Text

The Age of Innocence

by

[Edith Wharton]210-edith wharton

Book I

I.

On a January evening of the early seventies , [Christine Nilsson]211-christine nilsson was singing in Faust at [the Academy of Music in [New York]2-new york]1-the academy of music in new york .

Though there was already talk of the erection , in remote metropolitan distances " above the Forties , "[210-edith wharton] of [a new Opera House]494-a new opera house which should compete in costliness and splendour with those of [the great European capitals]495-the great european capitals , the world of fashion was still content to reassemble every winter in the shabby red and gold boxes of [the sociable old Academy]496-the sociable old academy . [Conservatives]212-conservatives cherished [it]497-it for being small and inconvenient , and thus keeping out [the " new people "[213-madame nilsson] whom [New York]2-new york was beginning to dread and yet be drawn to]498-the " new people " whom new york was beginning to dread and yet be drawn to ; and the sentimental clung to it for [its]497-it historic associations , and the musical for its excellent acoustics , always so problematic a quality in halls built for the hearing of music .

It was [Madame Nilsson]213-madame nilsson 's first appearance that winter , and what the daily press had already learned to describe as " [an exceptionally brilliant audience]3952-an exceptionally brilliant audience "[213-madame nilsson] had gathered to hear [her]213-madame nilsson , transported through [the slippery , snowy streets]499-the slippery , snowy streets in [private broughams]500-private broughams , in [the spacious family landau]501-the spacious family landau , or in the humbler but more convenient " Brown coupe . "[213-madame nilsson] To come to [the Opera]502-the opera in a Brown coupe was almost as honourable a way of arriving as in [[one]503-one 's own carriage]504-one 's own carriage ; and departure by the same means had the immense advantage of enabling [one]503-one ( with a playful allusion to democratic principles ) to scramble into the first Brown conveyance in the line , instead of waiting till the cold - and - gin congested nose of [[one]503-one 's own coachman]507-one 's own coachman gleamed under the portico of [the Academy]508-the academy . It was one of [the great livery - stableman]509-the great livery - stableman 's most masterly intuitions to have discovered that [Americans]214-americans want to get away from amusement even more quickly than [they]214-americans want to get to it .

When [Newland Archer]215-archer opened the door at the back of the club box the curtain had just gone up on [the garden scene]510-the garden scene . There was no reason why [the young man]511-the young man should not have come earlier , for [he]511-the young man had dined at seven , alone with [[his]511-the young man mother]512-his mother and [sister]513-sister , and had lingered afterward over a cigar in [the Gothic library]514-the gothic library with glazed black - walnut bookcases and finial - topped chairs which was [the only room in [the house]516-the house where [Mrs. Archer]215-archer allowed smoking]515-the only room in the house where mrs. archer allowed smoking . But , in the first place , [New York]2-new york was [a metropolis]517-a metropolis , and perfectly aware that in [metropolises]518-metropolises it was " not the thing "[511-the young man] to arrive early at the opera ; and what was or was not " the thing "[511-the young man] played a part as important in [[Newland]215-archer [Archer]215-archer]215-archer ['s [New York]2-new york]2-new york as the inscrutable totem terrors that had ruled the destinies of [[his]511-the young man forefathers]519-his forefathers thousands of years ago .

The second reason for [his]511-the young man delay was a personal one . [He]511-the young man had dawdled over [his]511-the young man cigar because [he]511-the young man was at heart [a dilettante]520-a dilettante , and thinking over a pleasure to come often gave [him]511-the young man a subtler satisfaction than its realisation . This was especially the case when the pleasure was a delicate one , as [his]511-the young man pleasures mostly were ; and on this occasion the moment [he]511-the young man looked forward to was so rare and exquisite in quality that -- well , if [he]511-the young man had timed [his]511-the young man arrival in accord with [the prima donna]521-the prima donna 's stage - manager [he]511-the young man could not have entered [the Academy]508-the academy at a more significant moment than just as [she]521-the prima donna was singing : " [He]511-the young man loves [me]521-the prima donna -- [he]511-the young man loves [me]521-the prima donna not -- [HE]511-the young man LOVES [ME!--]521-the prima donna "[521-the prima donna] and sprinkling the falling daisy petals with notes as clear as dew .

[She]521-the prima donna sang , of course , " M'ama ! "[521-the prima donna] and not " [he]511-the young man loves [me]521-the prima donna , "[521-the prima donna] since an unalterable and unquestioned law of the musical world required that the German text of French operas sung by [Swedish artists]523-swedish artists should be translated into Italian for the clearer understanding of [English - speaking audiences]524-english - speaking audiences . This seemed as natural to [Newland Archer]215-archer as all the other conventions on which [his]511-the young man life was moulded : such as the duty of using two silver - backed brushes with [his]511-the young man monogram in blue enamel to part [his]511-the young man hair , and of never appearing in society without a flower ( preferably a gardenia ) in [his]511-the young man buttonhole .

" [M'ama]216-m'ama ... non m'ama ... "[521-the prima donna] [the prima donna]521-the prima donna sang , and " M'ama ! "[521-the prima donna] , with a final burst of love triumphant , as [she]521-the prima donna pressed the dishevelled daisy to [her]521-the prima donna lips and lifted [her]521-the prima donna large eyes to the sophisticated countenance of [the little brown Faust - Capoul]526-the little brown faust - capoul , who was vainly trying , in a tight purple velvet doublet and plumed cap , to look as pure and true as [[his]526-the little brown faust - capoul artless victim]527-his artless victim .

[Newland Archer]215-archer , leaning against the wall at the back of the club box , turned [his]511-the young man eyes from [the stage]528-the stage and scanned the opposite side of [the house]516-the house . Directly facing [him]511-the young man was the box of [old Mrs. Manson Mingott]217-mrs. manson mingott , whose monstrous obesity had long since made it impossible for [her]217-mrs. manson mingott to attend the Opera , but who was always represented on fashionable nights by [some of [the younger members of [the family]532-the family]531-the younger members of the family]530-some of the younger members of the family . On this occasion , the front of the box was filled by [[her]217-mrs. manson mingott daughter - in - law]533-her daughter - in - law , [Mrs. Lovell Mingott]218-mrs. lovell mingott , and [[her]217-mrs. manson mingott daughter]534-her daughter , [Mrs. Welland]219-mrs. welland ; and slightly withdrawn behind [these brocaded matrons]535-these brocaded matrons sat [a young girl in white with eyes ecstatically fixed on [the stagelovers]537-the stagelovers]536-a young girl in white with eyes ecstatically fixed on the stagelovers . As [Madame Nilsson]213-madame nilsson 's " M'ama ! "[213-madame nilsson] thrilled out above [the silent house]538-the silent house ( the boxes always stopped talking during the Daisy Song ) a warm pink mounted to [the girl]539-the girl 's cheek , mantled [her]539-the girl brow to the roots of [her]539-the girl fair braids , and suffused the young slope of [her]539-the girl breast to the line where it met a modest tulle tucker fastened with a single gardenia . [She]539-the girl dropped [her]539-the girl eyes to the immense bouquet of lilies - of - the - valley on [her]539-the girl knee , and [Newland Archer]215-archer saw [her]539-the girl white - gloved finger - tips touch the flowers softly . [He]540-his drew a breath of satisfied vanity and [his]540-his eyes returned to [the stage]528-the stage .

No expense had been spared on the setting , which was acknowledged to be very beautiful even by [people who shared [his]540-his acquaintance with [the Opera houses of [Paris]7-paris and [Vienna]8-vienna]543-the opera houses of paris and vienna]542-people who shared his acquaintance with the opera houses of paris and vienna . The foreground , to the footlights , was covered with emerald green cloth . In the middle distance symmetrical mounds of woolly green moss bounded by croquet hoops formed the base of shrubs shaped like orange - trees but studded with large pink and red roses . Gigantic pansies , considerably larger than the roses , and closely resembling the floral pen - wipers made by [female parishioners for [fashionable clergymen]545-fashionable clergymen]544-female parishioners for fashionable clergymen , sprang from the moss beneath the rose - trees ; and here and there a daisy grafted on a rose - branch flowered with a luxuriance prophetic of [Mr. Luther Burbank]220-mr. luther burbank 's far - off prodigies .

In the centre of [this enchanted garden]546-this enchanted garden [Madame Nilsson]213-madame nilsson , in white cashmere slashed with pale blue satin , a reticule dangling from a blue girdle , and large yellow braids carefully disposed on each side of [her]213-madame nilsson muslin chemisette , listened with downcast eyes to [M. Capoul]221-m. capoul 's impassioned wooing , and affected a guileless incomprehension of [his]540-his designs whenever , by word or glance , [he]540-his persuasively indicated the ground floor window of [the neat brick villa]547-the neat brick villa projecting obliquely from the right wing .

" [The darling]3953-the darling ! "[215-archer] thought [Newland Archer]215-archer , [his]540-his glance flitting back to [the young girl with the lilies - of - [the - valley]549-the - valley]548-the young girl with the lilies - of - the - valley . " [She]548-the young girl with the lilies - of - the - valley does n't even guess what it 's all about . "[215-archer] And [he]540-his contemplated [her]548-the young girl with the lilies - of - the - valley absorbed young face with a thrill of possessorship in which pride in [his]540-his own masculine initiation was mingled with a tender reverence for [her]548-the young girl with the lilies - of - the - valley abysmal purity . " [We]3954-we 'll read [Faust]222-faust together ... by [the Italian lakes]3955-the italian lakes ... "[540-his] [he]540-his thought , somewhat hazily confusing the scene of [his]540-his projected honey - moon with the masterpieces of literature which it would be [his]540-his manly privilege to reveal to [[his]540-his bride]550-his bride . It was only that afternoon that [May Welland]219-mrs. welland had let [him]540-his guess that [she]548-the young girl with the lilies - of - the - valley " cared "[548-the young girl with the lilies - of - the - valley] ( [New York]2-new york 's consecrated phrase of [maiden avowal]551-maiden avowal ) , and already [his]540-his imagination , leaping ahead of the engagement ring , the betrothal kiss and the march from [Lohengrin]223-lohengrin , pictured [her]548-the young girl with the lilies - of - the - valley at [his]540-his side in some scene of old European witchery .

[He]540-his did not in the least wish the future [Mrs. Newland Archer]215-archer to be [a simpleton]552-a simpleton . [He]540-his meant [her]548-the young girl with the lilies - of - the - valley ( thanks to [his]540-his enlightening companionship ) to develop a social tact and readiness of wit enabling [her]548-the young girl with the lilies - of - the - valley to hold [her]548-the young girl with the lilies - of - the - valley own with [the most popular married women of [the " younger set]3957-the " younger set]3956-the most popular married women of the " younger set , "[3957-the " younger set] in which it was the recognised custom to attract masculine homage while playfully discouraging it . If [he]540-his had probed to the bottom of [his]540-his vanity ( as [he]540-his sometimes nearly did ) [he]540-his would have found there the wish that [[his]540-his wife]553-his wife should be as worldly - wise and as eager to please as [the married lady whose charms had held [his]540-his fancy through two mildly agitated years]554-the married lady whose charms had held his fancy through two mildly agitated years ; without , of course , any hint of the frailty which had so nearly marred [that unhappy being]555-that unhappy being 's life , and had disarranged [his]540-his own plans for a whole winter .

How this miracle of fire and ice was to be created , and to sustain itself in [a harsh world]556-a harsh world , [he]540-his had never taken the time to think out ; but [he]540-his was content to hold [his]540-his view without analysing it , since [he]540-his knew it was that of [all the carefully - brushed , white - waistcoated , button - hole - flowered gentlemen who succeeded [each other]558-each other in the club box]557-all the carefully - brushed , white - waistcoated , button - hole - flowered gentlemen who succeeded each other in the club box , exchanged friendly greetings with [him]540-his , and turned [their]557-all the carefully - brushed , white - waistcoated , button - hole - flowered gentlemen who succeeded each other in the club box opera - glasses critically on [the circle of [ladies who were the product of the system]560-ladies who were the product of the system]559-the circle of ladies who were the product of the system . In matters intellectual and artistic [Newland]215-archer [Archer]215-archer felt [himself]215-archer distinctly the superior of these chosen specimens of old [New York]2-new york gentility ; [he]540-his had probably read more , thought more , and even seen a good deal more of [the world]561-the world , than [any other man of the number]562-any other man of the number . Singly [they]563-they betrayed [their]563-they inferiority ; but grouped together [they]563-they represented " [New York]2-new york , "[563-they] and the habit of masculine solidarity made [him]540-his accept [their]563-they doctrine on all the issues called moral . [He]540-his instinctively felt that in this respect it would be troublesome -- and also rather bad form -- to strike out for [himself]540-his .

" Well -- upon [my]224-lawrence lefferts soul ! "[224-lawrence lefferts] exclaimed [Lawrence Lefferts]224-lawrence lefferts , turning [his]224-lawrence lefferts opera - glass abruptly away from the stage . [Lawrence Lefferts]224-lawrence lefferts was , on the whole , [the foremost authority on " form "[224-lawrence lefferts] in [New York]2-new york]564-the foremost authority on " form " in new york . [He]224-lawrence lefferts had probably devoted more time than [any one else]565-any one else to the study of this intricate and fascinating question ; but study alone could not account for [his]224-lawrence lefferts complete and easy competence . [One]503-one had only to look at [him]224-lawrence lefferts , from the slant of [his]224-lawrence lefferts bald forehead and the curve of [his]224-lawrence lefferts beautiful fair moustache to the long patent - leather feet at the other end of [[his]224-lawrence lefferts lean and elegant person]567-his lean and elegant person , to feel that the knowledge of " form "[569-a young admirer] must be congenital in [any one who knew how to wear such good clothes so carelessly and carry such height with so much lounging grace]568-any one who knew how to wear such good clothes so carelessly and carry such height with so much lounging grace . As [a young admirer]569-a young admirer had once said of [him]224-lawrence lefferts : " If [anybody]3958-anybody can tell [a fellow just when to wear a black tie with evening clothes and when not to]3959-a fellow just when to wear a black tie with evening clothes and when not to , it 's [Larry Lefferts]224-lawrence lefferts . "[569-a young admirer] And on the question of pumps versus patent - leather " Oxfords "[569-a young admirer] [his]224-lawrence lefferts authority had never been disputed .

" [[My]224-lawrence lefferts God]3960-my god ! "[224-lawrence lefferts] [he]224-lawrence lefferts said ; and silently handed [his]224-lawrence lefferts glass to [old Sillerton Jackson]225-mr. jackson .

[Newland Archer]215-archer , following [Lefferts]224-lawrence lefferts 's glance , saw with surprise that [his]224-lawrence lefferts exclamation had been occasioned by the entry of [a new figure into [[old Mrs. Mingott]217-mrs. manson mingott 's box]571-old mrs. mingott 's box]570-a new figure into old mrs. mingott 's box . It was that of [a slim young woman , a little less tall than [May Welland]226-may , with brown hair growing in close curls about [her]572-a slim young woman , a little less tall than may welland , with brown hair growing in close curls about her temples and held in place by a narrow band of diamonds temples and held in place by a narrow band of diamonds]572-a slim young woman , a little less tall than may welland , with brown hair growing in close curls about her temples and held in place by a narrow band of diamonds . The suggestion of this headdress , which gave [her]572-a slim young woman , a little less tall than may welland , with brown hair growing in close curls about her temples and held in place by a narrow band of diamonds what was then called a " Josephine look , "[572-a slim young woman , a little less tall than may welland , with brown hair growing in close curls about her temples and held in place by a narrow band of diamonds] was carried out in the cut of the dark blue velvet gown rather theatrically caught up under [her]572-a slim young woman , a little less tall than may welland , with brown hair growing in close curls about her temples and held in place by a narrow band of diamonds bosom by a girdle with a large old - fashioned clasp . [The wearer of this unusual dress]573-the wearer of this unusual dress , who seemed quite unconscious of the attention it was attracting , stood a moment in the centre of the box , discussing with [Mrs. Welland]219-mrs. welland the propriety of taking [the latter]574-the latter 's place in the front right - hand corner ; then [she]572-a slim young woman , a little less tall than may welland , with brown hair growing in close curls about her temples and held in place by a narrow band of diamonds yielded with a slight smile , and seated [herself]572-a slim young woman , a little less tall than may welland , with brown hair growing in close curls about her temples and held in place by a narrow band of diamonds in line with [[Mrs. Welland]219-mrs. welland 's sister - in - law]575-mrs. welland 's sister - in - law , [Mrs. Lovell Mingott]218-mrs. lovell mingott , who was installed in the opposite corner .

[Mr. Sillerton Jackson]225-mr. jackson had returned the opera - glass to [Lawrence Lefferts]224-lawrence lefferts . [The whole of the club]576-the whole of the club turned instinctively , waiting to hear what [the old man]577-the old man had to say ; for [old Mr. Jackson]225-mr. jackson was as great an authority on " [family]3961-family "[225-mr. jackson] as [Lawrence Lefferts]224-lawrence lefferts was on " form . "[225-mr. jackson] [He]225-mr. jackson knew all the ramifications of [[New York]2-new york 's cousinships]578-new york 's cousinships ; and could not only elucidate such complicated questions as that of the connection between [the Mingotts]227-the mingotts ( through [the Thorleys]228-the thorleys ) with [the Dallases of [South Carolina]9-south carolina]579-the dallases of south carolina , and that of the relationship of [the elder branch of [Philadelphia Thorleys]10-philadelphia thorleys]580-the elder branch of philadelphia thorleys to the [Albany]11-albany Chiverses ( on no account to be confused with [the Manson Chiverses of [University Place]13-university place]12-the manson chiverses of university place ) , but could also enumerate the leading characteristics of [each family]581-each family : as , for instance , the fabulous stinginess of [the younger lines of [Leffertses]283-the lawrence leffertses]582-the younger lines of leffertses ( [the Long Island ones]583-the long island ones ) ; or the fatal tendency of [the Rushworths]229-the rushworths to make foolish matches ; or the insanity recurring in [every second generation of the Albany Chiverses , with whom [[their]584-every second generation of the albany chiverses , with whom their new york cousins [New York]2-new york cousins]585-their new york cousins]584-every second generation of the albany chiverses , with whom their new york cousins had always refused to intermarry -- with the disastrous exception of [poor Medora Manson]230-medora manson , who , as [everybody]586-everybody knew ... but then [[her]230-medora manson mother]587-her mother was [a Rushworth]588-a rushworth .

In addition to this forest of family trees , [Mr. Sillerton Jackson]225-mr. jackson carried between [his]225-mr. jackson narrow hollow temples , and under [his]225-mr. jackson soft thatch of silver hair , a register of most of the scandals and mysteries that had smouldered under the unruffled surface of [New York]2-new york society within the last fifty years . So far indeed did [his]225-mr. jackson information extend , and so acutely retentive was [his]225-mr. jackson memory , that [he]225-mr. jackson was supposed to be [the only man who could have told [you]590-you who [Julius Beaufort]231-beaufort , [the banker]591-the banker , really was , and what had become of [handsome Bob Spicer]232-handsome bob spicer , [old [Mrs. Manson Mingott]217-mrs. manson mingott 's father]592-old mrs. manson mingott 's father , who had disappeared so mysteriously ( with a large sum of trust money ) less than a year after [his]592-old mrs. manson mingott 's father marriage , on the very day that a beautiful Spanish dancer who had been delighting thronged audiences in [the old Opera - house on [the Battery]15-the battery]593-the old opera - house on the battery]589-the only man who could have told you who julius beaufort , the banker , really was , and what had become of handsome bob spicer , old mrs. manson mingott 's father , who had disappeared so mysteriously ( with a large sum of trust money ) less than a year after his marriage , on the very day that a beautiful spanish dancer who had been delighting thronged audiences in the old opera - house on the battery had taken ship for [Cuba]16-cuba . But these mysteries , and many others , were closely locked in [Mr. Jackson]225-mr. jackson 's breast ; for not only did [his]225-mr. jackson keen sense of honour forbid [his]225-mr. jackson repeating anything privately imparted , but [he]225-mr. jackson was fully aware that [his]225-mr. jackson reputation for discretion increased [his]225-mr. jackson opportunities of finding out what [he]225-mr. jackson wanted to know .

[The club box]594-the club box , therefore , waited in visible suspense while [Mr. Sillerton Jackson]225-mr. jackson handed back [Lawrence Lefferts]224-lawrence lefferts 's opera - glass . For a moment [he]225-mr. jackson silently scrutinised [the attentive group]595-the attentive group out of [his]225-mr. jackson filmy blue eyes overhung by old veined lids ; then [he]225-mr. jackson gave [his]225-mr. jackson moustache a thoughtful twist , and said simply : " [I]225-mr. jackson did n't think [the Mingotts]227-the mingotts would have tried it on . "[225-mr. jackson]

II .

[Newland Archer]215-archer , during this brief episode , had been thrown into a strange state of embarrassment .

It was annoying that the box which was thus attracting the undivided attention of masculine [New York]2-new york should be that in which [[his]225-mr. jackson betrothed]596-his betrothed was seated between [[her]596-his betrothed mother]587-her mother and [aunt]598-aunt ; and for a moment [he]225-mr. jackson could not identify [the lady in the Empire dress]599-the lady in the empire dress , nor imagine why [her]599-the lady in the empire dress presence created such excitement among [the initiated]600-the initiated . Then light dawned on [him]225-mr. jackson , and with it came a momentary rush of indignation . No , indeed ; [no one]601-no one would have thought [the Mingotts]227-the mingotts would have tried it on !

But [they]602-they had ; [they]602-they undoubtedly had ; for the low - toned comments behind [him]225-mr. jackson left no doubt in [Archer]215-archer 's mind that [the young woman]603-the young woman was [[May Welland]226-may 's cousin]604-may welland 's cousin , [the cousin]605-the cousin always referred to in [the family]532-the family as " poor [Ellen Olenska]233-ellen . "[605-the cousin] [Archer]215-archer knew that [she]603-the young woman had suddenly arrived from [Europe]17-europe a day or two previously ; [he]225-mr. jackson had even heard from [Miss Welland]234-miss welland ( not disapprovingly ) that [she]603-the young woman had been to see [poor Ellen]233-ellen , who was staying with [old Mrs. Mingott]217-mrs. manson mingott . [Archer]215-archer entirely approved of [family]3961-family solidarity , and one of the qualities [he]225-mr. jackson most admired in [the Mingotts]227-the mingotts was [their]608-their resolute championship of the few black sheep that [their]608-their blameless stock had produced . There was nothing mean or ungenerous in [the young man]511-the young man 's heart , and [he]225-mr. jackson was glad that [[his]225-mr. jackson future wife]610-his future wife should not be restrained by false prudery from being kind ( in private ) to [[her]610-his future wife unhappy cousin]611-her unhappy cousin ; but to receive [Countess Olenska]235-the countess olenska in [the family circle]612-the family circle was a different thing from producing [her]235-the countess olenska in public , at the Opera of all places , and in the very box with [the young girl whose engagement to [him]225-mr. jackson , [Newland Archer]215-archer]613-the young girl whose engagement to him , newland archer , was to be announced within a few weeks . No , [he]225-mr. jackson felt as [old Sillerton Jackson]225-mr. jackson felt ; [he]225-mr. jackson did not think [the Mingotts]614-the mingotts would have tried it on !

[He]225-mr. jackson knew , of course , that [whatever man]615-whatever man dared ( within [Fifth Avenue]18-fifth avenue 's limits ) that [old Mrs. Manson Mingott]217-mrs. manson mingott , [the Matriarch of the line]616-the matriarch of the line , would dare . [Newland Archer]215-archer , as [he]227-the mingotts mused on these things , had once more turned [his]227-the mingotts eyes toward the [Mingott]217-mrs. manson mingott box . [He]227-the mingotts saw that [Mrs. Welland]219-mrs. welland and [[her]617-the high and mighty old lady , who , in spite of having been only catherine spicer of staten island , with a father mysteriously discredited , and neither money nor position enough to make people forget it , had allied herself with the head of the wealthy mingott line sister - in - law]650-her sister - in - law were facing [[their]651-their semicircle of [critics]653-critics]652-their semicircle of critics with the Mingottian APLOMB which [old Catherine]237-old catherine had inculcated in all [[her]617-the high and mighty old lady , who , in spite of having been only catherine spicer of staten island , with a father mysteriously discredited , and neither money nor position enough to make people forget it , had allied herself with the head of the wealthy mingott line tribe]654-her tribe , and that only [May Welland]226-may betrayed , by a heightened colour ( perhaps due to the knowledge that [he]227-the mingotts was watching [her]226-may ) a sense of the gravity of the situation . As for the cause of the commotion , [she]226-may sat gracefully in [her]226-may corner of the box , [her]226-may eyes fixed on the stage , and revealing , as [she]226-may leaned forward , a little more shoulder and bosom than [New York]2-new york was accustomed to seeing , at least in [ladies who had reasons for wishing to pass unnoticed]655-ladies who had reasons for wishing to pass unnoticed .

Few things seemed to [Newland]215-archer Archer more awful than an offence against " Taste , "[226-may] [that far - off divinity of whom " Form "[656-that far - off divinity of whom " form " was the mere visible representative and vicegerent] was [the mere visible representative and vicegerent]657-the mere visible representative and vicegerent]656-that far - off divinity of whom " form " was the mere visible representative and vicegerent . " After all , "[659-the younger men] [he]227-the mingotts heard one of [the younger men]659-the younger men begin behind [him]227-the mingotts ( [everybody]586-everybody talked through the Mephistopheles - and - [Martha]242-martha scenes ) , " after all , just WHAT happened ? The act was ending , and there was a general stir in the box . [Suddenly Newland Archer]215-archer felt [himself]215-archer impelled to decisive action . The desire to be [the first man]670-the first man to enter [[Mrs. Mingott]218-mrs. lovell mingott 's box]671-mrs. mingott 's box , to proclaim to the waiting world [his]670-the first man engagement to [May Welland]226-may , and to see [her]226-may through whatever difficulties [[her]226-may cousin]672-her cousin 's anomalous situation might involve [her]226-may in ; this impulse had abruptly overruled all scruples and hesitations , and sent [him]670-the first man hurrying through [the red corridors]673-the red corridors to [the farther side of [the house]516-the house]674-the farther side of the house .

[The persons of [their]676-the persons of their world world]676-the persons of their world lived in an atmosphere of faint implications and pale delicacies , and the fact that [he]670-the first man and [she]234-miss welland understood [each other]558-each other without a word seemed to [the young man]511-the young man to bring [them]676-the persons of their world nearer than any explanation would have done . "[670-the first man]

" [You]219-mrs. welland know [[my]219-mrs. welland niece]3975-my niece [Countess Olenska]235-the countess olenska ? "[670-the first man]

[Miss Welland]234-miss welland 's face grew rosy as the dawn , and [she]234-miss welland looked at [him]670-the first man with radiant eyes . " If [you]670-the first man can persuade [Mamma]245-mamma , "[234-miss welland] [she]234-miss welland said ; " but why should [we]3976-we change what is already settled ? [She]234-miss welland made way for [him]670-the first man by pushing back [her]234-miss welland chair , and promptly , and a little ostentatiously , with the desire that [the whole house]683-the whole house should see what [he]670-the first man was doing , [Archer]215-archer seated [himself]215-archer at the [Countess Olenska]235-the countess olenska 's side .

" [We]3980-we DID use to play together , did n't [we]3980-we ? "[234-miss welland] [she]234-miss welland asked , turning [her]234-miss welland grave eyes to [his]670-the first man . "[234-miss welland] [Her]234-miss welland glance swept the horse - shoe curve of boxes . " Ah , how this brings it all back to [me]234-miss welland -- [I]234-miss welland see [everybody here]3983-everybody here in knickerbockers and pantalettes , "[234-miss welland] [she]234-miss welland said , with [her]234-miss welland trailing slightly foreign accent , [her]234-miss welland eyes returning to [his]670-the first man face .

Agreeable as [their]684-their expression was , [the young man]511-the young man was shocked that [they]684-their should reflect so unseemly a picture of the august tribunal before which , at that very moment , [her]234-miss welland case was being tried . Nothing could be in worse taste than misplaced flippancy ; and [he]511-the young man answered somewhat stiffly : " Yes , [you]234-miss welland have been away a very long time . "[511-the young man]

" Oh , centuries and centuries ; so long , "[234-miss welland] [she]234-miss welland said , " that [I]234-miss welland 'm sure [I]234-miss welland 'm dead and buried , and [this dear old place]3984-this dear old place is [heaven]3985-heaven ; "[234-miss welland] which , for reasons [he]511-the young man could not define , struck [Newland Archer]215-archer as an even more disrespectful way of describing [New York]2-new york society .

III .

It invariably happened in the same way .

[Mrs. Julius Beaufort]231-beaufort , on the night of [her]231-beaufort annual ball , never failed to appear at [the Opera]502-the opera ; indeed , [she]231-beaufort always gave [her]231-beaufort ball on an Opera night in order to emphasise [her]231-beaufort complete superiority to household cares , and [her]231-beaufort possession of [a staff of [servants]688-servants competent to organise every detail of the entertainment in [her]231-beaufort absence]687-a staff of servants competent to organise every detail of the entertainment in her absence .

[[The Beauforts]247-the beauforts ' house]689-the beauforts ' house was one of [the few in [New York]2-new york]690-the few in new york that possessed [a ball - room]691-a ball - room ( [it]689-the beauforts ' house antedated even [Mrs. Manson Mingott]217-mrs. manson mingott 's and [the Headly Chiverses]248-the headly chiverses ' ) ; and at a time when it was beginning to be thought " provincial "[247-the beauforts] to put a " crash "[247-the beauforts] over the drawing - room floor and move the furniture [upstairs]692-upstairs , the possession of [a ball - room that was used for no other purpose , and left for three - hundred - and - sixty - four days of the year to shuttered darkness , with [its]689-the beauforts ' house gilt chairs stacked in a corner and [its]689-the beauforts ' house chandelier in a bag]693-a ball - room that was used for no other purpose , and left for three - hundred - and - sixty - four days of the year to shuttered darkness , with its gilt chairs stacked in a corner and its chandelier in a bag ; this undoubted superiority was felt to compensate for whatever was regrettable in the [Beaufort]231-beaufort past .

[Mrs. Archer]215-archer , who was fond of coining [her]215-archer social philosophy into axioms , had once said : " [We]3986-we all have [[our]3986-we pet common people--]3987-our pet common people-- "[215-archer] and though the phrase was a daring one , its truth was secretly admitted in many an exclusive bosom . But [the Beauforts]247-the beauforts were not exactly common ; [some people]694-some people said [they]694-some people were even worse . [Mrs. Beaufort]231-beaufort belonged indeed to [one of [[America]28-america 's most honoured families]696-america 's most honoured families]695-one of america 's most honoured families ; [she]231-beaufort had been the lovely [Regina Dallas]249-regina ( of [the South Carolina branch]697-the south carolina branch ) , [a penniless beauty introduced to [New York]2-new york society]698-a penniless beauty introduced to new york society by [[her]231-beaufort cousin]672-her cousin , [the imprudent [Medora Manson]230-medora manson , who was always doing the wrong thing from the right motive]230-medora manson . When [one]503-one was related to [the Mansons]250-the mansons and [the Rushworths]229-the rushworths [one]503-one had a " droit de cite "[503-one] ( as [Mr. Sillerton Jackson]225-mr. jackson , who had frequented [the Tuileries]29-the tuileries , called it ) in [New York]2-new york society ; but did [one]503-one not forfeit it in marrying [Julius Beaufort]231-beaufort ?

The question was : who was [Beaufort]231-beaufort ? [He]702-his passed for [an Englishman]703-an englishman , was agreeable , handsome , ill - tempered , hospitable and witty . [He]702-his had come to [America]28-america with letters of recommendation from [[old Mrs. Manson Mingott]217-mrs. manson mingott 's English son - in - law]704-old mrs. manson mingott 's english son - in - law , [the banker]591-the banker , and had speedily made [himself]702-his an important position in the world of affairs ; but [his]702-his habits were dissipated , [his]702-his tongue was bitter , [his]702-his antecedents were mysterious ; and when [Medora Manson]230-medora manson announced [[her]230-medora manson cousin]672-her cousin 's engagement to [him]702-his it was felt to be one more act of folly in poor [Medora]230-medora manson 's long record of imprudences .

But folly is as often justified of [[her]230-medora manson children]707-her children as wisdom , and two years after [young Mrs. Beaufort]231-beaufort 's marriage it was admitted that [she]230-medora manson had [the most distinguished house in [New York]2-new york]708-the most distinguished house in new york . [No one]601-no one knew exactly how the miracle was accomplished . [She]230-medora manson was indolent , passive , the caustic even called [her]230-medora manson dull ; but dressed like [an idol]710-an idol , hung with pearls , growing younger and blonder and more beautiful each year , [she]230-medora manson throned in [[Mr. Beaufort]251-beaufort 's heavy brown - stone palace]711-mr. beaufort 's heavy brown - stone palace , and drew all [the world]561-the world [there]713-there without lifting [her]230-medora manson jewelled little finger . [The knowing people]714-the knowing people said it was [Beaufort]251-beaufort [himself]251-beaufort who trained [the servants]715-the servants , taught [the chef]716-the chef new dishes , told [the gardeners]717-the gardeners what hot - house flowers to grow for the dinner - table and [the drawing - rooms]718-the drawing - rooms , selected [the guests]719-the guests , brewed the after - dinner punch and dictated the little notes [[his]251-beaufort wife]553-his wife wrote to [[her]553-his wife friends]721-her friends . If [he]251-beaufort did , these domestic activities were privately performed , and [he]251-beaufort presented to [the world]561-the world the appearance of [a careless and hospitable millionaire strolling into [[his]251-beaufort own drawing - room]724-his own drawing - room]723-a careless and hospitable millionaire strolling into his own drawing - room with the detachment of [an invited guest]725-an invited guest , and saying : " [[My]251-beaufort wife]3988-my wife 's gloxinias are a marvel , are n't [they]3989-they ? [I]251-beaufort believe [she]3988-my wife gets them out from [Kew]30-kew . "[251-beaufort]

[Mr. Beaufort]251-beaufort 's secret , [people]619-people were agreed , was the way [he]251-beaufort carried things off . It was all very well to whisper that [he]251-beaufort had been " helped "[251-beaufort] to leave [England]31-england by [the international banking - house in which [he]251-beaufort had been employed]727-the international banking - house in which he had been employed ; [he]251-beaufort carried off that rumour as easily as the rest -- though [New York]2-new york 's business conscience was no less sensitive than its moral standard -- [he]251-beaufort carried everything before [him]251-beaufort , and all [New York]2-new york into [[his]251-beaufort drawing - rooms]728-his drawing - rooms , and for over twenty years now [people]619-people had said [they]619-people were " going to [the Beauforts]247-the beauforts ' "[619-people] with the same tone of security as if [they]619-people had said [they]619-people were going to [Mrs. Manson Mingott]217-mrs. manson mingott 's , and with the added satisfaction of knowing [they]619-people would get hot canvas - back ducks and vintage wines , instead of tepid Veuve Clicquot without a year and warmed - up croquettes from [Philadelphia]32-philadelphia .

[Mrs. Beaufort]231-beaufort , then , had as usual appeared in [her]231-beaufort box just before the Jewel Song ; and when , again as usual , [she]231-beaufort rose at the end of the third act , drew [her]231-beaufort opera cloak about [her]231-beaufort lovely shoulders , and disappeared , [New York]2-new york knew that meant that half an hour later the ball would begin .

[The Beaufort house]730-the beaufort house was one that [New Yorkers]731-new yorkers were proud to show to [foreigners]732-foreigners , especially on the night of the annual ball . [The Beauforts]247-the beauforts had been among [the first people in [New York]2-new york]733-the first people in new york to own [their]247-the beauforts own red velvet carpet and have it rolled down the steps by [[their]247-the beauforts own footmen]734-their own footmen , under [their]247-the beauforts own awning , instead of hiring it with the supper and the ball - room chairs . [They]619-people had also inaugurated the custom of letting [the ladies]735-the ladies take [their]735-the ladies cloaks off in [the hall]736-the hall , instead of shuffling up to [[the hostess]737-the hostess 's bedroom]738-the hostess 's bedroom and recurling [their]735-the ladies hair with the aid of the gas - burner ; [Beaufort]231-beaufort was understood to have said that [he]739-he supposed all [[his]739-he wife 's friends]740-his wife 's friends had [maids who saw to it that [they]741-maids who saw to it that they were properly coiffees when they left home were properly coiffees when [they]741-maids who saw to it that they were properly coiffees when they left home left [home]631-home]741-maids who saw to it that they were properly coiffees when they left home .

Then [the house]516-the house had been boldly planned with [a ball - room]691-a ball - room , so that , instead of squeezing through [a narrow passage]745-a narrow passage to get to [it]691-a ball - room ( as at [the Chiverses]248-the headly chiverses ' ) one marched solemnly down a vista of [enfiladed drawing - rooms]746-enfiladed drawing - rooms ( the sea - green , the crimson and the bouton d'or ) , seeing from afar the many - candled lustres reflected in the polished parquetry , and beyond that the depths of [a conservatory where camellias and tree - ferns arched their costly foliage over seats of black and gold bamboo]747-a conservatory where camellias and tree - ferns arched their costly foliage over seats of black and gold bamboo .

[Newland Archer]215-archer , as became [a young man of [his]748-a young man of his position position]748-a young man of his position , strolled in somewhat late . [He]748-a young man of his position had left [his]748-a young man of his position overcoat with [the silk - stockinged footmen]749-the silk - stockinged footmen ( the stockings were one of [Beaufort]231-beaufort 's few fatuities ) , had dawdled a while in [the library]750-the library hung with Spanish leather and furnished with [Buhl]252-buhl and malachite , where [a few men]751-a few men were chatting and putting on [their]751-a few men dancing - gloves , and had finally joined the line of [guests whom [Mrs. Beaufort]231-beaufort was receiving on the threshold of [the crimson drawing - room]753-the crimson drawing - room]752-guests whom mrs. beaufort was receiving on the threshold of the crimson drawing - room .

[Archer]215-archer was distinctly nervous . [He]748-a young man of his position had not gone back to [[his]748-a young man of his position club]754-his club after the Opera ( as [the young bloods]755-the young bloods usually did ) , but , the night being fine , had walked for some distance up [Fifth Avenue]18-fifth avenue before turning back in the direction of [[the Beauforts]247-the beauforts ' house]689-the beauforts ' house . [He]748-a young man of his position was definitely afraid that [the Mingotts]227-the mingotts might be going too far ; that , in fact , [they]757-they might have [Granny Mingott]244-granny 's orders to bring [the Countess Olenska]235-the countess olenska to the ball .

From the tone of the club box [he]748-a young man of his position had perceived how grave a mistake that would be ; and , though [he]748-a young man of his position was more than ever determined to " see the thing through , "[748-a young man of his position] [he]748-a young man of his position felt less chivalrously eager to champion [[his]748-a young man of his position betrothed 's cousin]758-his betrothed 's cousin than before [their]759-their brief talk at [the Opera]502-the opera .

Wandering on to [the bouton d'or drawing - room]761-the bouton d'or drawing - room ( where [Beaufort]231-beaufort had had the audacity to hang " [Love Victorious]253-love victorious , "[758-his betrothed 's cousin] the much - discussed nude of [Bouguereau]254-bouguereau ) [Archer]215-archer found [Mrs. Welland]219-mrs. welland and [[her]219-mrs. welland daughter]534-her daughter standing near the ball - room door . [Couples]763-couples were already gliding over the floor beyond : the light of the wax candles fell on revolving tulle skirts , on girlish heads wreathed with modest blossoms , on the dashing aigrettes and ornaments of [the young married women]764-the young married women 's coiffures , and on the glitter of highly glazed shirt - fronts and fresh glace gloves .

[Miss Welland]234-miss welland , evidently about to join [the dancers]765-the dancers , hung on the threshold , [her]234-miss welland lilies - of - [the - valley]549-the - valley in [her]234-miss welland hand ( [she]234-miss welland carried no other bouquet ) , [her]234-miss welland face a little pale , [her]234-miss welland eyes burning with a candid excitement . [A group of young men]767-a group of young men and [girls]768-girls were gathered about [her]234-miss welland , and there was much hand - clasping , laughing and pleasantry on which [Mrs. Welland]219-mrs. welland , standing slightly apart , shed the beam of a qualified approval . It was evident that [Miss Welland]234-miss welland was in the act of announcing [her]234-miss welland engagement , while [[her]534-her daughter mother]587-her mother affected the air of parental reluctance considered suitable to the occasion .

[Archer]215-archer paused a moment . It was at [his]770-he express wish that the announcement had been made , and yet it was not thus that [he]770-he would have wished to have [his]770-he happiness known . To proclaim it in the heat and noise of [a crowded ball - room]771-a crowded ball - room was to rob [it]771-a crowded ball - room of the fine bloom of privacy which should belong to things nearest the heart . [His]770-he joy was so deep that this blurring of the surface left its essence untouched ; but [he]770-he would have liked to keep the surface pure too . It was something of a satisfaction to find that [May Welland]234-miss welland shared this feeling . [Her]234-miss welland eyes fled to [his]770-he beseechingly , and [their]772-their look said : " Remember , [we]772-their 're doing this because it 's right . "[772-their]

No appeal could have found a more immediate response in [Archer]215-archer 's breast ; but [he]770-he wished that the necessity of [their]772-their action had been represented by some ideal reason , and not simply by poor [Ellen Olenska]233-ellen . [The group about [Miss Welland]234-miss welland]773-the group about miss welland made way for [him]770-he with significant smiles , and after taking [his]770-he share of the felicitations [he]770-he drew [[his]770-he betrothed]596-his betrothed into the middle of [the ball - room floor]775-the ball - room floor and put [his]770-he arm about [her]596-his betrothed waist .

" Now [we]3990-we sha n't have to talk , "[770-he] [he]770-he said , smiling into [her]596-his betrothed candid eyes , as they floated away on the soft waves of [the Blue Danube]33-the blue danube .

[She]596-his betrothed made no answer . [Her]596-his betrothed lips trembled into a smile , but the eyes remained distant and serious , as if bent on some ineffable vision . " [Dear]3991-dear , "[215-archer] [Archer]215-archer whispered , pressing [her]596-his betrothed to [him]770-he : it was borne in on [him]770-he that the first hours of being engaged , even if spent in [a ball - room]691-a ball - room , had in [them]777-them something grave and sacramental . What a new life it was going to be , with this whiteness , radiance , goodness at one 's side !

The dance over , [the two]778-the two , as became [an affianced couple]779-an affianced couple , wandered into [the conservatory]780-the conservatory ; and sitting behind a tall screen of tree - ferns and camellias [Newland]215-archer pressed [her]596-his betrothed gloved hand to [his]770-he lips .

" [You]215-archer see [I]596-his betrothed did as [you]770-he asked [me]596-his betrothed to , "[596-his betrothed] [she]596-his betrothed said .

" Yes : [I]770-he could n't wait , "[770-he] [he]770-he answered smiling . After a moment [he]770-he added : " Only [I]770-he wish it had n't had to be at a ball . "[770-he]

" Yes , [I]596-his betrothed know . "[596-his betrothed] [She]596-his betrothed met [his]770-he glance comprehendingly . " But after all -- even here [we]3992-we 're alone together , are n't [we]3992-we ? "[596-his betrothed]

" Oh , dearest -- always ! "[215-archer] [Archer]215-archer cried .

Evidently [she]596-his betrothed was always going to understand ; [she]596-his betrothed was always going to say the right thing . The discovery made the cup of [his]770-he bliss overflow , and [he]770-he went on gaily : " The worst of it is that [I]770-he want to kiss [you]596-his betrothed and [I]770-he ca n't . "[770-he] As [he]770-he spoke [he]770-he took a swift glance about [the conservatory]780-the conservatory , assured [himself]770-he of [their]782-their momentary privacy , and catching [her]596-his betrothed to [him]770-he laid a fugitive pressure on [her]596-his betrothed lips . To counteract the audacity of this proceeding [he]770-he led [her]596-his betrothed to a bamboo sofa in [a less secluded part of [the conservatory]780-the conservatory]783-a less secluded part of the conservatory , and sitting down beside [her]596-his betrothed broke a lily - of - the - valley from [her]596-his betrothed bouquet . [She]596-his betrothed sat silent , and [the world]561-the world lay like [a sunlit valley]786-a sunlit valley at [their]782-their feet .

" Did [you]770-he tell [[my]596-his betrothed cousin]3978-my cousin [Ellen]233-ellen ? "[596-his betrothed] [she]596-his betrothed asked presently , as if [she]596-his betrothed spoke through a dream .

[He]770-he roused [himself]770-he , and remembered that [he]770-he had not done so . Some invincible repugnance to speak of such things to [the strange foreign woman]787-the strange foreign woman had checked the words on [his]770-he lips .

" No -- [I]770-he had n't the chance after all , "[770-he] [he]770-he said , fibbing hastily .

" Ah . "[596-his betrothed] [She]596-his betrothed looked disappointed , but gently resolved on gaining [her]596-his betrothed point . " [You]770-he must , then , for [I]596-his betrothed did n't either ; and [I]596-his betrothed should n't like [her]3978-my cousin to think-- "[596-his betrothed]

" Of course not . But are n't [you]770-he , after all , [the person to do it]3994-the person to do it ? "[787-the strange foreign woman]

[She]596-his betrothed pondered on this . " If [I]596-his betrothed 'd done it at the right time , yes : but now that there 's been a delay [I]596-his betrothed think [you]770-he must explain that [I]596-his betrothed 'd asked [you]770-he to tell [her]3978-my cousin at [the Opera]502-the opera , before [our]3996-our speaking about it to [everybody here]3983-everybody here . [You]770-he see , [she]3978-my cousin 's [one of [the family]532-the family]3998-one of the family , and [she]3978-my cousin 's been away so long that [she]3978-my cousin 's rather -- sensitive . "[596-his betrothed]

[Archer]215-archer looked at [her]596-his betrothed glowingly . " [Dear and great angel]4000-dear and great angel ! Of course [I]215-archer 'll tell [her]3978-my cousin . "[215-archer] [He]788-he glanced a trifle apprehensively toward [the crowded ball - room]789-the crowded ball - room . " But [I]788-he have n't seen [her]3978-my cousin yet . Has [she]3978-my cousin come ? "[788-he]

" No ; at the last minute [she]3978-my cousin decided not to . "[215-archer]

" At the last minute ? "[788-he] [he]788-he echoed , betraying [his]788-he surprise that [she]596-his betrothed should ever have considered the alternative possible .

" Yes . [She]3978-my cousin 's awfully fond of dancing , "[790-the young girl] [the young girl]790-the young girl answered simply . " But suddenly [she]3978-my cousin made up [her]3978-my cousin mind that [her]3978-my cousin dress was n't smart enough for a ball , though [we]792-we thought it so lovely ; and so [[my]790-the young girl aunt]4001-my aunt had to take [her]3978-my cousin [home]631-home . "[790-the young girl]

" Oh , well-- "[215-archer] said [Archer]215-archer with happy indifference . "[788-he]

IV .

In the course of the next day the first of the usual betrothal visits were exchanged . The [New York]2-new york ritual was precise and inflexible in such matters ; and in conformity with it [Newland Archer]215-archer first went with [[his]788-he mother]512-his mother and [sister]513-sister to call on [Mrs. Welland]219-mrs. welland , after which [he]788-he and [Mrs. Welland]219-mrs. welland and [May]226-may drove out to [old [Mrs. Manson Mingott]217-mrs. manson mingott 's]795-old mrs. manson mingott 's to receive [that venerable ancestress]796-that venerable ancestress 's blessing .

A visit to [Mrs. Manson Mingott]217-mrs. manson mingott was always an amusing episode to [the young man]511-the young man . [The house]516-the house in itself was already an historic document , though not , of course , as venerable as [certain other old family houses in [University Place]13-university place and lower [Fifth Avenue]18-fifth avenue]799-certain other old family houses in university place and lower fifth avenue . Those were of the purest 1830 , with a grim harmony of cabbage - rose - garlanded carpets , rosewood consoles , round - arched fire - places with black marble mantels , and immense glazed book - cases of mahogany ; whereas old [Mrs. Mingott]217-mrs. manson mingott , who had built [[her]217-mrs. manson mingott house]800-her house later , had bodily cast out the massive furniture of [her]217-mrs. manson mingott prime , and mingled with [the Mingott]217-mrs. manson mingott heirlooms the frivolous upholstery of [the Second Empire]801-the second empire . It was [her]217-mrs. manson mingott habit to sit in a window of [[her]217-mrs. manson mingott sitting - room]802-her sitting - room on the ground floor , as if watching calmly for life and fashion to flow northward to [her]217-mrs. manson mingott solitary doors . [She]217-mrs. manson mingott seemed in no hurry to have them come , for [her]217-mrs. manson mingott patience was equalled by [her]217-mrs. manson mingott confidence . [She]217-mrs. manson mingott was sure that presently [the hoardings]803-the hoardings , [the quarries]804-the quarries , [the one - story saloons]805-the one - story saloons , [the wooden green - houses in [ragged gardens]807-ragged gardens]806-the wooden green - houses in ragged gardens , and the rocks from which [goats]808-goats surveyed the scene , would vanish before the advance of [residences]809-residences as stately as [her]217-mrs. manson mingott own -- perhaps ( for [she]217-mrs. manson mingott was [an impartial woman]810-an impartial woman ) even statelier ; and that the cobble - stones over which the old clattering omnibuses bumped would be replaced by smooth asphalt , such as [people]619-people reported having seen in [Paris]7-paris . Meanwhile , as [every one [she]217-mrs. manson mingott cared to see]812-every one she cared to see came to [HER]217-mrs. manson mingott ( and [she]217-mrs. manson mingott could fill [[her]217-mrs. manson mingott rooms]813-her rooms as easily as [the Beauforts]814-the beauforts , and without adding a single item to the menu of [her]217-mrs. manson mingott suppers ) , [she]217-mrs. manson mingott did not suffer from [her]217-mrs. manson mingott geographic isolation .

The immense accretion of flesh which had descended on [her]217-mrs. manson mingott in middle life like a flood of lava on [a doomed city]815-a doomed city had changed [her]217-mrs. manson mingott from [a plump active little woman with a neatly - turned foot and ankle into something as vast and august as a natural phenomenon]816-a plump active little woman with a neatly - turned foot and ankle into something as vast and august as a natural phenomenon . [She]217-mrs. manson mingott had accepted this submergence as philosophically as all [her]217-mrs. manson mingott other trials , and now , in extreme old age , was rewarded by presenting to [her]217-mrs. manson mingott mirror an almost unwrinkled expanse of firm pink and white flesh , in the centre of which the traces of a small face survived as if awaiting excavation . A flight of smooth double chins led down to the dizzy depths of a still - snowy bosom veiled in snowy muslins that were held in place by a miniature portrait of the late [Mr. Mingott]238-mr. mingott ; and around and below , wave after wave of black silk surged away over the edges of a capacious armchair , with two tiny white hands poised like gulls on the surface of the billows .

The burden of [Mrs. Manson Mingott]217-mrs. manson mingott 's flesh had long since made it impossible for [her]217-mrs. manson mingott to go up and down [stairs]817-stairs , and with characteristic independence [she]217-mrs. manson mingott had made [[her]217-mrs. manson mingott reception rooms]818-her reception rooms [upstairs]692-upstairs and established [herself]217-mrs. manson mingott ( in flagrant violation of all the New [York]35-york proprieties ) on the ground floor of [[her]217-mrs. manson mingott house]800-her house ; so that , as [you]821-you sat in [her]217-mrs. manson mingott sitting - room window with [her]217-mrs. manson mingott , [you]821-you caught ( through a door that was always open , and a looped - back yellow damask portiere ) the unexpected vista of [a bedroom]822-a bedroom with a huge low bed upholstered like a sofa , and a toilet - table with frivolous lace flounces and a gilt - framed mirror .

[[Her]217-mrs. manson mingott visitors]823-her visitors were startled and fascinated by the foreignness of this arrangement , which recalled scenes in French fiction , and architectural incentives to immorality such as [the simple American]824-the simple american had never dreamed of . That was how [women]3970-women with [lovers]826-lovers lived in [the wicked old societies]827-the wicked old societies , in [apartments]828-apartments with all [the rooms on one floor]829-the rooms on one floor , and all the indecent propinquities that [their]3970-women novels described . It amused [Newland Archer]215-archer ( who had secretly situated the love - scenes of " [Monsieur de Camors]255-monsieur de camors "[831-he] in [[Mrs. Mingott]217-mrs. manson mingott 's bedroom]830-mrs. mingott 's bedroom ) to picture [her]217-mrs. manson mingott blameless life led in the stage - setting of adultery ; but [he]831-he said to [himself]831-he , with considerable admiration , that if [a lover]832-a lover had been what [she]217-mrs. manson mingott wanted , [the intrepid woman]833-the intrepid woman would have had [him]831-he too .

To the general relief [the Countess Olenska]235-the countess olenska was not present in [[[her]235-the countess olenska grandmother]834-her grandmother 's drawing - room]835-her grandmother 's drawing - room during the visit of [the betrothed couple]836-the betrothed couple . [Mrs. Mingott]217-mrs. manson mingott said [she]217-mrs. manson mingott had gone out ; which , on a day of such glaring sunlight , and at the " shopping hour , "[217-mrs. manson mingott] seemed in itself an indelicate thing for [a compromised woman]837-a compromised woman to do . But at any rate it spared [them]836-the betrothed couple the embarrassment of [her]217-mrs. manson mingott presence , and the faint shadow that [her]217-mrs. manson mingott unhappy past might seem to shed on [their]836-the betrothed couple radiant future . The visit went off successfully , as was to have been expected . [Old Mrs. Mingott]236-old mrs. mingott was delighted with the engagement , which , being long foreseen by [watchful relatives]838-watchful relatives , had been carefully passed upon in [family council]839-family council ; and the engagement ring , a large thick sapphire set in invisible claws , met with [her]217-mrs. manson mingott unqualified admiration .

" It 's the new setting : of course it shows the stone beautifully , but it looks a little bare to old - fashioned eyes , "[219-mrs. welland] [Mrs. Welland]219-mrs. welland had explained , with a conciliatory side - glance at [[her]219-mrs. welland future son - in - law]679-her future son - in - law .

" Old - fashioned eyes ? [I]841-the ancestress hope [you]679-her future son - in - law do n't mean [mine]841-the ancestress , [[my]841-the ancestress dear]4004-my dear ? [I]841-the ancestress like all the novelties , "[841-the ancestress] said [the ancestress]841-the ancestress , lifting the stone to [her]841-the ancestress small bright orbs , which no glasses had ever disfigured . " Very handsome , "[841-the ancestress] [she]841-the ancestress added , returning the jewel ; " very liberal . In [my]841-the ancestress time a cameo set in pearls was thought sufficient . "[841-the ancestress] and [she]841-the ancestress waved one of [her]841-the ancestress tiny hands , with small pointed nails and rolls of aged fat encircling the wrist like ivory bracelets . " Mine was modelled in [Rome]36-rome by [the great Ferrigiani]257-the great ferrigiani . "[841-the ancestress] [she]841-the ancestress broke off , fixing [her]841-the ancestress eyes on [Archer]256-archer 's face .

" Oh-- "[219-mrs. welland] [Mrs. Welland]219-mrs. welland murmured , while [the young man]511-the young man , smiling at [[his]511-the young man betrothed]596-his betrothed , replied : " As soon as ever it can , if only [you]219-mrs. welland 'll back [me]511-the young man up , [Mrs. Mingott]217-mrs. manson mingott . "[511-the young man]

" [We]4007-we must give [them]4008-them time to get to know [each other]558-each other a little better , [mamma]4010-mamma , "[219-mrs. welland] [Mrs. Welland]219-mrs. welland interposed , with the proper affectation of reluctance ; to which [the ancestress]841-the ancestress rejoined : " Know [each other]558-each other ? These successive statements were received with the proper expressions of amusement , incredulity and gratitude ; and the visit was breaking up in a vein of mild pleasantry when the door opened to admit [the Countess Olenska]845-the countess olenska , who entered in bonnet and mantle followed by the unexpected figure of [Julius Beaufort]231-beaufort .

" Thanks . [I]849-the visitor wish it might happen oftener , "[849-the visitor] said [the visitor]849-the visitor in [his]849-the visitor easy arrogant way . [She]217-mrs. manson mingott had forgotten [[her]217-mrs. manson mingott relatives , who were drifting out into [the hall]736-the hall under [Ellen Olenska]233-ellen 's guidance]850-her relatives , who were drifting out into the hall under ellen olenska 's guidance . " Of course if [you]4021-you and [Regina]249-regina invite [her]260-mrs. struthers the thing is settled . " Of course [you]235-the countess olenska know already -- about [May]226-may and [me]256-archer , "[256-archer] [he]256-archer said , answering [her]235-the countess olenska look with a shy laugh . "[256-archer]

In [the carriage]859-the carriage , on the way down [Fifth Avenue]18-fifth avenue , [they]735-the ladies talked pointedly of [Mrs. Mingott]217-mrs. manson mingott , of [her]217-mrs. manson mingott age , [her]217-mrs. manson mingott spirit , and all [her]217-mrs. manson mingott wonderful attributes . V.

The next evening [old Mr. Sillerton Jackson]225-mr. jackson came to dine with [the Archers]262-the archers .

[Mrs. Archer]215-archer was [a shy woman]864-a shy woman and shrank from society ; but [she]215-archer liked to be well - informed as to its doings . [[Her]215-archer old friend]865-her old friend [Mr. Sillerton Jackson]225-mr. jackson applied to the investigation of [[his]225-mr. jackson friends]866-his friends ' affairs the patience of [a collector]867-a collector and the science of [a naturalist]868-a naturalist ; and [[his]225-mr. jackson sister]869-his sister , [Miss Sophy Jackson]263-miss jackson , who lived with [him]225-mr. jackson , and was entertained by [all the people who could not secure [[her]215-archer much - sought - after brother]871-her much - sought - after brother]870-all the people who could not secure her much - sought - after brother , brought home bits of minor gossip that filled out usefully the gaps in [his]225-mr. jackson picture .

Therefore , whenever anything happened that [Mrs. Archer]215-archer wanted to know about , [she]215-archer asked [Mr. Jackson]225-mr. jackson to dine ; and as [she]215-archer honoured [few people]872-few people with [her]215-archer invitations , and as [she]215-archer and [[her]215-archer daughter]534-her daughter [Janey]264-janey were [an excellent audience]874-an excellent audience , [Mr. Jackson]225-mr. jackson usually came [himself]225-mr. jackson instead of sending [[his]225-mr. jackson sister]869-his sister . If [he]225-mr. jackson could have dictated all the conditions , [he]225-mr. jackson would have chosen the evenings when [Newland]215-archer was out ; not because [the young man]511-the young man was uncongenial to [him]225-mr. jackson ( [the two]778-the two got on capitally at [[their]778-the two club]878-their club ) but because [the old anecdotist]879-the old anecdotist sometimes felt , on [Newland]215-archer 's part , a tendency to weigh [his]225-mr. jackson evidence that [the ladies of [the family]532-the family]880-the ladies of the family never showed .

[Mr. Jackson]225-mr. jackson , if perfection had been attainable on [earth]882-earth , would also have asked that [Mrs. Archer]215-archer 's food should be a little better . But then [New York]2-new york , as far back as the mind of [man]883-man could travel , had been divided into [the two great fundamental groups of [the Mingotts]227-the mingotts and [Mansons]250-the mansons and all [[their]778-the two clan]885-their clan , who cared about eating and clothes and money]884-the two great fundamental groups of the mingotts and mansons and all their clan , who cared about eating and clothes and money , and [the Archer]215-archer - [Newland - van - der -]215-archer [Luyden tribe , who were devoted to travel , horticulture and the best fiction , and looked down on the grosser forms of pleasure]886-luyden tribe , who were devoted to travel , horticulture and the best fiction , and looked down on the grosser forms of pleasure .

[You]887-you could n't have everything , after all . If [you]887-you dined with [the Lovell Mingotts]227-the mingotts [you]887-you got canvas - back and terrapin and vintage wines ; at [Adeline Archer]265-dear adeline 's [you]887-you could talk about [Alpine scenery]888-alpine scenery and " The Marble Faun "[887-you] ; and luckily [the Archer Madeira]266-the archer madeira had gone round [the Cape]39-the cape . Therefore when a friendly summons came from [Mrs. Archer]215-archer , [Mr. Jackson]225-mr. jackson , who was [a true eclectic]889-a true eclectic , would usually say to [[his]225-mr. jackson sister]869-his sister : " [I]225-mr. jackson 've been a little gouty since [my]225-mr. jackson last dinner at [the Lovell Mingotts'--it]4030-the lovell mingotts'--it will do [me]225-mr. jackson good to diet at [Adeline 's]265-dear adeline . "[225-mr. jackson]

[Mrs. Archer]215-archer , who had long been [a widow]891-a widow , lived with [[her]215-archer son]648-her son and daughter in [West Twenty - eighth Street]41-west twenty - eighth street . [An upper floor]893-an upper floor was dedicated to [Newland]215-archer , and [the two women]894-the two women squeezed [themselves]894-the two women into [narrower quarters below]895-narrower quarters below . In an unclouded harmony of tastes and interests [they]894-the two women cultivated ferns in Wardian cases , made macrame lace and wool embroidery on linen , collected American revolutionary glazed ware , subscribed to " Good Words , "[894-the two women] and read [Ouida]267-ouida 's novels for the sake of the Italian atmosphere . ( [They]894-the two women preferred those about peasant life , because of the descriptions of scenery and the pleasanter sentiments , though in general [they]894-the two women liked novels about [people in society , whose motives and habits were more comprehensible]896-people in society , whose motives and habits were more comprehensible , spoke severely of [Dickens]268-dickens , who " had never drawn [a gentleman]4031-a gentleman , "[896-people in society , whose motives and habits were more comprehensible] and considered [Thackeray]269-thackeray less at [home]631-home in [the great world]898-the great world than [Bulwer]270-bulwer -- who , however , was beginning to be thought old - fashioned . ) [Mrs.]899-mrs. and [Miss Archer]271-miss archer were both [great lovers of scenery]900-great lovers of scenery . It was what [they]894-the two women principally sought and admired on [their]894-the two women occasional travels abroad ; considering architecture and painting as subjects for [men]848-men , and chiefly for [learned persons who read Ruskin]902-learned persons who read ruskin . [Mrs. Archer]215-archer had been born [a Newland]215-archer , and [mother]903-mother and [daughter , who were as like as sisters]904-daughter , who were as like as sisters , were both , as [people]619-people said , " true [Newlands]44-newlands "[619-people] ; tall , pale , and slightly round - shouldered , with long noses , sweet smiles and a kind of drooping distinction like that in certain faded Reynolds portraits . [Their]894-the two women physical resemblance would have been complete if [an elderly embonpoint]906-an elderly embonpoint had not stretched [Mrs. Archer]215-archer 's black brocade , while [Miss Archer]271-miss archer 's brown and purple poplins hung , as the years went on , more and more slackly on [her]271-miss archer virgin frame .

Mentally , the likeness between [them]894-the two women , as [Newland]215-archer was aware , was less complete than [their]894-the two women identical mannerisms often made it appear . The long habit of living together in mutually dependent intimacy had given [them]894-the two women the same vocabulary , and the same habit of beginning [their]894-the two women phrases " [Mother]903-mother thinks "[907-the other] or " [Janey]264-janey thinks , "[907-the other] according as one or [the other]907-the other wished to advance an opinion of [her]271-miss archer own ; but in reality , while [Mrs. Archer]215-archer 's serene unimaginativeness rested easily in the accepted and familiar , [Janey]264-janey was subject to starts and aberrations of fancy welling up from springs of suppressed romance .

[Mother]903-mother and [daughter]909-daughter adored [each other]558-each other and revered [[their]894-the two women son]911-their son and [brother]912-brother ; and [Archer]215-archer loved [them]894-the two women with a tenderness made compunctious and uncritical by the sense of [their]894-the two women exaggerated admiration , and by [his]913-his secret satisfaction in it . After all , [he]913-his thought it a good thing for [a man]914-a man to have [his]914-a man authority respected in [[his]914-a man own house]915-his own house , even if [his]913-his sense of humour sometimes made [him]913-his question the force of [his]913-his mandate .

On this occasion [the young man]511-the young man was very sure that [Mr. Jackson]225-mr. jackson would rather have had [him]913-his dine out ; but [he]511-the young man had [his]511-the young man own reasons for not doing so .

There was a faint touch of sarcasm in the reference to [[her]215-archer son]648-her son , and [Archer]215-archer knew it and had expected it . [Even Mrs. Archer]215-archer , who was seldom unduly pleased with human events , had been altogether glad of [[her]215-archer son]648-her son 's engagement . After dinner , according to immemorial custom , [Mrs. Archer]215-archer and [Janey]264-janey trailed [their]963-their long silk draperies up to [the drawing - room]964-the drawing - room , where , while [the gentlemen]965-the gentlemen smoked below stairs , [they]963-their sat beside a Carcel lamp with an engraved globe , facing each other across a rosewood work - table with a green silk bag under it , and stitched at the two ends of a tapestry band of field - flowers destined to adorn an " occasional "[225-mr. jackson] chair in [the drawing - room]964-the drawing - room of [young Mrs. Newland Archer]215-archer .

[Mr. Jackson]225-mr. jackson sank into the armchair with satisfaction , lit [his]225-mr. jackson cigar with perfect confidence ( it was [Newland]215-archer who bought them ) , and stretching [his]225-mr. jackson thin old ankles to the coals , said : " [You]225-mr. jackson say [the secretary]4064-the secretary merely helped [her]215-archer to get away , [[my]225-mr. jackson dear fellow]4074-my dear fellow ?
