"[1959-he]

[He]1959-he wondered what [Mrs. Welland]219-mrs. welland would have said if [he]1959-he had uttered the words instead of merely thinking them . Ah , no , [he]1959-he did not want [May]226-may to have that kind of innocence , the innocence that seals the mind against imagination and the heart against experience !

" [I]219-mrs. welland verily believe , "[219-mrs. welland] [Mrs. Welland]219-mrs. welland continued , " that if the horrible business had come out in the newspapers it would have been [[my]219-mrs. welland husband]4101-my husband 's death - blow . " [I]511-the young man 'm always thinking of [May]226-may , "[511-the young man] [the young man]511-the young man rejoined , rising to cut short the conversation .

[His]511-the young man only hope was to plead again with [May]226-may , and on the day before [his]511-the young man departure [he]511-the young man walked with [her]226-may to [the ruinous garden of [the Spanish Mission]1964-the spanish mission]1963-the ruinous garden of the spanish mission . " [We]4516-we might be seeing it all this spring -- even the Easter ceremonies at [Seville]103-seville , "[511-the young man] [he]511-the young man urged , exaggerating [his]511-the young man demands in the hope of a larger concession .

[His]511-the young man surprise at discovering that [her]1969-her fears had fastened upon an episode so remote and so completely of the past as [his]511-the young man love - affair with [Mrs. Thorley Rushworth]243-mrs. thorley rushworth gave way to wonder at the generosity of [her]1969-her view . [She]1977-her flushed with joy and lifted [her]1977-her face to [his]511-the young man ; as [he]511-the young man bent to it [he]511-the young man saw that [her]1977-her eyes were full of happy tears . XVII .

" [[Your]511-the young man cousin]3982-your cousin [the Countess]1255-the countess called on [mother]903-mother while [you]511-the young man were away , "[264-janey] [Janey Archer]264-janey announced to [[her]1977-her brother]956-her brother on the evening of [his]956-her brother return .

[The old lady]3973-the old lady received [him]956-her brother with unusual warmth ; [she]3973-the old lady was grateful to [him]956-her brother for persuading [the Countess Olenska]235-the countess olenska to give up the idea of a divorce ; and when [he]956-her brother told [her]215-archer that [he]956-her brother had deserted [the office]1759-the office without leave , and rushed down to [St. Augustine]93-st. augustine simply because [he]956-her brother wanted to see [May]226-may , [she]215-archer gave an adipose chuckle and patted [his]956-her brother knee with [her]215-archer puff - ball hand .

" Ah , ah -- so [you]956-her brother kicked over the traces , did [you]956-her brother ? " [I]215-archer hoped [she]226-may did ; but after all [she]226-may would n't agree to what [I]215-archer 'd gone down to ask for . "[215-archer]

" Would n't [she]226-may indeed ? And what was that ? "[215-archer]

" [I]215-archer wanted to get [her]226-may to promise that [we]4559-we should be married in April . What 's the use of [our]4559-we wasting another year ? "[215-archer]

[Mrs. Manson Mingott]217-mrs. manson mingott screwed up [her]217-mrs. manson mingott little mouth into a grimace of mimic prudery and twinkled at [him]1994-him through malicious lids . " ' Ask [Mamma]245-mamma , ' [I]1995-i suppose -- the usual story . [Ah]4560-ah , [these Mingotts]4561-these mingotts -- all alike ! Born in a rut , and [you]245-mamma ca n't root 'em out of it . "[1995-i] [She]1995-i broke off , still twinkling at [him]1996-you , and asked , with the casual irrelevance of old age : " Now , why in [the world]561-the world did n't [you]1996-you marry [[my]1995-i little [Ellen]276-ellen]4570-my little ellen ? "[1995-i]

[Archer]256-archer laughed . " For one thing , [she]276-ellen was n't there to be married . "[256-archer]

" No -- to be sure ; more 's the pity . And now it 's too late ; [her]276-ellen life is finished . "[1995-i] [She]1995-i spoke with the cold - blooded complacency of the aged throwing earth into the grave of [young hopes]1997-young hopes . [The young man]511-the young man 's heart grew chill , and [he]511-the young man said hurriedly : " Ca n't [I]511-the young man persuade [you]1995-i to use [your]1995-i influence with [the Wellands]1300-the wellands , [Mrs. Mingott]217-mrs. manson mingott ? [I]511-the young man was n't made for long engagements . "[511-the young man]

[Old Catherine]406-old catherine beamed on [him]1996-you approvingly . " No ; [I]406-old catherine can see that . [You]1996-you 've got a quick eye . [Archer]256-archer was aware that [Madame Olenska]241-madame olenska , who had seated [herself]241-madame olenska at [[her]241-madame olenska grandmother]834-her grandmother 's side , was still thoughtfully scrutinising [him]256-archer . " Tomorrow evening ? "[241-madame olenska]

[She]241-madame olenska nodded . " Tomorrow ; yes ; but early . [I]241-madame olenska 'm going out . "[241-madame olenska]

The next day was a Sunday , and if [she]241-madame olenska were " going out "[241-madame olenska] on a Sunday evening it could , of course , be only to [[Mrs. Lemuel Struthers]260-mrs. struthers 's]4299-mrs. lemuel struthers 's . [He]256-archer felt a slight movement of annoyance , not so much at [her]241-madame olenska going [there]713-there ( for [he]256-archer rather liked [her]241-madame olenska going where [she]241-madame olenska pleased in spite of [the van der Luydens]275-the van der luydens ) , but because it was [the kind of house at which [she]241-madame olenska was sure to meet [Beaufort]231-beaufort , where [she]241-madame olenska must have known beforehand that [she]241-madame olenska would meet [him]256-archer]2010-the kind of house at which she was sure to meet beaufort , where she must have known beforehand that she would meet him -- and where [she]241-madame olenska was probably going for that purpose .

" Very well ; tomorrow evening , "[256-archer] [he]256-archer repeated , inwardly resolved that [he]256-archer would not go early , and that by reaching [her]241-madame olenska door late [he]256-archer would either prevent [her]241-madame olenska from going to [[Mrs. Struthers]260-mrs. struthers 's]2011-mrs. struthers 's , or else arrive after [she]241-madame olenska had started -- which , all things considered , would no doubt be the simplest solution .

It was only half - past eight , after all , when [he]256-archer rang the bell under the wisteria ; not as late as [he]256-archer had intended by half an hour -- but a singular restlessness had driven [him]256-archer to [her]241-madame olenska door . [He]256-archer reflected , however , that [Mrs. Struthers]260-mrs. struthers 's Sunday evenings were not like a ball , and that [[her]241-madame olenska guests]2012-her guests , as if to minimise [their]2012-her guests delinquency , usually went early .

The one thing [he]256-archer had not counted on , in entering [[Madame Olenska]241-madame olenska 's hall]2013-madame olenska 's hall , was to find hats and overcoats [there]713-there . Why had [she]241-madame olenska bidden [him]256-archer to come early if [she]241-madame olenska was having [people]619-people to dine ? On a closer inspection of the garments besides which [Nastasia]336-nastasia was laying [his]256-archer own , [his]256-archer resentment gave way to curiosity . The overcoats were in fact the very strangest [he]256-archer had ever seen under a polite roof ; and it took but a glance to assure [himself]256-archer that neither of them belonged to [Julius Beaufort]231-beaufort . [One]503-one was a shaggy yellow ulster of " reach - [me]503-one - down "[503-one] cut , the other a very old and rusty cloak with a cape -- something like what [the French]407-the french called a " [Macfarlane]408-macfarlane . "[407-the french] This garment , which appeared to be made for [a person of prodigious size , had evidently seen long and hard wear]2017-a person of prodigious size , had evidently seen long and hard wear , and its greenish - black folds gave out a moist sawdusty smell suggestive of prolonged sessions against [bar - room walls]2018-bar - room walls . On it lay a ragged grey scarf and an odd felt hat of semiclerical shape .

[Archer]256-archer raised [his]256-archer eyebrows enquiringly at [Nastasia]336-nastasia , who raised [hers]336-nastasia in return with a fatalistic " [Gia]409-gia ! "[336-nastasia] as [she]336-nastasia threw open the drawing - room door .

[The young man]511-the young man saw at once that [[his]511-the young man hostess]1243-his hostess was not in [the room]972-the room ; then , with surprise , [he]511-the young man discovered another lady standing by the fire . [This lady]2022-this lady , who was long , lean and loosely put together , was clad in raiment intricately looped and fringed , with plaids and stripes and bands of plain colour disposed in a design to which the clue seemed missing . [Her]2022-this lady hair , which had tried to turn white and only succeeded in fading , was surmounted by a Spanish comb and black lace scarf , and silk mittens , visibly darned , covered [her]2022-this lady rheumatic hands .

Beside [her]2022-this lady , in a cloud of cigar - smoke , stood [the owners of the two overcoats]2023-the owners of the two overcoats , both in morning clothes that [they]2023-the owners of the two overcoats had evidently not taken off since morning . " [She]316-the marchioness manson knows nothing yet -- of all this ? "[256-archer] [he]256-archer asked abruptly .

"[217-mrs. manson mingott]

" That [she]316-the marchioness manson ought to go back ? [I]511-the young man would rather see [her]316-the marchioness manson dead ! "[511-the young man] cried [the young man]511-the young man violently .

" Ah , "[2030-the marchioness] [the Marchioness]2030-the marchioness murmured , without visible resentment . For a while [she]2030-the marchioness sat in [her]2030-the marchioness arm - chair , opening and shutting the absurd ivory fan between [her]2030-the marchioness mittened fingers ; but suddenly [she]2030-the marchioness lifted [her]2030-the marchioness head and listened .

" Here [she]316-the marchioness manson comes , "[2030-the marchioness] [she]2030-the marchioness said in a rapid whisper ; and then , pointing to the bouquet on the sofa : " Am [I]2030-the marchioness to understand that [you]256-archer prefer THAT , [Mr. Archer]256-archer ? After all , marriage is marriage ... and [[my]2030-the marchioness niece]3975-my niece is still [a wife]996-a wife ... "[2030-the marchioness]

XVIII .

" What are [you]256-archer two plotting together , [aunt Medora]230-medora manson ? "[241-madame olenska] [Madame Olenska]241-madame olenska cried as [she]241-madame olenska came into [the room]972-the room .

[She]241-madame olenska was dressed as if for a ball . Everything about [her]241-madame olenska shimmered and glimmered softly , as if [her]241-madame olenska dress had been woven out of candle - beams ; and [she]241-madame olenska carried [her]241-madame olenska head high , like [a pretty woman challenging a roomful of rivals]2045-a pretty woman challenging a roomful of rivals .

" [We]4630-we were saying , [[my]217-mrs. manson mingott dear]4004-my dear , that here was something beautiful to surprise [you]4004-my dear with , "[217-mrs. manson mingott] [Mrs. Manson]217-mrs. manson mingott rejoined , rising to [her]217-mrs. manson mingott feet and pointing archly to the flowers .

[Madame Olenska]241-madame olenska stopped short and looked at the bouquet . [Her]241-madame olenska colour did not change , but a sort of white radiance of anger ran over [her]241-madame olenska like summer lightning . " Ah , "[241-madame olenska] [she]241-madame olenska exclaimed , in a shrill voice that [the young man]511-the young man had never heard , " who is ridiculous enough to send [me]241-madame olenska a bouquet ? Why a bouquet ? And why tonight of all nights ? [I]241-madame olenska am not going to a ball ; [I]241-madame olenska am not [a girl engaged to be married]4632-a girl engaged to be married . But [some people]694-some people are always ridiculous . "[241-madame olenska]

[She]241-madame olenska turned back to the door , opened it , and called out : " [Nastasia]336-nastasia ! "[241-madame olenska]

[The ubiquitous handmaiden]2047-the ubiquitous handmaiden promptly appeared , and [Archer]256-archer heard [Madame Olenska]241-madame olenska say , in an Italian that [she]241-madame olenska seemed to pronounce with intentional deliberateness in order that [he]511-the young man might follow it : " Here -- throw this into the dustbin ! "[241-madame olenska] and then , as [Nastasia]336-nastasia stared protestingly : " But no -- it 's not the fault of the poor flowers . Tell [the boy]1711-the boy to carry them to [the house]516-the house three doors away , [the house of [Mr. Winsett]411-mr. winsett]4636-the house of mr. winsett , [the dark gentleman who dined [here]4019-here]4637-the dark gentleman who dined here . [[His]411-mr. winsett wife]553-his wife is ill -- [they]4640-they may give [her]553-his wife pleasure ... [The boy]1711-the boy is out , [you]256-archer say ? Then , [[my]336-nastasia dear one]4642-my dear one , run [yourself]4642-my dear one ; here , put [my]336-nastasia cloak over [you]4642-my dear one and fly . [I]336-nastasia want the thing out of [the house]516-the house immediately ! And , as [you]4642-my dear one live , do n't say they come from [me]336-nastasia ! "[336-nastasia]

[She]2048-she flung [her]2048-she velvet opera cloak over [the maid]2049-the maid 's shoulders and turned back into [the drawing - room]964-the drawing - room , shutting the door sharply . [Her]2048-she bosom was rising high under its lace , and for a moment [Archer]256-archer thought [she]2048-she was about to cry ; but [she]2048-she burst into a laugh instead , and looking from [the Marchioness]316-the marchioness manson to [Archer]256-archer , asked abruptly : " And [you]256-archer two -- have [you]256-archer made [friends]4143-friends ! "[2048-she]

" It 's for [Mr. Archer]256-archer to say , [darling]4645-darling ; [he]256-archer has waited patiently while [you]256-archer were dressing . "[2048-she]

" Yes -- [I]241-madame olenska gave [you]256-archer time enough : [my]241-madame olenska hair would n't go , "[241-madame olenska] [Madame Olenska]241-madame olenska said , raising [her]241-madame olenska hand to the heaped - up curls of [her]241-madame olenska chignon . " But that reminds [me]241-madame olenska : [I]241-madame olenska see [Dr. Carver]410-dr. carver is gone , and [you]256-archer 'll be late at the Blenkers ' . [Mr. Archer]256-archer , will [you]256-archer put [[my]241-madame olenska aunt]4001-my aunt in [the carriage]859-the carriage ? "[241-madame olenska]

[She]241-madame olenska followed [the Marchioness]2030-the marchioness into [the hall]736-the hall , saw [her]2030-the marchioness fitted into a miscellaneous heap of overshoes , shawls and tippets , and called from [the doorstep]2053-the doorstep : " Mind , [the carriage]859-the carriage is to be back for [me]241-madame olenska at ten ! "[241-madame olenska] Then [she]241-madame olenska returned to [the drawing - room]964-the drawing - room , where [Archer]256-archer , on re - entering [it]964-the drawing - room , found [her]2030-the marchioness standing by the mantelpiece , examining [herself]2030-the marchioness in the mirror . It was not usual , in [New York]2-new york society , for [a lady]680-a lady to address [[her]680-a lady parlour - maid]2056-her parlour - maid as " [[my]680-a lady dear one]4642-my dear one , "[680-a lady] and send [her]2030-the marchioness out on an errand wrapped in [her]2030-the marchioness own opera - cloak ; and [Archer]256-archer , through all [his]256-archer deeper feelings , tasted the pleasurable excitement of being in a world where action followed on emotion with such Olympian speed .

[Madame Olenska]241-madame olenska did not move when [he]256-archer came up behind [her]241-madame olenska , and for a second [their]2057-their eyes met in the mirror ; then [she]241-madame olenska turned , threw [herself]241-madame olenska into [her]241-madame olenska sofa - corner , and sighed out : " There 's time for a cigarette . "[241-madame olenska]

[He]256-archer handed [her]241-madame olenska the box and lit a spill for [her]241-madame olenska ; and as the flame flashed up into [her]241-madame olenska face [she]241-madame olenska glanced at [him]256-archer with laughing eyes and said : " What do [you]256-archer think of [me]241-madame olenska in a temper ? "[241-madame olenska]

[Archer]256-archer paused a moment ; then [he]256-archer answered with sudden resolution : " It makes [me]256-archer understand what [[your]241-madame olenska aunt]4650-your aunt has been saying about [you]241-madame olenska . "[256-archer]

" [I]241-madame olenska knew [she]4650-your aunt 'd been talking about [me]241-madame olenska . Well ? "[241-madame olenska]

" [She]4650-your aunt said [you]256-archer were used to all kinds of things -- splendours and amusements and excitements -- that [we]4651-we could never hope to give [you]256-archer here . "[256-archer]

[Madame Olenska]241-madame olenska smiled faintly into the circle of smoke about [her]241-madame olenska lips .

" [Medora]230-medora manson is incorrigibly romantic . It has made up to [her]230-medora manson for so many things ! "[256-archer]

[Archer]256-archer hesitated again , and again took [his]256-archer risk . " Is [[your]241-madame olenska aunt]4650-your aunt 's romanticism always consistent with accuracy ? "[256-archer]

" [You]256-archer mean : does [she]4650-your aunt speak the truth ? "[241-madame olenska] [[Her]241-madame olenska niece]2058-her niece considered . " Well , [I]2058-her niece 'll tell [you]256-archer : in almost everything [she]4650-your aunt says , there 's something true and something untrue . But why do [you]256-archer ask ? What has [she]4650-your aunt been telling [you]256-archer ? "[2058-her niece]

[He]256-archer looked away into the fire , and then back at [her]241-madame olenska shining presence . [His]256-archer heart tightened with the thought that this was [their]2059-their last evening by that fireside , and that in a moment [the carriage]859-the carriage would come to carry [her]241-madame olenska away .

" [She]4650-your aunt says -- [she]4650-your aunt pretends that [Count Olenski]278-count olenski has asked [her]4650-your aunt to persuade [you]256-archer to go back to [him]278-count olenski . "[241-madame olenska]

[Madame Olenska]241-madame olenska made no answer . [She]241-madame olenska sat motionless , holding [her]241-madame olenska cigarette in [her]241-madame olenska half - lifted hand . The expression of [her]241-madame olenska face had not changed ; and [Archer]256-archer remembered that [he]256-archer had before noticed [her]241-madame olenska apparent incapacity for surprise .

" [You]241-madame olenska knew , then ? "[256-archer] [he]256-archer broke out .

[She]241-madame olenska was silent for so long that the ash dropped from [her]241-madame olenska cigarette . [She]241-madame olenska brushed it to the floor . " [She]4650-your aunt has hinted about a letter : [poor darling]1009-poor darling ! [Medora]230-medora manson 's hints-- "[241-madame olenska]

" Is it at [[your]241-madame olenska husband]4388-your husband 's request that [she]4650-your aunt has arrived [here]4019-here suddenly ? "[256-archer]

[Madame Olenska]241-madame olenska seemed to consider this question also . " There again : one ca n't tell . [She]4650-your aunt told [me]241-madame olenska [she]4650-your aunt had had a ' spiritual summons , ' whatever that is , from [Dr. Carver]410-dr. carver . " But [you]241-madame olenska do believe [she]4650-your aunt has a letter from [[your]241-madame olenska husband]4388-your husband ? "[256-archer]

Again [Madame Olenska]241-madame olenska brooded silently ; then [she]241-madame olenska said : " After all , it was to be expected . "[241-madame olenska]

[The young man]511-the young man rose and went to lean against the fireplace . " [You]511-the young man know that [[your]511-the young man aunt]4650-your aunt believes [you]511-the young man will go back ? "[241-madame olenska]

[Madame Olenska]241-madame olenska raised [her]241-madame olenska head quickly . A deep blush rose to [her]241-madame olenska face and spread over [her]241-madame olenska neck and shoulders . [She]241-madame olenska blushed seldom and painfully , as if it hurt [her]241-madame olenska like a burn .

" Many cruel things have been believed of [me]241-madame olenska , "[241-madame olenska] [she]241-madame olenska said .

" Oh , [Ellen]233-ellen -- forgive [me]241-madame olenska ; [I]241-madame olenska 'm [a fool]4662-a fool and [a brute]4663-a brute ! "[241-madame olenska]

[She]241-madame olenska smiled a little . " [You]511-the young man are horribly nervous ; [you]511-the young man have [your]511-the young man own troubles . [I]241-madame olenska know [you]511-the young man think [the Wellands]321-the wellands are unreasonable about [your]511-the young man marriage , and of course [I]241-madame olenska agree with [you]511-the young man . "[241-madame olenska] [She]241-madame olenska pronounced the " [we]4665-we "[241-madame olenska] with a faint emphasis that gave it an ironic sound .

[Archer]256-archer felt the irony but did not dare to take it up . After all , [she]241-madame olenska had perhaps purposely deflected the conversation from [her]241-madame olenska own affairs , and after the pain [his]256-archer last words had evidently caused [her]241-madame olenska [he]256-archer felt that all [he]256-archer could do was to follow [her]241-madame olenska lead . But the sense of the waning hour made [him]256-archer desperate : [he]256-archer could not bear the thought that a barrier of words should drop between [them]2064-them again .

" Yes , "[256-archer] [he]256-archer said abruptly ; " [I]256-archer went [south]4666-south to ask [May]226-may to marry [me]256-archer after Easter . There 's no reason why [we]4665-we should n't be married then . "[256-archer]

" And [May]4667-may adores [you]256-archer -- and yet [you]256-archer could n't convince [her]4667-may ? [I]241-madame olenska thought [her]4667-may too intelligent to be the slave of such absurd superstitions . "[241-madame olenska]

" [She]4667-may IS too intelligent -- [she]4667-may 's not [[their]4665-we slave]4668-their slave . "[256-archer]

[Madame Olenska]241-madame olenska looked at [him]256-archer . " Well , then -- [I]241-madame olenska do n't understand . "[241-madame olenska]

[Archer]256-archer reddened , and hurried on with a rush . " [We]4665-we had a frank talk -- almost the first . [She]4667-may thinks [my]256-archer impatience a bad sign . "[256-archer]

" Merciful heavens -- a bad sign ? "[241-madame olenska]

" [She]4667-may thinks it means that [I]256-archer ca n't trust [myself]256-archer to go on caring for [her]4667-may . [She]4667-may thinks , in short , [I]256-archer want to marry [her]4667-may at once to get away from some one that [I]256-archer -- care for more . "[256-archer]

[Madame Olenska]241-madame olenska examined this curiously . " But if [she]4667-may thinks that -- why is n't [she]4667-may in a hurry too ? "[241-madame olenska]

[Madame Olenska]241-madame olenska leaned toward the fire and gazed into it with fixed eyes . Down [the quiet street]1355-the quiet street [Archer]256-archer heard the approaching trot of [[her]241-madame olenska horses]2066-her horses .

" Ah . "[256-archer] There was another long interval . At length [she]241-madame olenska looked up at [him]256-archer and asked : " [This other woman]4672-this other woman -- does [she]4672-this other woman love [you]256-archer ? "[241-madame olenska]

" Yes . "[241-madame olenska] [She]241-madame olenska smiled and added : " [I]241-madame olenska must go where [I]241-madame olenska am invited , or [I]241-madame olenska should be too lonely . Why not come with [me]241-madame olenska ? "[241-madame olenska]

[Archer]256-archer felt that at any cost [he]256-archer must keep [her]241-madame olenska beside [him]256-archer , must make [her]241-madame olenska give [him]256-archer the rest of [her]241-madame olenska evening . " [May]4677-may guessed the truth , "[256-archer] [he]256-archer said . " There is [another woman]4678-another woman -- but not the one [she]4677-may thinks . "[256-archer]

[Ellen Olenska]233-ellen made no answer , and did not move . After a moment [he]256-archer sat down beside [her]241-madame olenska , and , taking [her]241-madame olenska hand , softly unclasped it , so that the gloves and fan fell on the sofa between [them]2067-them .

[She]241-madame olenska started up , and freeing [herself]241-madame olenska from [him]256-archer moved away to the other side of the hearth . " Ah , do n't make love to [me]241-madame olenska ! [Too many people]4679-too many people have done that , "[241-madame olenska] [she]241-madame olenska said , frowning .

" [I]256-archer have never made love to [you]241-madame olenska , "[256-archer] [he]256-archer said , " and [I]256-archer never shall . "[256-archer]

" Possible for either of [us]4681-us ? "[241-madame olenska] [She]241-madame olenska looked at [him]256-archer with unfeigned astonishment . " And [you]256-archer say that -- when it 's [you]256-archer who 've made it impossible ? "[241-madame olenska]

[He]256-archer stared at [her]241-madame olenska , groping in a blackness through which a single arrow of light tore its blinding way .

" [I'VE]256-archer made it impossible-- ? "[256-archer]

" [You]256-archer , [you]256-archer , [YOU]256-archer ! "[241-madame olenska] [she]241-madame olenska cried , [her]241-madame olenska lip trembling like [a child]1378-a child 's on the verge of tears . " Is n't it [you]256-archer who made [me]2069-i give up divorcing -- give it up because [you]256-archer showed [me]2069-i how selfish and wicked it was , how [one]503-one must sacrifice [one]503-one 's self to preserve the dignity of marriage ... and to spare [[one]503-one 's family]4685-one 's family the publicity , the scandal ? And because [[my]2069-i family]4397-my family was going to be [[your]256-archer family]4191-your family -- for [May]226-may 's sake and for [yours]256-archer -- [I]2069-i did what [you]256-archer told [me]2069-i , what [you]256-archer proved to [me]2069-i that [I]2069-i ought to do . Ah , "[2069-i] [she]2069-i broke out with a sudden laugh , " [I]2069-i 've made no secret of having done it for [you]511-the young man ! "[2069-i]

[She]2069-i sank down on the sofa again , crouching among the festive ripples of [her]2069-i dress like a stricken masquerader ; and [the young man]511-the young man stood by the fireplace and continued to gaze at [her]2069-i without moving .

" [Good God]413-good god , "[511-the young man] [he]511-the young man groaned . " When [I]511-the young man thought-- "[511-the young man]

" [You]511-the young man thought ? "[511-the young man]

" Ah , do n't ask [me]511-the young man what [I]511-the young man thought ! "[511-the young man]

" [I]2069-i do ask [you]511-the young man . "[2069-i]

" Well , then : there were things in that letter [you]511-the young man asked [me]2069-i to read-- "[2069-i]

" [[My]2069-i husband]4101-my husband 's letter ? "[2069-i]

" Yes . "[2069-i]

" [I]2069-i had nothing to fear from that letter : absolutely nothing ! All [I]2069-i feared was to bring notoriety , scandal , on [the family]532-the family -- on [you]511-the young man and May. "[2069-i]

" [Good God]413-good god , "[511-the young man] [he]511-the young man groaned again , bowing [his]511-the young man face in [his]511-the young man hands .

The silence that followed lay on [them]2071-them with the weight of things final and irrevocable . It seemed to [Archer]256-archer to be crushing [him]511-the young man down like [his]511-the young man own grave - stone ; in all the wide future [he]511-the young man saw nothing that would ever lift that load from [his]511-the young man heart . [He]511-the young man did not move from [his]511-the young man place , or raise [his]511-the young man head from [his]511-the young man hands ; [his]511-the young man hidden eyeballs went on staring into utter darkness .

" At least [I]511-the young man loved [you--]2072-her "[511-the young man] [he]511-the young man brought out .

On the other side of the hearth , from the sofa - corner where [he]511-the young man supposed that [she]2072-her still crouched , [he]511-the young man heard a faint stifled crying like [a child]1378-a child 's . [He]511-the young man started up and came to [her]2072-her side .

" [Ellen]233-ellen ! What madness ! Why are [you]2072-her crying ? Nothing 's done that ca n't be undone . [I]511-the young man 'm still free , and [you]2072-her 're going to be . "[511-the young man] [He]511-the young man had [her]2072-her in [his]511-the young man arms , [her]2072-her face like a wet flower at [his]511-the young man lips , and all [their]2074-their vain terrors shrivelling up like ghosts at sunrise . The one thing that astonished [him]511-the young man now was that [he]511-the young man should have stood for five minutes arguing with [her]2072-her across the width of [the room]972-the room , when just touching [her]2072-her made everything so simple .

[She]2072-her gave [him]511-the young man back all [his]511-the young man kiss , but after a moment [he]511-the young man felt [her]2072-her stiffening in [his]511-the young man arms , and [she]2072-her put [him]511-the young man aside and stood up .

" Ah , [[my]2072-her poor Newland]4690-my poor newland -- [I]2072-her suppose this had to be . But it does n't in the least alter things , "[2072-her] [she]2072-her said , looking down at [him]511-the young man in [her]2072-her turn from the hearth .

" It alters the whole of life for [me]2072-her . "[2072-her]

" No , no -- it must n't , it ca n't . [You]511-the young man 're engaged to [May Welland]226-may ; and [I]2072-her 'm married . "[2072-her]

[He]511-the young man stood up too , flushed and resolute . " Nonsense ! It 's too late for that sort of thing . [We]4691-we 've no right to lie to [other people]4692-other people or to [ourselves]4691-we . [We]4691-we wo n't talk of [your]511-the young man marriage ; but do [you]511-the young man see [me]511-the young man marrying [May]226-may after this ? "[511-the young man]

[She]2072-her stood silent , resting [her]2072-her thin elbows on the mantelpiece , [her]2072-her profile reflected in the glass behind [her]2072-her . One of the locks of [her]2072-her chignon had become loosened and hung on [her]2072-her neck ; [she]2072-her looked haggard and almost old .

" [I]2072-her do n't see [you]511-the young man , "[2072-her] [she]2072-her said at length , " putting that question to May. Do [you]511-the young man ? "[2072-her]

[He]511-the young man gave a reckless shrug . " It 's too late to do anything else . "[511-the young man]

" [You]511-the young man say that because it 's the easiest thing to say at this moment -- not because it 's true . In reality it 's too late to do anything but what [we]4691-we 'd both decided on . "[2072-her]

" Ah , [I]511-the young man do n't understand [you]511-the young man ! "[511-the young man]

[She]2072-her forced a pitiful smile that pinched [her]2072-her face instead of smoothing it . " [You]511-the young man do n't understand because [you]511-the young man have n't yet guessed how [you]511-the young man 've changed things for [me]2072-her : oh , from the first -- long before [I]2072-her knew all [you]511-the young man 'd done . "[2072-her]

" All [I]511-the young man 'd done ? "[511-the young man]

" Yes . [I]2072-her was perfectly unconscious at first that [people here]4693-people here were shy of [me]2072-her -- that [they]4693-people here thought [I]2072-her was [a dreadful sort of person]4694-a dreadful sort of person . It seems [they]4693-people here had even refused to meet [me]2072-her at dinner . [I]2072-her found that out afterward ; and how [you]511-the young man 'd made [[your]511-the young man mother]4580-your mother go with [you]511-the young man to [the van der Luydens ']4162-the van der luydens ' ; and how [you]511-the young man 'd insisted on announcing [your]511-the young man engagement at the Beaufort ball , so that [I]2072-her might have [two families]4697-two families to stand by [me]2072-her instead of one-- "[2072-her]

At that [he]2076-you broke into a laugh .

" Just imagine , "[2077-i] [she]2077-i said , " how stupid and unobservant [I]2077-i was ! [I]2077-i knew nothing of all this till [Granny]244-granny blurted it out one day . [New York]2-new york simply meant peace and freedom to [me]2077-i : it was coming [home]631-home . And [I]2077-i was so happy at being among [[my]2077-i own people]4699-my own people that [every one [I]2077-i met]4700-every one i met seemed kind and good , and glad to see [me]2077-i . But from the very beginning , "[2077-i] [she]2077-i continued , " [I]2077-i felt there was [no one]601-no one as kind as [you]2076-you ; [no one who gave [me]2077-i reasons that [I]2077-i understood for doing what at first seemed so hard and -- unnecessary]4702-no one who gave me reasons that i understood for doing what at first seemed so hard and -- unnecessary . [The very good people]4703-the very good people did n't convince [me]2077-i ; [I]2077-i felt [they]4703-the very good people 'd never been tempted . But [you]2076-you knew ; [you]2076-you understood ; [you]2076-you had felt the world outside tugging at one with all its golden hands -- and yet [you]2076-you hated the things it asks of [one]503-one ; [you]2076-you hated happiness bought by disloyalty and cruelty and indifference . That was what [I]2077-i 'd never known before -- and it 's better than anything [I]2077-i 've known . "[2077-i]

[She]2077-i spoke in a low even voice , without tears or visible agitation ; and each word , as it dropped from [her]2077-i , fell into [his]2078-his breast like burning lead . [He]2078-his sat bowed over , [his]2078-his head between [his]2078-his hands , staring at the hearthrug , and at the tip of the satin shoe that showed under [her]2077-i dress . Suddenly [he]2078-his knelt down and kissed the shoe .

[She]2077-i bent over [him]2078-his , laying [her]2077-i hands on [his]2078-his shoulders , and looking at [him]2078-his with eyes so deep that [he]2078-his remained motionless under [her]2077-i gaze .

" Ah , do n't let [us]4705-us undo what [you]2078-his 've done ! "[2077-i] [she]2077-i cried . " [I]2077-i ca n't go back now to that other way of thinking . [I]2077-i ca n't love [you]2078-his unless [I]2077-i give [you]2078-his up . "[2077-i]

[His]2078-his arms were yearning up to [her]2077-i ; but [she]2077-i drew away , and [they]2079-they remained facing each other , divided by the distance that [her]2077-i words had created . Then , abruptly , [his]2078-his anger overflowed .

" And [Beaufort]231-beaufort ? Is [he]2078-his to replace [me]2077-i ? "[2077-i]

As the words sprang out [he]2078-his was prepared for an answering flare of anger ; and [he]2078-his would have welcomed it as fuel for [his]2078-his own . But [Madame Olenska]241-madame olenska only grew a shade paler , and stood with [her]241-madame olenska arms hanging down before [her]241-madame olenska , and [her]241-madame olenska head slightly bent , as [her]241-madame olenska way was when [she]241-madame olenska pondered a question .

" [He]2078-his 's waiting for [you]256-archer now at [[Mrs. Struthers]260-mrs. struthers 's]2011-mrs. struthers 's ; why do n't [you]256-archer go to [him]2078-his ? "[256-archer] [Archer]256-archer sneered .

[She]241-madame olenska turned to ring the bell . " [I]241-madame olenska shall not go out this evening ; tell [the carriage]859-the carriage to go and fetch [the Signora Marchesa]415-the signora marchesa , "[241-madame olenska] [she]241-madame olenska said when [the maid]2049-the maid came .

After the door had closed again [Archer]256-archer continued to look at [her]241-madame olenska with bitter eyes . " Why this sacrifice ? Since [you]241-madame olenska tell [me]256-archer that [you]241-madame olenska 're lonely [I]256-archer 've no right to keep [you]241-madame olenska from [[your]241-madame olenska friends]4177-your friends . "[256-archer]

[She]241-madame olenska smiled a little under [her]241-madame olenska wet lashes . " [I]241-madame olenska sha n't be lonely now . [I]241-madame olenska WAS lonely ; [I]241-madame olenska WAS afraid . But the emptiness and the darkness are gone ; when [I]241-madame olenska turn back into [myself]241-madame olenska now [I]241-madame olenska 'm like [a child]1378-a child going at night into [a room where there 's always a light]4710-a room where there 's always a light . "[241-madame olenska]

[Her]241-madame olenska tone and [her]241-madame olenska look still enveloped [her]241-madame olenska in a soft inaccessibility , and [Archer]256-archer groaned out again : " [I]256-archer do n't understand [you]241-madame olenska ! "[256-archer]

" Yet [you]241-madame olenska understand [May]226-may ! "[241-madame olenska]

[He]256-archer reddened under the retort , but kept [his]256-archer eyes on [her]241-madame olenska . " [May]226-may is ready to give [me]256-archer up . "[256-archer]

" What ! Three days after [you]241-madame olenska 've entreated [her]226-may on [your]241-madame olenska knees to hasten [your]241-madame olenska marriage ? "[256-archer]

" [She]226-may 's refused ; that gives [me]256-archer the right-- "[256-archer]

" Ah , [you]256-archer 've taught [me]241-madame olenska what an ugly word that is , "[241-madame olenska] [she]241-madame olenska said .

[He]256-archer turned away with a sense of utter weariness . [He]256-archer felt as though [he]256-archer had been struggling for hours up the face of a steep precipice , and now , just as [he]256-archer had fought [his]256-archer way to the top , [his]256-archer hold had given way and [he]256-archer was pitching down headlong into darkness .

If [he]256-archer could have got [her]241-madame olenska in [his]256-archer arms again [he]256-archer might have swept away [her]241-madame olenska arguments ; but [she]241-madame olenska still held [him]256-archer at a distance by something inscrutably aloof in [her]241-madame olenska look and attitude , and by [his]256-archer own awed sense of [her]241-madame olenska sincerity . At length [he]256-archer began to plead again .

" If [we]2082-they do this now it will be worse afterward -- worse for every one-- "[256-archer]

" No -- no -- no ! "[241-madame olenska] [she]241-madame olenska almost screamed , as if [he]256-archer frightened [her]241-madame olenska .

At that moment the bell sent a long tinkle through [the house]516-the house . [They]2082-they had heard [no carriage]2083-no carriage stopping at the door , and [they]2082-they stood motionless , looking at [each other]558-each other with startled eyes .

Outside , [Nastasia]336-nastasia 's step crossed [the hall]736-the hall , the outer door opened , and a moment later [she]241-madame olenska came in carrying a telegram which [she]241-madame olenska handed to [the Countess Olenska]235-the countess olenska .

" [The lady]663-the lady was very happy at the flowers , "[336-nastasia] [Nastasia]336-nastasia said , smoothing [her]336-nastasia apron . " [She]663-the lady thought it was [[her]663-the lady signor]4712-her signor marito who had sent [them]4713-them , and [she]663-the lady cried a little and said it was a folly . "[336-nastasia]

[[Her]336-nastasia mistress]1319-her mistress smiled and took the yellow envelope . [She]1319-her mistress tore it open and carried it to the lamp ; then , when the door had closed again , [she]1319-her mistress handed the telegram to [Archer]256-archer .

It was dated from [St. Augustine]93-st. augustine , and addressed to [the Countess Olenska]235-the countess olenska . In it [he]256-archer read : " [Granny]244-granny 's telegram successful . [Papa]402-papa and [Mamma]245-mamma agree marriage after Easter . Am telegraphing [Newland]215-archer . [Am]256-archer too happy for words and love [you]215-archer dearly . [Your]215-archer grateful May. "[256-archer]

Half an hour later , when [Archer]256-archer unlocked [his]256-archer own front - door , [he]256-archer found a similar envelope on the hall - table on top of [his]256-archer pile of notes and letters . The message inside the envelope was also from [May Welland]226-may , and ran as follows : " [Parents]4714-parents consent wedding Tuesday after Easter at twelve Grace Church eight [bridesmaids]4715-bridesmaids please see [Rector]416-rector so happy love May. "[226-may]

[Archer]256-archer crumpled up the yellow sheet as if the gesture could annihilate the news it contained . Then [he]256-archer pulled out a small pocket - diary and turned over the pages with trembling fingers ; but [he]256-archer did not find what [he]256-archer wanted , and cramming the telegram into [his]256-archer pocket [he]256-archer mounted the stairs .

A light was shining through the door of [the little hall - room]2087-the little hall - room which served [Janey]264-janey as [a dressing - room]2088-a dressing - room and boudoir , and [[her]2089-her brother]956-her brother rapped impatiently on the panel . The door opened , and [[his]256-archer sister]869-his sister stood before [him]256-archer in [her]869-his sister immemorial purple flannel dressing - gown , with [her]869-his sister hair " on pins . "[869-his sister] [Her]869-his sister face looked pale and apprehensive .

" [Newland]215-archer ! [I]869-his sister hope there 's no bad news in that telegram ? [I]869-his sister waited on purpose , in case-- "[869-his sister] ( No item of [his]256-archer correspondence was safe from [Janey]264-janey . )

[He]256-archer took no notice of [her]869-his sister question . " Look here -- what day is Easter this year ? "[256-archer]

[She]869-his sister looked shocked at such unchristian ignorance . " Easter ? [Newland]215-archer ! Why , of course , the first week in April . Why ? "[869-his sister]

" The first week ? "[256-archer] [He]256-archer turned again to the pages of [his]256-archer diary , calculating rapidly under [his]256-archer breath . " The first week , did [you]264-janey say ? "[256-archer] [He]256-archer threw back [his]256-archer head with a long laugh .

" For mercy 's sake what 's the matter ? "[256-archer]

" Nothing 's the matter , except that [I]256-archer 'm going to be married in a month . "[256-archer]

[Janey]264-janey fell upon [his]256-archer neck and pressed [him]256-archer to [her]869-his sister purple flannel breast . " Oh [Newland]215-archer , how wonderful ! [I]264-janey 'm so glad ! But , [dearest]4517-dearest , why do [you]215-archer keep on laughing ? Do hush , or [you]215-archer 'll wake [Mamma]245-mamma . "[264-janey]

Book II

XIX .

The day was fresh , with a lively spring wind full of dust . [All the old ladies in [both families]2093-both families]2092-all the old ladies in both families had got out [their]2092-all the old ladies in both families faded sables and yellowing ermines , and the smell of camphor from the front pews almost smothered the faint spring scent of the lilies banking the altar .

[Newland Archer]215-archer , at a signal from [the sexton]2094-the sexton , had come out of [the vestry]2095-the vestry and placed [himself]215-archer with [[his]256-archer best man]2096-his best man on [the chancel step of [Grace Church]99-grace church]2097-the chancel step of grace church .

The signal meant that the brougham bearing [the bride]2098-the bride and [[her]2098-the bride father]1687-her father was in sight ; but there was sure to be a considerable interval of adjustment and consultation in [the lobby]1700-the lobby , where [the bridesmaids]2101-the bridesmaids were already hovering like a cluster of Easter blossoms . During this unavoidable lapse of time [the bridegroom]2102-the bridegroom , in proof of [his]2102-the bridegroom eagerness , was expected to expose [himself]2102-the bridegroom alone to the gaze of [the assembled company]2103-the assembled company ; and [Archer]215-archer had gone through this formality as resignedly as through all the others which made of a nineteenth century [New York]2-new york wedding a rite that seemed to belong to the dawn of history . Everything was equally easy -- or equally painful , as [one]503-one chose to put it -- in the path [he]256-archer was committed to tread , and [he]256-archer had obeyed the flurried injunctions of [[his]256-archer best man]2096-his best man as piously as [other bridegrooms]2106-other bridegrooms had obeyed [his]256-archer own , in the days when [he]256-archer had guided [them]2106-other bridegrooms through the same labyrinth .

So far [he]256-archer was reasonably sure of having fulfilled all [his]256-archer obligations . [The bridesmaids]2101-the bridesmaids ' eight bouquets of white lilac and lilies - of - [the - valley]549-the - valley had been sent in due time , as well as the gold and sapphire sleeve - links of [the eight ushers]2109-the eight ushers and [the best man]2110-the best man 's cat's - eye scarf - pin ; [Archer]215-archer had sat up half the night trying to vary the wording of [his]256-archer thanks for the last batch of presents from [men friends]2111-men friends and [ex - lady - loves]2112-ex - lady - loves ; the fees for [the Bishop]2113-the bishop and [the Rector]2114-the rector were safely in the pocket of [[his]256-archer best man]2096-his best man ; [his]256-archer own luggage was already at [[Mrs. Manson Mingott]217-mrs. manson mingott 's]2116-mrs. manson mingott 's , where the wedding - breakfast was to take place , and so were the travelling clothes into which [he]256-archer was to change ; and a private compartment had been engaged in [the train that was to carry [the young couple]2118-the young couple to]2117-the train that was to carry the young couple to [[their]2118-the young couple unknown destination]2119-their unknown destination -- concealment of the spot in which the bridal night was to be spent being one of the most sacred taboos of the prehistoric ritual .

" Got the ring all right ? "[417-young van der luyden newland , who was inexperienced in the duties of a best man , and awed by the weight of his responsibility] whispered [young van der Luyden Newland , who was inexperienced in the duties of [a best man]2120-a best man , and awed by the weight of [his]417-young van der luyden newland , who was inexperienced in the duties of a best man , and awed by the weight of his responsibility responsibility]417-young van der luyden newland , who was inexperienced in the duties of a best man , and awed by the weight of his responsibility .

[Archer]215-archer made the gesture which [he]256-archer had seen so many [bridegrooms]2121-bridegrooms make : with [his]256-archer ungloved right hand [he]256-archer felt in the pocket of [his]256-archer dark grey waistcoat , and assured [himself]256-archer that the little gold circlet ( engraved inside : [Newland]215-archer to May , April --- , 187- ) was in its place ; then , resuming [his]256-archer former attitude , [his]256-archer tall hat and pearl - grey gloves with black stitchings grasped in [his]256-archer left hand , [he]256-archer stood looking at the door of [the church]2122-the church .

Overhead , [Handel]418-handel 's March swelled pompously through the imitation stone vaulting , carrying on its waves the faded drift of the many weddings at which , with cheerful indifference , [he]256-archer had stood on the same chancel step watching [other brides]2123-other brides float up [the nave]2124-the nave toward [other bridegrooms]2106-other bridegrooms .

" How like a first night at [the Opera]502-the opera ! "[256-archer] [he]256-archer thought , recognising all the same faces in the same boxes ( no , pews ) , and wondering if , when the Last Trump sounded , [Mrs. Selfridge Merry]419-mrs. selfridge merry would be there with the same towering ostrich feathers in [her]419-mrs. selfridge merry bonnet , and [Mrs. Beaufort]231-beaufort with the same diamond earrings and the same smile -- and whether suitable proscenium seats were already prepared for [them]2126-them in [another world]2127-another world .

After that there was still time to review , one by one , [the familiar countenances in the first rows]2128-the familiar countenances in the first rows ; [the women]2129-the women 's sharp with curiosity and excitement , [the men]1249-the men 's sulky with the obligation of having to put on [their]1249-the men frock - coats before luncheon , and fight for food at the wedding - breakfast .

" Too bad the breakfast is at [old [Catherine]406-old catherine 's]4718-old catherine 's , "[2102-the bridegroom] [the bridegroom]2102-the bridegroom could fancy [Reggie Chivers]393-reggie chivers saying . " But [I]256-archer 'm told that [Lovell Mingott]218-mrs. lovell mingott insisted on its being cooked by [[his]218-mrs. lovell mingott own chef]4719-his own chef , so it ought to be good if [one]503-one can only get at it . "[256-archer] And [he]256-archer could imagine [Sillerton Jackson]225-mr. jackson adding with authority : " [[My]225-mr. jackson dear fellow]4074-my dear fellow , have n't [you]215-archer heard ? It 's to be served at small tables , in the new English fashion . "[225-mr. jackson]

[Archer]215-archer 's eyes lingered a moment on the left - hand pew , where [[his]256-archer mother]512-his mother , who had entered [the church]2122-the church on [Mr. Henry van der Luyden]302-mr. van der luyden 's arm , sat weeping softly under [her]512-his mother Chantilly veil , [her]512-his mother hands in [[her]512-his mother grandmother]834-her grandmother 's ermine muff .

" [Poor Janey]420-janey ! "[256-archer] [he]256-archer thought , looking at [[his]256-archer sister]869-his sister , " even by screwing [her]420-janey head around [she]420-janey can see only the people in the few front pews ; and [they]4722-they 're mostly dowdy [Newlands]44-newlands and [Dagonets]295-the dagonets . "[256-archer]

On the hither side of the white ribbon dividing off the seats reserved for the families [he]256-archer saw [Beaufort]231-beaufort , tall and redfaced , scrutinising [the women]2129-the women with [his]256-archer arrogant stare . Beside [him]256-archer sat [[his]256-archer wife]553-his wife , all silvery chinchilla and violets ; and on the far side of the ribbon , [Lawrence Lefferts]224-lawrence lefferts 's sleekly brushed head seemed to mount guard over the invisible deity of " [Good Form "[224-lawrence lefferts] who presided at the ceremony]4723-good form " who presided at the ceremony .

[Archer]215-archer wondered how many flaws [Lefferts]224-lawrence lefferts 's keen eyes would discover in the ritual of [his]224-lawrence lefferts divinity ; then [he]256-archer suddenly recalled that [he]256-archer too had once thought such questions important . The things that had filled [his]256-archer days seemed now like a nursery parody of life , or like the wrangles of [mediaeval schoolmen]2138-mediaeval schoolmen over metaphysical terms that [nobody]3966-nobody had ever understood . A stormy discussion as to whether the wedding presents should be " shown "[2140-grown - up people] had darkened the last hours before the wedding ; and it seemed inconceivable to [Archer]215-archer that [grown - up people]2140-grown - up people should work [themselves]2140-grown - up people into a state of agitation over such trifles , and that the matter should have been decided ( in the negative ) by [Mrs. Welland]219-mrs. welland 's saying , with indignant tears : " [I]219-mrs. welland should as soon turn [the reporters]4724-the reporters loose in [[my]219-mrs. welland house]4209-my house . "[219-mrs. welland] Yet there was a time when [Archer]215-archer had had definite and rather aggressive opinions on all such problems , and when everything concerning the manners and customs of [[his]256-archer little tribe]2141-his little tribe had seemed to [him]256-archer fraught with world - wide significance .

" And all the while , [I]256-archer suppose , "[256-archer] [he]256-archer thought , " [real people]4726-real people were living somewhere , and real things happening to [them]4726-real people ... "[256-archer]

" THERE [THEY]4726-real people COME ! "[2110-the best man] breathed [the best man]2110-the best man excitedly ; but [the bridegroom]2102-the bridegroom knew better .

The cautious opening of the door of [the church]2122-the church meant only that [Mr. Brown]421-mr. brown [the livery - stable keeper ( gowned in black in [his]421-mr. brown intermittent character of sexton]2145-the livery - stable keeper ( gowned in black in his intermittent character of sexton ) was taking a preliminary survey of the scene before marshalling [his]421-mr. brown forces . The door was softly shut again ; then after another interval it swung majestically open , and a murmur ran through [the church]2122-the church : " [The family]532-the family ! "[421-mr. brown]

[Mrs. Welland]219-mrs. welland came first , on the arm of [[her]219-mrs. welland eldest son]2147-her eldest son . [Her]219-mrs. welland large pink face was appropriately solemn , and [her]219-mrs. welland plum - coloured satin with pale blue side - panels , and blue ostrich plumes in a small satin bonnet , met with general approval ; but before [she]219-mrs. welland had settled [herself]219-mrs. welland with a stately rustle in the pew opposite [Mrs. Archer]215-archer 's [the spectators]2148-the spectators were craning [their]2148-the spectators necks to see who was coming after [her]219-mrs. welland . Wild rumours had been abroad the day before to the effect that [Mrs. Manson Mingott]217-mrs. manson mingott , in spite of [her]217-mrs. manson mingott physical disabilities , had resolved on being present at the ceremony ; and the idea was so much in keeping with [her]217-mrs. manson mingott sporting character that bets ran high at the clubs as to [her]217-mrs. manson mingott being able to walk up [the nave]2124-the nave and squeeze into a seat . It was known that [she]217-mrs. manson mingott had insisted on sending [[her]217-mrs. manson mingott own carpenter]2150-her own carpenter to look into the possibility of taking down the end panel of the front pew , and to measure the space between the seat and the front ; but the result had been discouraging , and for one anxious day [[her]217-mrs. manson mingott family]1193-her family had watched [her]217-mrs. manson mingott dallying with the plan of being wheeled up [the nave]2124-the nave in [her]217-mrs. manson mingott enormous Bath chair and sitting enthroned in it at the foot of [the chancel]2153-the chancel .

The idea of this monstrous exposure of [[her]217-mrs. manson mingott person]2154-her person was so painful to [[her]217-mrs. manson mingott relations]1461-her relations that [they]1461-her relations could have covered with gold [the ingenious person who suddenly discovered that the chair was too wide to pass between the iron uprights of the awning which extended from [the church]2122-the church door to the curbstone]2156-the ingenious person who suddenly discovered that the chair was too wide to pass between the iron uprights of the awning which extended from the church door to the curbstone . The idea of doing away with this awning , and revealing [the bride]2098-the bride to [the mob of [dressmakers]2160-dressmakers and [newspaper reporters who stood outside fighting to get near the joints of the canvas]2161-newspaper reporters who stood outside fighting to get near the joints of the canvas]2159-the mob of dressmakers and newspaper reporters who stood outside fighting to get near the joints of the canvas , exceeded even [old Catherine]406-old catherine 's courage , though for a moment [she]217-mrs. manson mingott had weighed the possibility . " Why , [they]1461-her relations might take a photograph of [[my]219-mrs. welland child]4006-my child AND PUT IT IN THE PAPERS ! "[219-mrs. welland] [Mrs. Welland]219-mrs. welland exclaimed when [[her]219-mrs. welland mother]587-her mother 's last plan was hinted to [her]219-mrs. welland ; and from this unthinkable indecency [the clan]1479-the clan recoiled with a collective shudder . [The ancestress]841-the ancestress had had to give in ; but [her]217-mrs. manson mingott concession was bought only by the promise that the wedding - breakfast should take place under [her]217-mrs. manson mingott roof , though ( as the [Washington]112-washington Square connection said ) with [[the Wellands]321-the wellands ' house]2165-the wellands ' house in easy reach it was hard to have to make a special price with [Brown]421-mr. brown to drive one to [the other end of nowhere]2166-the other end of nowhere .

Though all these transactions had been widely reported by [the Jacksons]288-the jacksons a sporting minority still clung to the belief that [old Catherine]406-old catherine would appear in [church]1398-church , and there was a distinct lowering of the temperature when [she]406-old catherine was found to have been replaced by [[her]587-her mother daughter - in - law]533-her daughter - in - law . [Mrs. Lovell Mingott]218-mrs. lovell mingott had the high colour and glassy stare induced in ladies of [her]217-mrs. manson mingott age and habit by the effort of getting into a new dress ; but once the disappointment occasioned by [[her]217-mrs. manson mingott mother - in - law]2169-her mother - in - law 's non - appearance had subsided , it was agreed that [her]217-mrs. manson mingott black Chantilly over lilac satin , with a bonnet of Parma violets , formed the happiest contrast to [Mrs. Welland]219-mrs. welland 's blue and plum - colour . Far different was the impression produced by [the gaunt and mincing lady who followed on [Mr. Mingott]238-mr. mingott 's arm]2170-the gaunt and mincing lady who followed on mr. mingott 's arm , in a wild dishevelment of stripes and fringes and floating scarves ; and as [this last apparition]2171-this last apparition glided into view [Archer]215-archer 's heart contracted and stopped beating .

[He]238-mr. mingott had taken it for granted that [the Marchioness Manson]316-the marchioness manson was still in [Washington]112-washington , where [she]316-the marchioness manson had gone some four weeks previously with [[her]316-the marchioness manson niece]2058-her niece , [Madame Olenska]241-madame olenska . " [Newland]215-archer -- [I]2110-the best man say : [SHE]2098-the bride 'S HERE ! "[2110-the best man] [the best man]2110-the best man whispered .

[Archer]215-archer roused [himself]215-archer with a start .

A long time had apparently passed since [his]238-mr. mingott heart had stopped beating , for [the white and rosy procession]2186-the white and rosy procession was in fact half way up [the nave]2124-the nave , [the Bishop]2113-the bishop , [the Rector]2114-the rector and [two white - winged assistants]2190-two white - winged assistants were hovering about the flower - banked altar , and the first chords of the Spohr symphony were strewing their flower - like notes before [the bride]2098-the bride .

[Archer]215-archer opened [his]238-mr. mingott eyes ( but could they really have been shut , as [he]238-mr. mingott imagined ? ) , and felt [his]238-mr. mingott heart beginning to resume its usual task . The music , the scent of the lilies on [the altar]2192-the altar , the vision of the cloud of tulle and orange - blossoms floating nearer and nearer , the sight of [Mrs. Archer]215-archer 's face suddenly convulsed with happy sobs , the low benedictory murmur of [the Rector]2114-the rector 's voice , the ordered evolutions of [the eight pink bridesmaids]2194-the eight pink bridesmaids and [the eight black ushers]2195-the eight black ushers : all these sights , sounds and sensations , so familiar in themselves , so unutterably strange and meaningless in [his]238-mr. mingott new relation to them , were confusedly mingled in [his]238-mr. mingott brain .

" [[My]238-mr. mingott God]3960-my god , "[238-mr. mingott] [he]238-mr. mingott thought , " HAVE [I]238-mr. mingott got the ring?"--and[238-mr. mingott] once more [he]238-mr. mingott went through [the bridegroom]2102-the bridegroom 's convulsive gesture .

" Dearly beloved , [we]4730-we are gathered together here , "[2114-the rector] [the Rector]2114-the rector began ...

" [Your]215-archer arm -- [I]215-archer SAY , GIVE [HER]226-may [YOUR]215-archer ARM ! "[215-archer] [young Newland]215-archer nervously hissed ; and once more [Archer]215-archer became aware of having been adrift far off in [the unknown]2201-the unknown . " [Darling]4645-darling ! Every detail of the day had been so carefully thought out that [the young couple]2118-the young couple , after the wedding - breakfast , had ample time to put on [their]2118-the young couple travelling - clothes , descend the wide Mingott stairs between [laughing bridesmaids]2212-laughing bridesmaids and [weeping parents]2213-weeping parents , and get into the brougham under the traditional shower of rice and satin slippers ; and there was still half an hour left in which to drive to [the station]1868-the station , buy the last weeklies at the bookstall with the air of [seasoned travellers]2215-seasoned travellers , and settle [themselves]2118-the young couple in [the reserved compartment in which [[May]226-may 's maid]2217-may 's maid]2216-the reserved compartment in which may 's maid had already placed [her]2217-may 's maid dove - coloured travelling cloak and glaringly new dressing - bag from [London]81-london .

[The old du Lac aunts at [Rhinebeck]98-rhinebeck]2218-the old du lac aunts at rhinebeck had put [[their]2218-the old du lac aunts at rhinebeck house]2219-their house at the disposal of [the bridal couple]2220-the bridal couple , with a readiness inspired by the prospect of spending a week in [New York]2-new york with [Mrs. Archer]215-archer ; and [Archer]215-archer , glad to escape the usual " bridal suite "[215-archer] in [a [Philadelphia]32-philadelphia or [Baltimore]52-baltimore hotel]2221-a philadelphia or baltimore hotel , had accepted with an equal alacrity .

[May]226-may was enchanted at the idea of going to [the country]1743-the country , and childishly amused at the vain efforts of [the eight bridesmaids]2223-the eight bridesmaids to discover where [[their]2223-the eight bridesmaids mysterious retreat was situated]2224-their mysterious retreat was situated . It was thought " very English "[601-no one] to have [a country - house]2225-a country - house lent to one , and the fact gave a last touch of distinction to what was generally conceded to be the most brilliant wedding of the year ; but where [the house]516-the house was [no one]601-no one was permitted to know , except [the parents of [bride]2229-bride and [groom]2230-groom]2228-the parents of bride and groom , who , when taxed with the knowledge , pursed [their]2228-the parents of bride and groom lips and said mysteriously : " Ah , [they]2228-the parents of bride and groom did n't tell [us--]4734-us-- "[2228-the parents of bride and groom] which was manifestly true , since there was no need to .

Once [they]2223-the eight bridesmaids were settled in [[their]2223-the eight bridesmaids compartment]2231-their compartment , and [the train]2232-the train , shaking off the endless wooden suburbs , had pushed out into the pale landscape of spring , talk became easier than [Archer]215-archer had expected . [May]226-may was still , in look and tone , [the simple girl of yesterday]2233-the simple girl of yesterday , eager to compare notes with [him]2234-he as to the incidents of the wedding , and discussing [them]2235-them as impartially as [a bridesmaid]2236-a bridesmaid talking it all over with [an usher]2237-an usher . At first [Archer]215-archer had fancied that this detachment was the disguise of an inward tremor ; but [her]226-may clear eyes revealed only the most tranquil unawareness . [She]226-may was alone for the first time with [[her]226-may husband]645-her husband ; but [[her]226-may husband]645-her husband was only [the charming comrade of yesterday]2240-the charming comrade of yesterday . There was [no one whom [she]226-may liked as much]2241-no one whom she liked as much , [no one whom [she]226-may trusted as completely]2242-no one whom she trusted as completely , and [the culminating " lark "[2243-the culminating " lark " of the whole delightful adventure of engagement and marriage] of the whole delightful adventure of engagement and marriage]2243-the culminating " lark " of the whole delightful adventure of engagement and marriage was to be off with [him]645-her husband alone on a journey , like [a grownup person]2244-a grownup person , like [a " married woman]4735-a " married woman , "[4735-a " married woman] in fact .

It was wonderful that -- as [he]2234-he had learned in [the Mission garden at [St. Augustine]93-st. augustine]2245-the mission garden at st. augustine -- such depths of feeling could coexist with such absence of imagination . But [he]2234-he remembered how , even then , [she]226-may had surprised [him]2234-he by dropping back to inexpressive girlishness as soon as [her]226-may conscience had been eased of its burden ; and [he]2234-he saw that [she]226-may would probably go through life dealing to the best of [her]226-may ability with each experience as it came , but never anticipating any by so much as a stolen glance .

Perhaps that faculty of unawareness was what gave [her]226-may eyes their transparency , and [her]226-may face the look of representing [a type]2246-a type rather than [a person]2247-a person ; as if [she]226-may might have been chosen to pose for a Civic Virtue or [a Greek goddess]2248-a greek goddess . The blood that ran so close to [her]226-may fair skin might have been a preserving fluid rather than a ravaging element ; yet [her]226-may look of indestructible youthfulness made [her]226-may seem neither hard nor dull , but only primitive and pure . " Of course [we]4753-we must dine with [Mrs. Carfry]424-mrs. carfry , dearest , "[215-archer] [Archer]215-archer said ; and [[his]645-her husband wife]553-his wife looked at [him]645-her husband with an anxious frown across the monumental Britannia ware of [[their]2266-their lodging house]2267-their lodging house breakfast - table .

In [all the rainy desert of autumnal [London]81-london]2268-all the rainy desert of autumnal london there were only [two people whom [the Newland Archers]262-the archers knew]2269-two people whom the newland archers knew ; and these two [they]262-the archers had sedulously avoided , in conformity with the old [New York]2-new york tradition that it was not " dignified "[2271-one 's self] to force [[one]503-one 's self]2271-one 's self on the notice of [one 's acquaintances]2272-one 's acquaintances in [foreign countries]2273-foreign countries .

[Mrs. Archer]215-archer and [Janey]420-janey , in the course of [their]2266-their visits to [Europe]17-europe , had so unflinchingly lived up to this principle , and met the friendly advances of [[their]2266-their fellow - travellers]2274-their fellow - travellers with an air of such impenetrable reserve , that [they]2266-their had almost achieved the record of never having exchanged a word with [a " foreigner "[2275-a " foreigner " other than those employed in hotels and railway - stations] other than [those employed in [hotels]2277-hotels and [railway - stations]2278-railway - stations]2276-those employed in hotels and railway - stations]2275-a " foreigner " other than those employed in hotels and railway - stations . But the utmost precautions are sometimes unavailing ; and one night at [Botzen]113-botzen [one of [the two English ladies in [the room across the passage]2283-the room across the passage]2282-the two english ladies in the room across the passage ( whose names , dress and social situation were already intimately known to [Janey]420-janey]2281-one of the two english ladies in the room across the passage ( whose names , dress and social situation were already intimately known to janey ) had knocked on the door and asked if [Mrs. Archer]215-archer had a bottle of liniment . [The other lady]2284-the other lady -- [[the intruder]2285-the intruder 's sister]2286-the intruder 's sister , [Mrs. Carfry]424-mrs. carfry -- had been seized with a sudden attack of bronchitis ; and [Mrs. Archer]215-archer , who never travelled without [a complete family pharmacy]2287-a complete family pharmacy , was fortunately able to produce the required remedy .

[Mrs. Carfry]424-mrs. carfry was very ill , and as [she]424-mrs. carfry and [[her]424-mrs. carfry sister]2288-her sister [Miss Harle]425-miss harle were travelling alone [they]2266-their were profoundly grateful to [[the Archer]2289-the archer ladies , who supplied [them]2266-their with ingenious comforts and [whose efficient maid]2291-whose efficient maid helped to nurse [the invalid]2292-the invalid back to health]2290-the archer ladies , who supplied them with ingenious comforts and whose efficient maid helped to nurse the invalid back to health .

When [the Archers]262-the archers left [Botzen]113-botzen [they]262-the archers had no idea of ever seeing [Mrs. Carfry]424-mrs. carfry and [Miss Harle]425-miss harle again . Nothing , to [Mrs. Archer]215-archer 's mind , would have been more " undignified "[2295-a " foreigner " to whom one had happened to render an accidental service] than to force [[one]503-one 's self]2271-one 's self on the notice of [a " foreigner "[2295-a " foreigner " to whom one had happened to render an accidental service] to whom [one]503-one had happened to render an accidental service]2295-a " foreigner " to whom one had happened to render an accidental service . With touching fidelity [they]2266-their seized every chance of meeting [Mrs. Archer]215-archer and [Janey]420-janey in the course of [their]2266-their continental travels , and displayed a supernatural acuteness in finding out when [they]2266-their were to pass through [London]81-london on [their]2266-their way to or from [the States]114-the states . The intimacy became indissoluble , and [Mrs. Archer]215-archer and [Janey]420-janey , whenever [they]2266-their alighted at [Brown 's Hotel]115-brown 's hotel , found [themselves]2266-their awaited by [two affectionate friends]2300-two affectionate friends who , like [themselves]2266-their , cultivated ferns in Wardian cases , made macrame lace , read the memoirs of [the Baroness Bunsen]426-the baroness bunsen and had views about [the occupants of [the leading [London]81-london pulpits]2302-the leading london pulpits]2301-the occupants of the leading london pulpits . "[215-archer]
