Of course , "[241-madame olenska] [she]241-madame olenska added gaily , " [I]241-madame olenska should n't have minded half as much if [I]241-madame olenska 'd known [you]2677-her son - in - law were coming . "[241-madame olenska]

Symptoms of a lumbering coquetry became visible in [her]241-madame olenska , and [Archer]256-archer found the strength to break in : " But [Madame Olenska]241-madame olenska -- has [she]241-madame olenska gone to [Newport]105-newport too ? "[256-archer]

[Miss Blenker]452-miss blenker looked at [him]256-archer with surprise . " [Madame Olenska]241-madame olenska -- didn't [you]2677-her son - in - law know [she]241-madame olenska 'd been called away ? "[452-miss blenker]

" Called away?-- "[452-miss blenker]

" Oh , [my]452-miss blenker best parasol ! [I]452-miss blenker lent it to that goose of [a Katie]400-kate merry , because it matched [her]241-madame olenska ribbons , and the careless thing must have dropped it here . [We]4880-we [Blenkers]362-the blenkers are all like that ... [real Bohemians]4881-real bohemians ! "[452-miss blenker] Recovering the sunshade with a powerful hand [she]452-miss blenker unfurled it and suspended its rosy dome above [her]452-miss blenker head . " Yes , [Ellen]233-ellen was called away yesterday : [she]241-madame olenska lets [us]4880-we call [her]233-ellen [Ellen]233-ellen , [you]2677-her son - in - law know . A telegram came from [Boston]147-boston : [she]241-madame olenska said [she]241-madame olenska might be gone for two days . [I]452-miss blenker do LOVE the way [she]241-madame olenska does [her]241-madame olenska hair , do n't [you]2677-her son - in - law ? "[452-miss blenker] [Miss Blenker]452-miss blenker rambled on .

[Archer]256-archer continued to stare through [her]452-miss blenker as though [she]452-miss blenker had been transparent . All [he]256-archer saw was the trumpery parasol that arched its pinkness above [her]452-miss blenker giggling head .

After a moment [he]256-archer ventured : " [You]452-miss blenker do n't happen to know why [Madame Olenska]241-madame olenska went to [Boston]147-boston ? [I]256-archer hope it was not on account of bad news ? "[256-archer]

[Miss Blenker]452-miss blenker took this with a cheerful incredulity . " Oh , [I]452-miss blenker do n't believe so . [She]241-madame olenska did n't tell [us]4882-us what was in the telegram . [I]452-miss blenker think [she]241-madame olenska did n't want [the Marchioness]2030-the marchioness to know . [She]241-madame olenska 's so romantic - looking , is n't [she]241-madame olenska ? Does n't [she]241-madame olenska remind [you]256-archer of [Mrs. Scott - Siddons]453-mrs. scott - siddons when [she]241-madame olenska reads ' [Lady Geraldine]454-lady geraldine 's Courtship ' ? Did [you]256-archer never hear [her]241-madame olenska ? "[452-miss blenker]

[Archer]256-archer was dealing hurriedly with crowding thoughts . [His]256-archer whole future seemed suddenly to be unrolled before [him]256-archer ; and passing down its endless emptiness [he]256-archer saw the dwindling figure of [a man to whom nothing was ever to happen]2749-a man to whom nothing was ever to happen . [He]256-archer glanced about [him]256-archer at [the unpruned garden]2750-the unpruned garden , [the tumble - down house]2751-the tumble - down house , and [the oak - grove under which the dusk]2752-the oak - grove under which the dusk was gathering . It had seemed so exactly the place in which [he]256-archer ought to have found [Madame Olenska]241-madame olenska ; and [she]241-madame olenska was far away , and even the pink sunshade was not [hers]241-madame olenska ...

[He]256-archer frowned and hesitated . " [You]452-miss blenker do n't know , [I]256-archer suppose -- [I]256-archer shall be in [Boston]147-boston tomorrow . If [I]256-archer could manage to see [her--]241-madame olenska "[256-archer]

[He]256-archer felt that [Miss Blenker]452-miss blenker was losing interest in [him]256-archer , though [her]452-miss blenker smile persisted . " Oh , of course ; how lovely of [you]256-archer ! [She]452-miss blenker 's staying at [the Parker House]4884-the parker house ; it must be horrible there in this weather . "[452-miss blenker]

After that [Archer]256-archer was but intermittently aware of the remarks [they]2753-they exchanged . [He]256-archer could only remember stoutly resisting [her]452-miss blenker entreaty that [he]256-archer should await [the returning family]2754-the returning family and have high tea with [them]2754-the returning family before [he]256-archer drove [home]631-home . At length , with [[his]256-archer hostess]1243-his hostess still at [his]256-archer side , [he]256-archer passed out of range of [the wooden Cupid]2757-the wooden cupid , unfastened [his]256-archer horses and drove off . At the turn of [the lane]2719-the lane [he]256-archer saw [Miss Blenker]452-miss blenker standing at the gate and waving the pink parasol .

XXIII .

The next morning , when [Archer]256-archer got out of [the Fall River train]2759-the fall river train , [he]256-archer emerged upon [a steaming midsummer [Boston]147-boston]2760-a steaming midsummer boston . [[The streets]4186-the streets near [the station]1868-the station]2762-the streets near the station were full of the smell of beer and coffee and decaying fruit and a shirt - sleeved populace moved through [them]2762-the streets near the station with the intimate abandon of [boarders]2764-boarders going down [the passage]1854-the passage to [the bathroom]2766-the bathroom .

[Archer]256-archer found [a cab]2767-a cab and drove to [the Somerset Club]2768-the somerset club for breakfast . Even [the fashionable quarters]2769-the fashionable quarters had the air of untidy domesticity to which no excess of heat ever degrades [the European cities]2770-the european cities . [Care - takers]2771-care - takers in calico lounged on the door - steps of [the wealthy]2772-the wealthy , and [the Common]2773-the common looked like [a pleasure - ground on the morrow of a Masonic picnic]2774-a pleasure - ground on the morrow of a masonic picnic . If [Archer]256-archer had tried to imagine [Ellen Olenska]233-ellen in improbable scenes [he]256-archer could not have called up any into which it was more difficult to fit [her]233-ellen than this heat - prostrated and deserted [Boston]147-boston .

[He]256-archer breakfasted with appetite and method , beginning with a slice of melon , and studying a morning paper while [he]256-archer waited for [his]256-archer toast and scrambled eggs . A new sense of energy and activity had possessed [him]256-archer ever since [he]256-archer had announced to [May]226-may the night before that [he]256-archer had business in [Boston]147-boston , and should take the Fall River boat that night and go on to [New York]2-new york the following evening . It had always been understood that [he]256-archer would return to [town]1110-town early in the week , and when [he]256-archer got back from [his]256-archer expedition to [Portsmouth]132-portsmouth a letter from [the office]1759-the office , which fate had conspicuously placed on a corner of the hall table , sufficed to justify [his]256-archer sudden change of plan . [He]256-archer was even ashamed of the ease with which the whole thing had been done : it reminded [him]256-archer , for an uncomfortable moment , of [Lawrence Lefferts]224-lawrence lefferts 's masterly contrivances for securing [his]256-archer freedom . But this did not long trouble [him]256-archer , for [he]256-archer was not in an analytic mood .

After breakfast [he]256-archer smoked a cigarette and glanced over [the Commercial Advertiser]2777-the commercial advertiser . While [he]256-archer was thus engaged [two or three men [he]256-archer knew]2778-two or three men he knew came in , and the usual greetings were exchanged : it was [the same world]2779-the same world after all , though [he]256-archer had such a queer sense of having slipped through the meshes of time and space .

[He]256-archer looked at [his]256-archer watch , and finding that it was half - past nine got up and went into [the writing - room]2780-the writing - room . There [he]256-archer wrote a few lines , and ordered [a messenger]2781-a messenger to take a cab to [the Parker House]156-the parker house and wait for the answer . [He]256-archer then sat down behind another newspaper and tried to calculate how long it would take [a cab]2767-a cab to get to [the Parker House]156-the parker house .

" [The lady]663-the lady was out , [sir]4062-sir , "[256-archer] [he]256-archer suddenly heard [a waiter]2783-a waiter 's voice at [his]256-archer elbow ; and [he]256-archer stammered : " Out?-- "[256-archer] as if it were a word in a strange language .

[He]256-archer got up and went into [the hall]736-the hall . It must be a mistake : [she]2785-her could not be out at that hour . [He]256-archer flushed with anger at [his]256-archer own stupidity : why had [he]256-archer not sent the note as soon as [he]256-archer arrived ?

[He]256-archer found [his]256-archer hat and stick and went forth into [the street]1900-the street . [The city]2787-the city had suddenly become as strange and vast and empty as if [he]256-archer were [a traveller from [distant lands]2789-distant lands]2788-a traveller from distant lands . For a moment [he]256-archer stood on the door - step hesitating ; then [he]256-archer decided to go to [the Parker House]4884-the parker house . What if [the messenger]2791-the messenger had been misinformed , and [she]2785-her were still [there]713-there ?

[He]256-archer started to walk across [the Common]2773-the common ; and on the first bench , under a tree , [he]256-archer saw [her]2785-her sitting . [She]2785-her had a grey silk sunshade over [her]2785-her head -- how could [he]256-archer ever have imagined [her]2785-her with a pink one ? As [he]256-archer approached [he]256-archer was struck by [her]2785-her listless attitude : [she]2785-her sat there as if [she]2785-her had nothing else to do . [He]256-archer saw [her]2785-her drooping profile , and the knot of hair fastened low in the neck under [her]2785-her dark hat , and the long wrinkled glove on the hand that held the sunshade . [He]256-archer came a step or two nearer , and [she]2785-her turned and looked at [him]256-archer .

" [Oh"--she]4887-oh"--she[2785-her] said ; and for the first time [he]256-archer noticed a startled look on [her]2785-her face ; but in another moment it gave way to a slow smile of wonder and contentment .

" [Oh"--she]4888-oh"--she[256-archer] murmured again , on a different note , as [he]256-archer stood looking down at [her]2785-her ; and without rising [she]2785-her made a place for [him]256-archer on the bench .

" [I]256-archer 'm here on business -- just got here , "[256-archer] [Archer]256-archer explained ; and , without knowing why , [he]256-archer suddenly began to feign astonishment at seeing [her]2785-her . " But what on earth are [you]2785-her doing in [this wilderness]4889-this wilderness ? "[256-archer] [He]256-archer had really no idea what [he]256-archer was saying : [he]256-archer felt as if [he]256-archer were shouting at [her]2785-her across endless distances , and [she]2785-her might vanish again before [he]256-archer could overtake [her]2785-her .

" [I]2785-her ? Oh , [I]2785-her 'm here on business too , "[2785-her] [she]2785-her answered , turning [her]2785-her head toward [him]256-archer so that [they]2794-they were face to face . The words hardly reached [him]256-archer : [he]256-archer was aware only of [her]2785-her voice , and of the startling fact that not an echo of it had remained in [his]256-archer memory . [He]256-archer had not even remembered that it was low - pitched , with a faint roughness on the consonants .

" [You]2785-her do [your]2785-her hair differently , "[256-archer] [he]256-archer said , [his]256-archer heart beating as if [he]256-archer had uttered something irrevocable .

" Differently ? No -- it 's only that [I]2785-her do it as best [I]2785-her can when [I]2785-her 'm without [Nastasia]336-nastasia . "[2785-her]

" [Nastasia]336-nastasia ; but is n't [she]2785-her with [you]256-archer ? "[2785-her]

" No ; [I]2785-her 'm alone . For two days it was not worth while to bring [her]2785-her . "[2785-her]

" [You]256-archer 're alone -- at [the Parker House]4884-the parker house ? "[2785-her]

[She]2785-her looked at [him]256-archer with a flash of [her]2785-her old malice . " Does it strike [you]256-archer as dangerous ? "[2785-her]

" No ; not dangerous-- "[2785-her]

" But unconventional ? [I]2785-her see ; [I]2785-her suppose it is . "[2785-her] [She]2785-her considered a moment . " [I]2785-her had n't thought of it , because [I]2785-her 've just done something so much more unconventional . "[2785-her] The faint tinge of irony lingered in [her]2785-her eyes . " [I]2785-her 've just refused to take back a sum of money -- that belonged to [me]2785-her . "[2785-her]

[Archer]256-archer sprang up and moved a step or two away . [She]2785-her had furled [her]2785-her parasol and sat absently drawing patterns on the gravel . Presently [he]256-archer came back and stood before [her]2785-her .

" [Some one]669-some one -- has come here to meet [you]2785-her ? "[2785-her]

" Yes . "[256-archer]

" With this offer ? "[2785-her]

[She]2785-her nodded .

" And [you]256-archer refused -- because of the conditions ? "[256-archer]

" [I]2785-her refused , "[2785-her] [she]2785-her said after a moment .

[He]256-archer sat down by [her]2785-her again . " What were the conditions ? "[256-archer]

" Oh , they were not onerous : just to sit at the head of [his]256-archer table now and then . "[256-archer]

There was another interval of silence . [Archer]256-archer 's heart had slammed itself shut in the queer way it had , and [he]256-archer sat vainly groping for a word .

" [He]256-archer wants [you]2785-her back -- at any price ? "[256-archer]

" Well -- a considerable price . At least the sum is considerable for [me]256-archer . "[256-archer]

[He]256-archer paused again , beating about the question [he]256-archer felt [he]256-archer must put .

" It was to meet [him]256-archer here that [you]2785-her came ? "[256-archer]

[She]2785-her stared , and then burst into a laugh . " Meet [him]256-archer -- [[my]2785-her husband]4101-my husband ? HERE ? At this season [he]256-archer 's always at [Cowes]68-cowes or [Baden]158-baden . "[2785-her]

" [He]256-archer sent some one ? "[256-archer]

" Yes . "[2785-her]

" With a letter ? "[256-archer]

[She]2785-her shook [her]2785-her head . " No ; just a message . [He]256-archer never writes . [I]2785-her do n't think [I]2785-her 've had more than one letter from [him]256-archer . "[2785-her] The allusion brought the colour to [her]2785-her cheek , and it reflected itself in [Archer]256-archer 's vivid blush .

" Why does [he]256-archer never write ? "[2785-her]

" Why should [he]256-archer ? What does [one]503-one have [secretaries]4894-secretaries for ? "[2785-her]

[The young man]511-the young man 's blush deepened . [She]2785-her had pronounced the word as if it had no more significance than any other in [her]2785-her vocabulary . "[511-the young man] But the remembrance of [Count Olenski]278-count olenski 's only letter to [[his]278-count olenski wife]553-his wife was too present to [him]511-the young man . [He]511-the young man paused again , and then took another plunge .

" And the person?"--[511-the young man]

" [The emissary]4896-the emissary ? " And [you]241-madame olenska came out here to think the chance over ? "[511-the young man]

[They]2797-we sat silent , not looking at [each other]558-each other , but straight ahead at [the people passing along [the path]2800-the path]2799-the people passing along the path . " This is horrible . Why should n't [we]2797-we go out a little on [the bay]2535-the bay ? There 's a breeze , and it will be cooler . " [Oh"--she]4905-oh"--she[511-the young man] murmured again . " Then [you]511-the young man must come at once . "[511-the young man]

" To get away from [me]241-madame olenska as far as [you]511-the young man could ? "[241-madame olenska]

[He]511-the young man laughed out again , this time in boyish satisfaction . " Well , [you]511-the young man see it 's no use . " [[Our]4913-we boat]4914-our boat ? "[241-madame olenska] [She]241-madame olenska frowned perplexedly , and then smiled . " Oh , but [I]241-madame olenska must go back to [the hotel]4898-the hotel first : [I]241-madame olenska must leave a note-- "[241-madame olenska]

" As many notes as [you]511-the young man please . [You]511-the young man can write here . "[511-the young man] [He]511-the young man drew out a note - case and one of the new stylographic pens . " [I]511-the young man 've even got an envelope -- [you]511-the young man see how everything 's predestined ! [They]2802-the passersby have to be humoured ; wait-- "[511-the young man] [He]511-the young man banged the hand that held the pen against the back of the bench . " It 's like jerking down the mercury in a thermometer : just a trick . Now try-- "[511-the young man]

[She]241-madame olenska laughed , and bending over the sheet of paper which [he]511-the young man had laid on [his]511-the young man note - case , began to write . [Archer]256-archer walked away a few steps , staring with radiant unseeing eyes at [the passersby]2802-the passersby , who , in [their]2802-the passersby turn , paused to stare at the unwonted sight of [a fashionably - dressed lady writing a note on [her]2803-a fashionably - dressed lady writing a note on her knee on a bench in the common knee on a bench in [the Common]2773-the common]2803-a fashionably - dressed lady writing a note on her knee on a bench in the common .

[Madame Olenska]241-madame olenska slipped the sheet into the envelope , wrote a name on it , and put it into [her]241-madame olenska pocket . Then [she]241-madame olenska too stood up .

[They]2805-they walked back toward [Beacon Street]160-beacon street , and near [the club]1418-the club [Archer]256-archer caught sight of the plush - lined " herdic "[241-madame olenska] which had carried [his]511-the young man note to [the Parker House]156-the parker house , and whose driver was reposing from this effort by bathing [his]511-the young man brow at the corner hydrant .

" [I]2805-they told [you]2805-they everything was predestined ! Here 's [a cab]2767-a cab for [us]2805-they . [You]2805-they see ! "[2805-they] [They]2805-they laughed , astonished at the miracle of picking up a public conveyance at that hour , and in that unlikely spot , in [a city]4172-a city where [cab - stands]2808-cab - stands were still [a " foreign "[2805-they] novelty]2809-a " foreign " novelty .

[Archer]256-archer , looking at [his]256-archer watch , saw that there was time to drive to [the Parker House]156-the parker house before going to [the steamboat landing]2810-the steamboat landing . [They]2805-they rattled through [the hot streets]2811-the hot streets and drew up at the door of [the hotel]4898-the hotel .

[Archer]256-archer held out [his]256-archer hand for the letter . " Shall [I]256-archer take it in ? "[256-archer] [he]256-archer asked ; but [Madame Olenska]241-madame olenska , shaking [her]241-madame olenska head , sprang out and disappeared through the glazed doors . It was barely half - past ten ; but what if [the emissary]4896-the emissary , impatient for [her]241-madame olenska reply , and not knowing how else to employ [his]4896-the emissary time , were already seated among [the travellers with cooling drinks at [their]2814-the travellers with cooling drinks at their elbows of whom archer had caught a glimpse as she went in elbows of whom [Archer]256-archer had caught a glimpse as [she]241-madame olenska went in]2814-the travellers with cooling drinks at their elbows of whom archer had caught a glimpse as she went in ?

[He]256-archer waited , pacing up and down before [the herdic]2815-the herdic . [A Sicilian youth with eyes like [Nastasia]336-nastasia 's]2816-a sicilian youth with eyes like nastasia 's offered to shine [his]2816-a sicilian youth with eyes like nastasia 's boots , and [an Irish matron]2817-an irish matron to sell [him]2816-a sicilian youth with eyes like nastasia 's peaches ; and every few moments the doors opened to let out [hot men with straw hats tilted far back]2818-hot men with straw hats tilted far back , who glanced at [him]256-archer as [they]2818-hot men with straw hats tilted far back went by . [He]256-archer marvelled that the door should open so often , and that [all the people it let out]2819-all the people it let out should look so like [each other]558-each other , and so like [all the other hot men who , at that hour , through the length and breadth of]2821-all the other hot men who , at that hour , through the length and breadth of [the land]1821-the land , were passing continuously in and out of the swinging doors of [hotels]2277-hotels .

And then , suddenly , came a face that [he]256-archer could not relate to the other faces . [He]256-archer caught but a flash of it , for [his]256-archer pacings had carried [him]256-archer to the farthest point of [his]256-archer beat , and it was in turning back to [the hotel]4898-the hotel that [he]256-archer saw , in a group of typical countenances -- [the lank and weary]2825-the lank and weary , [the round and surprised]2826-the round and surprised , the lantern - jawed and mild -- this other face that was so many more things at once , and things so different . It was that of [a young man , pale too , and half - extinguished by the heat]2827-a young man , pale too , and half - extinguished by the heat , or worry , or both , but somehow , quicker , vivider , more conscious ; or perhaps seeming so because [he]2816-a sicilian youth with eyes like nastasia 's was so different . [Archer]256-archer hung a moment on a thin thread of memory , but it snapped and floated off with the disappearing face -- apparently that of [some foreign business man , looking doubly foreign in such a setting]2828-some foreign business man , looking doubly foreign in such a setting . [He]2816-a sicilian youth with eyes like nastasia 's vanished in the stream of [passersby]2829-passersby , and [Archer]256-archer resumed [his]256-archer patrol .

[He]256-archer did not care to be seen watch in hand within view of [the hotel]4898-the hotel , and [his]256-archer unaided reckoning of the lapse of time led [him]256-archer to conclude that , if [Madame Olenska]241-madame olenska was so long in reappearing , it could only be because [she]241-madame olenska had met [the emissary]4896-the emissary and been waylaid by [him]256-archer . At the thought [Archer]256-archer 's apprehension rose to anguish .

" If [she]241-madame olenska does n't come soon [I]256-archer 'll go in and find [her]241-madame olenska , "[256-archer] [he]256-archer said .

The doors swung open again and [she]241-madame olenska was at [his]256-archer side . [They]2832-they got into [the herdic]2815-the herdic , and as it drove off [he]256-archer took out [his]256-archer watch and saw that [she]241-madame olenska had been absent just three minutes . In the clatter of loose windows that made talk impossible [they]2832-they bumped over the disjointed cobblestones to [the wharf]2834-the wharf .

Seated side by side on a bench of [the half - empty boat]2835-the half - empty boat [they]2832-they found that [they]2832-they had hardly anything to say to [each other]558-each other , or rather that what [they]2832-they had to say communicated itself best in the blessed silence of [their]2832-they release and [their]2832-they isolation .

As the paddle - wheels began to turn , and wharves and shipping to recede through the veil of heat , it seemed to [Archer]256-archer that everything in the old familiar world of habit was receding also . [He]256-archer longed to ask [Madame Olenska]241-madame olenska if [she]241-madame olenska did not have the same feeling : the feeling that [they]2832-they were starting on some long voyage from which [they]2832-they might never return . But [he]256-archer was afraid to say it , or anything else that might disturb the delicate balance of [her]241-madame olenska trust in [him]256-archer . In reality [he]256-archer had no wish to betray that trust . There had been days and nights when the memory of [their]2832-they kiss had burned and burned on [his]256-archer lips ; the day before even , on the drive to [Portsmouth]132-portsmouth , the thought of [her]241-madame olenska had run through [him]256-archer like fire ; but now that [she]241-madame olenska was beside [him]256-archer , and [they]2832-they were drifting forth into [this unknown world]2837-this unknown world , [they]2832-they seemed to have reached the kind of deeper nearness that a touch may sunder .

As [the boat]2606-the boat left [the harbour]2839-the harbour and turned seaward a breeze stirred about [them]2832-they and [the bay]2535-the bay broke up into long oily undulations , then into ripples tipped with spray . The fog of sultriness still hung over [the city]2787-the city , but ahead lay a fresh world of ruffled waters , and [distant promontories with light - houses]2842-distant promontories with light - houses in the sun . [Madame Olenska]241-madame olenska , leaning back against the boat - rail , drank in the coolness between parted lips . [She]241-madame olenska had wound a long veil about [her]241-madame olenska hat , but it left [her]241-madame olenska face uncovered , and [Archer]256-archer was struck by the tranquil gaiety of [her]241-madame olenska expression . [She]241-madame olenska seemed to take [their]2832-they adventure as a matter of course , and to be neither in fear of unexpected encounters , nor ( what was worse ) unduly elated by [their]2832-they possibility .

In [the bare dining - room of [the inn]1931-the inn , which [he]256-archer had hoped [they]2832-they would have to [themselves]2832-they]2843-the bare dining - room of the inn , which he had hoped they would have to themselves , [they]2832-they found a strident party of [innocent - looking young men]2845-innocent - looking young men and [women -- school - teachers]2846-women -- school - teachers on a holiday , [the landlord]2847-the landlord told [them]2832-they -- and [Archer]256-archer 's heart sank at the idea of having to talk through [their]2832-they noise .

" This is hopeless -- [I'll]256-archer ask for [a private room]4376-a private room , "[256-archer] [he]256-archer said ; and [Madame Olenska]241-madame olenska , without offering any objection , waited while [he]256-archer went in search of [it]2848-it . [The room]972-the room opened on [a long wooden verandah]2850-a long wooden verandah , with [the sea]2426-the sea coming in at the windows . [It]972-the room was bare and cool , with a table covered with a coarse checkered cloth and adorned by a bottle of pickles and a blueberry pie under a cage . No more guileless - looking cabinet particulier ever offered [its]972-the room shelter to [a clandestine couple]2852-a clandestine couple : [Archer]256-archer fancied [he]256-archer saw the sense of [its]972-the room reassurance in the faintly amused smile with which [Madame Olenska]241-madame olenska sat down opposite to [him]256-archer . [A woman who had run away from [[her]241-madame olenska husband]645-her husband -- and reputedly with [another man]2855-another man -- was likely to have mastered the art of taking things for granted]2853-a woman who had run away from her husband -- and reputedly with another man -- was likely to have mastered the art of taking things for granted ; but something in the quality of [her]241-madame olenska composure took the edge from [his]256-archer irony . By being so quiet , so unsurprised and so simple [she]241-madame olenska had managed to brush away the conventions and make [him]256-archer feel that to seek to be alone was the natural thing for [two old friends who had so much to say to [each other]558-each other]2856-two old friends who had so much to say to each other ....

XXIV .

[They]2856-two old friends who had so much to say to each other lunched slowly and meditatively , with mute intervals between rushes of talk ; for , the spell once broken , [they]2856-two old friends who had so much to say to each other had much to say , and yet moments when saying became the mere accompaniment to long duologues of silence . [Archer]256-archer kept the talk from [his]256-archer own affairs , not with conscious intention but because [he]256-archer did not want to miss a word of [her]241-madame olenska history ; and leaning on the table , [her]241-madame olenska chin resting on [her]241-madame olenska clasped hands , [she]241-madame olenska talked to [him]256-archer of the year and a half since [they]2856-two old friends who had so much to say to each other had met .

[She]241-madame olenska had grown tired of what [people]619-people called " society "[241-madame olenska] ; [New York]2-new york was kind , it was almost oppressively hospitable ; [she]241-madame olenska should never forget the way in which [it]2-new york had welcomed [her]241-madame olenska back ; but after the first flush of novelty [she]241-madame olenska had found [herself]241-madame olenska , as [she]241-madame olenska phrased it , too " different "[241-madame olenska] to care for the things it cared about -- and so [she]241-madame olenska had decided to try [Washington]112-washington , where [one]503-one was supposed to meet more varieties of [people]619-people and of opinion . And on the whole [she]241-madame olenska should probably settle down in [Washington]112-washington , and make a home there for [poor [Medora]441-medora , who had worn out the patience of all [her]441-medora other relations]2861-poor medora , who had worn out the patience of all her other relations just at the time when [she]441-medora most needed looking after and protecting from matrimonial perils .

" But [Dr. Carver]410-dr. carver -- aren't [you]241-madame olenska afraid of [Dr. Carver]410-dr. carver ? [She]241-madame olenska smiled . " Oh , [the Carver]410-dr. carver danger is over . [Dr. Carver]410-dr. carver is [a very clever man]4920-a very clever man . " [A convert]4922-a convert to what ? "[2861-poor medora , who had worn out the patience of all her other relations]

" To all sorts of new and crazy social schemes . "[241-madame olenska]

[Archer]256-archer changed colour . " And [Beaufort]231-beaufort -- do [you]241-madame olenska say these things to [Beaufort]231-beaufort ? "[256-archer] [he]256-archer asked abruptly .

" [I]241-madame olenska have n't seen [him]4930-he for a long time . But [I]241-madame olenska used to ; and [he]4930-he understands . "[241-madame olenska]

" Ah , it 's what [I]256-archer 've always told [you]241-madame olenska ; [you]241-madame olenska do n't like [us]4931-us . "[256-archer] [He]256-archer looked about [the bare room]2862-the bare room and out at [the bare beach]2863-the bare beach and the row of [stark white village houses strung along [the shore]2555-the shore]2864-stark white village houses strung along the shore . " [We]4931-us 're damnably dull . [We]4931-us 've no character , no colour , no variety.--I wonder , "[256-archer] [he]256-archer broke out , " why [you]2866-her do n't go back ? "[256-archer]

[Her]2866-her eyes darkened , and [he]256-archer expected an indignant rejoinder . But [she]2866-her sat silent , as if thinking over what [he]256-archer had said , and [he]256-archer grew frightened lest [she]2866-her should answer that [she]2866-her wondered too .

At length [she]2866-her said : " [I]2866-her believe it 's because of [you]256-archer . "[2866-her]

It was impossible to make the confession more dispassionately , or in a tone less encouraging to the vanity of [the person addressed]2867-the person addressed . [Archer]256-archer reddened to the temples , but dared not move or speak : it was as if [her]2866-her words had been some rare butterfly that the least motion might drive off on startled wings , but that might gather a flock about it if it were left undisturbed .

" At least , "[2866-her] [she]2866-her continued , " it was [you]256-archer who made [me]2866-her understand that under the dullness there are things so fine and sensitive and delicate that even those [I]2866-her most cared for in [my]2866-her other life look cheap in comparison . [I]2866-her do n't know how to explain [myself"--she]2866-her[2866-her] drew together [her]2866-her troubled brows--"but it seems as if [I]2866-her 'd never before understood with how much that is hard and shabby and base the most exquisite pleasures may be paid . "[2866-her]

" Exquisite pleasures -- it 's something to have had them ! "[256-archer] [he]256-archer felt like retorting ; but the appeal in [her]2866-her eyes kept [him]256-archer silent .

" [I]2866-her want , "[2866-her] [she]2866-her went on , " to be perfectly honest with [you]256-archer -- and with [myself]2866-her . For a long time [I]2866-her 've hoped this chance would come : that [I]2866-her might tell [you]256-archer how [you]256-archer 've helped [me]2866-her , what [you]256-archer 've made of [me--]2866-her "[2866-her]

[Archer]256-archer sat staring beneath frowning brows . [He]256-archer interrupted [her]2866-her with a laugh . " And what do [you]256-archer make out that [you]256-archer 've made of [me]256-archer ? "[256-archer]

[She]2866-her paled a little . " Of [you]256-archer ? "[2866-her]

" Yes : for [I]2866-her 'm of [your]256-archer making much more than [you]256-archer ever were of [mine]2866-her . "[2866-her]

[Her]2866-her paleness turned to a fugitive flush . " [I]2866-her thought -- [you]256-archer promised -- [you]256-archer were not to say such things today . "[2866-her]

" Ah -- how like [a woman]4935-a woman ! None of [you]256-archer will ever see a bad business through ! "[2866-her]

[She]2866-her lowered [her]2866-her voice . " IS it a bad business -- for [May]226-may ? "[2866-her]

[He]2868-he stood in the window , drumming against the raised sash , and feeling in every fibre the wistful tenderness with which [she]2866-her had spoken [[her]2866-her cousin]672-her cousin 's name .

" For that 's the thing [we]4936-we 've always got to think of -- haven't [we]4936-we -- by [your]2868-he own showing ? "[2866-her] [she]2866-her insisted .

" [My]2868-he own showing ? "[2868-he] [he]2868-he echoed , [his]2868-he blank eyes still on [the sea]2426-the sea .

" Or if not , "[2866-her] [she]2866-her continued , pursuing [her]2866-her own thought with a painful application , " if it 's not worth while to have given up , to have missed things , so that [others]1554-others may be saved from disillusionment and misery -- then everything [I]2866-her came [home]631-home for , everything that made [my]2866-her other life seem by contrast so bare and so poor because [no one there]4939-no one there took account of [them]4940-them -- all these things are a sham or a dream-- "[2866-her]

[He]2868-he turned around without moving from [his]2868-he place . " And in that case there 's no reason on earth why [you]2866-her should n't go back ? "[2868-he] [he]2868-he concluded for [her]2866-her .

[Her]2866-her eyes were clinging to [him]2868-he desperately . " Oh , IS there no reason ? "[2866-her]

" Not if [you]2866-her staked [your]2866-her all on the success of [my]2868-he marriage . [My]2868-he marriage , "[2868-he] [he]2868-he said savagely , " is n't going to be a sight to keep [you]2866-her here . "[2868-he] [She]2866-her made no answer , and [he]2868-he went on : " What 's the use ? [You]2866-her gave [me]2868-he [my]2868-he first glimpse of a real life , and at the same moment [you]2866-her asked [me]2868-he to go on with a sham one . It 's beyond human enduring -- that 's all . "[2868-he]

" Oh , do n't say that ; when [I]2866-her 'm enduring it ! "[2866-her] [she]2866-her burst out , [her]2866-her eyes filling .

[Her]2866-her arms had dropped along the table , and [she]2866-her sat with [her]2866-her face abandoned to [his]2868-he gaze as if in the recklessness of a desperate peril . The face exposed [her]2866-her as much as if it had been [[her]2866-her whole person]2871-her whole person , with the soul behind it : [Archer]256-archer stood dumb , overwhelmed by what it suddenly told [him]256-archer .

" [You]256-archer too -- oh , all this time , [you]256-archer too ? "[2866-her]

For answer , [she]2866-her let the tears on [her]2866-her lids overflow and run slowly downward .

Half the width of [the room]972-the room was still between [them]2873-them , and [neither]1129-neither made any show of moving . [Archer]256-archer was conscious of a curious indifference to [her]2866-her bodily presence : [he]256-archer would hardly have been aware of it if one of the hands [she]2866-her had flung out on the table had not drawn [his]256-archer gaze as on the occasion when , in [the little Twenty - third Street house]2875-the little twenty - third street house , [he]256-archer had kept [his]256-archer eye on [it]2876-it in order not to look at [her]2866-her face . Now [his]256-archer imagination spun about the hand as about the edge of a vortex ; but still [he]256-archer made no effort to draw nearer . [He]256-archer had known the love that is fed on caresses and feeds them ; but this passion that was closer than [his]256-archer bones was not to be superficially satisfied . [His]256-archer one terror was to do anything which might efface the sound and impression of [her]2866-her words ; [his]256-archer one thought , that [he]256-archer should never again feel quite alone .

But after a moment the sense of waste and ruin overcame [him]256-archer . There [they]2877-they were , close together and safe and shut in ; yet so chained to [their]2877-they separate destinies that [they]2877-they might as well have been half [the world]561-the world apart .

" What 's the use -- when [you]2866-her will go back ? "[256-archer] [he]256-archer broke out , a great hopeless HOW ON [EARTH]161-earth CAN [I]215-archer KEEP [YOU]2866-her ? crying out to [her]2866-her beneath [his]256-archer words .

[She]2866-her sat motionless , with lowered lids . " Oh -- [I]2866-her sha n't go yet ! "[2866-her]

" Not yet ? Some time , then ? Some time that [you]256-archer already foresee ? "[256-archer]

At that [she]2866-her raised [her]2866-her clearest eyes . " [I]2866-her promise [you]256-archer : not as long as [you]256-archer hold out . Not as long as [we]4941-we can look straight at [each other]558-each other like this . "[2866-her]

[He]256-archer dropped into [his]256-archer chair . What [her]2866-her answer really said was : " If [you]256-archer lift a finger [you]256-archer 'll drive [me]2866-her back : back to all the abominations [you]256-archer know of , and all the temptations [you]256-archer half guess . "[2866-her] [He]256-archer understood it as clearly as if [she]2866-her had uttered the words , and the thought kept [him]256-archer anchored to [his]256-archer side of the table in a kind of moved and sacred submission .

" What a life for [you!--]2866-her "[256-archer] [he]256-archer groaned .

" Oh -- as long as it 's a part of [yours]2866-her . "[2866-her]

" And [mine]2866-her a part of [yours]2866-her ? "[2866-her]

[She]2866-her nodded .

" And that 's to be all -- for either of [us]4943-us ? "[256-archer]

" Well ; it IS all , is n't it ? "[2866-her]

At that [he]256-archer sprang up , forgetting everything but the sweetness of [her]2866-her face . [She]2866-her rose too , not as if to meet [him]256-archer or to flee from [him]256-archer , but quietly , as though the worst of the task were done and [she]2866-her had only to wait ; so quietly that , as [he]256-archer came close , [her]2866-her outstretched hands acted not as a check but as a guide to [him]256-archer . They fell into [his]256-archer , while [her]2866-her arms , extended but not rigid , kept [him]256-archer far enough off to let [her]2866-her surrendered face say the rest .

[They]2879-their may have stood in that way for a long time , or only for a few moments ; but it was long enough for [her]2866-her silence to communicate all [she]2866-her had to say , and for [him]256-archer to feel that only one thing mattered . [He]256-archer must do nothing to make this meeting [their]2879-their last ; [he]256-archer must leave [their]2879-their future in [her]2866-her care , asking only that [she]2866-her should keep fast hold of it .

" Don't -- don't be unhappy , "[2866-her] [she]2866-her said , with a break in [her]2866-her voice , as [she]2866-her drew [her]2866-her hands away ; and [he]256-archer answered : " [You]2866-her wo n't go back -- [you]2866-her wo n't go back ? "[256-archer] as if it were the one possibility [he]256-archer could not bear .

" [I]2866-her wo n't go back , "[2866-her] [she]2866-her said ; and turning away [she]2866-her opened the door and led the way into [the public dining - room]2880-the public dining - room .

[The strident school - teachers]2881-the strident school - teachers were gathering up [their]2881-the strident school - teachers possessions preparatory to a straggling flight to [the wharf]2834-the wharf ; across [the beach]4909-the beach lay [the white steam - boat]2884-the white steam - boat at [the pier]2885-the pier ; and over the sunlit waters [Boston]147-boston loomed in a line of haze .

XXV .

Once more on [the boat]2606-the boat , and in the presence of [others]1554-others , [Archer]256-archer felt a tranquillity of spirit that surprised as much as it sustained [him]256-archer .

The day , according to any current valuation , had been a rather ridiculous failure ; [he]256-archer had not so much as touched [Madame Olenska]241-madame olenska 's hand with [his]256-archer lips , or extracted one word from [her]241-madame olenska that gave promise of farther opportunities . Nevertheless , for [a man sick with unsatisfied love]2888-a man sick with unsatisfied love , and parting for an indefinite period from the object of [his]256-archer passion , [he]256-archer felt [himself]256-archer almost humiliatingly calm and comforted . It was the perfect balance [she]241-madame olenska had held between [their]2889-their loyalty to [others]1554-others and [their]2889-their honesty to [themselves]2889-their that had so stirred and yet tranquillized [him]256-archer ; a balance not artfully calculated , as [her]241-madame olenska tears and [her]241-madame olenska falterings showed , but resulting naturally from [her]241-madame olenska unabashed sincerity . It filled [him]256-archer with a tender awe , now the danger was over , and made [him]256-archer thank [the fates]2891-the fates that no personal vanity , no sense of playing a part before [sophisticated witnesses]2892-sophisticated witnesses , had tempted [him]256-archer to tempt [her]241-madame olenska . Even after [they]2889-their had clasped hands for good - bye at [the Fall River station]2893-the fall river station , and [he]256-archer had turned away alone , the conviction remained with [him]256-archer of having saved out of [their]2889-their meeting much more than [he]256-archer had sacrificed .

[He]256-archer wandered back to [the club]1418-the club , and went and sat alone in [the deserted library]2895-the deserted library , turning and turning over in [his]256-archer thoughts every separate second of [their]2889-their hours together . It was clear to [him]256-archer , and it grew more clear under closer scrutiny , that if [she]241-madame olenska should finally decide on returning to [Europe]17-europe -- returning to [[her]241-madame olenska husband]645-her husband -- it would not be because [her]241-madame olenska old life tempted [her]241-madame olenska , even on the new terms offered . No : [she]241-madame olenska would go only if [she]241-madame olenska felt [herself]241-madame olenska becoming a temptation to [Archer]256-archer , a temptation to fall away from the standard [they]2889-their had both set up . [Her]241-madame olenska choice would be to stay near [him]256-archer as long as [he]256-archer did not ask [her]241-madame olenska to come nearer ; and it depended on [himself]256-archer to keep [her]241-madame olenska just there , safe but secluded .

In [the train]2232-the train these thoughts were still with [him]256-archer . They enclosed [him]256-archer in a kind of golden haze , through which the faces about [him]256-archer looked remote and indistinct : [he]256-archer had a feeling that if [he]256-archer spoke to [[his]256-archer fellow - travellers]2898-his fellow - travellers [they]2898-his fellow - travellers would not understand what [he]256-archer was saying . In this state of abstraction [he]256-archer found [himself]256-archer , the following morning , waking to the reality of a stifling September day in [New York]2-new york . The heat - withered faces in [the long train]2899-the long train streamed past [him]256-archer , and [he]256-archer continued to stare at [them]2898-his fellow - travellers through the same golden blur ; but suddenly , as [he]256-archer left [the station]1868-the station , one of the faces detached itself , came closer and forced itself upon [his]256-archer consciousness . It was , as [he]256-archer instantly recalled , the face of [the young man [he]256-archer had seen , the day before , passing out of [the Parker House]4884-the parker house]2901-the young man he had seen , the day before , passing out of the parker house , and had noted as not conforming to type , as not having [an American hotel face]2903-an american hotel face .

The same thing struck [him]256-archer now ; and again [he]256-archer became aware of [a dim stir of former associations]2904-a dim stir of former associations . [The young man]511-the young man stood looking about [him]256-archer with the dazed air of [the foreigner flung upon the harsh mercies of American travel]2906-the foreigner flung upon the harsh mercies of american travel ; then [he]511-the young man advanced toward [Archer]256-archer , lifted [his]511-the young man hat , and said in English : " Surely , [Monsieur]4944-monsieur , [we]4945-we met in [London]81-london ? "[511-the young man]

" Ah , to be sure : in [London]81-london ! "[256-archer] [Archer]256-archer grasped [his]511-the young man hand with curiosity and sympathy . " So [you]256-archer DID get [here]4019-here , after all ? "[511-the young man] [he]511-the young man exclaimed , casting a wondering eye on [the astute and haggard little countenance of [[young Carfry]424-mrs. carfry 's French tutor]2908-young carfry 's french tutor]2907-the astute and haggard little countenance of young carfry 's french tutor .

" Oh , [I]433-m. riviere got [here]4019-here -- yes , "[433-m. riviere] [M. Riviere]433-m. riviere smiled with drawn lips . " But not for long ; [I]433-m. riviere return the day after tomorrow . "[433-m. riviere] [He]433-m. riviere stood grasping [his]433-m. riviere light valise in one neatly gloved hand , and gazing anxiously , perplexedly , almost appealingly , into [Archer]256-archer 's face .

" [I]433-m. riviere wonder , [Monsieur]4948-monsieur , since [I]433-m. riviere 've had the good luck to run across [you]4948-monsieur , if [I]433-m. riviere might-- "[433-m. riviere]

" [I]433-m. riviere was just going to suggest it : come to luncheon , wo n't [you]4948-monsieur ? "[433-m. riviere]

[M. Riviere]433-m. riviere was visibly touched and surprised . " [You]4948-monsieur 're too kind . " [I]511-the young man know : [[our]4955-our American stations]4956-our american stations must surprise [you]4948-monsieur . "[511-the young man]

[The young man]511-the young man , after a just perceptible hesitation , replied , with profuse thanks , and in a tone that did not carry complete conviction , that [he]511-the young man was already engaged ; but when [they]2910-they had reached the comparative reassurance of [the street]1900-the street [he]511-the young man asked if [he]511-the young man might call that afternoon .

[Archer]256-archer , at ease in the midsummer leisure of [the office]1759-the office , fixed an hour and scribbled [his]256-archer address , which [the Frenchman]2913-the frenchman pocketed with reiterated thanks and a wide flourish of [his]2913-the frenchman hat . [A horse - car]2914-a horse - car received [him]256-archer , and [Archer]256-archer walked away .

Punctually at the hour [M. Riviere]433-m. riviere appeared , shaved , smoothed - out , but still unmistakably drawn and serious . [Archer]256-archer was alone in [[his]256-archer office]2915-his office , and [the young man]511-the young man , before accepting the seat [he]511-the young man proffered , began abruptly : " [I]511-the young man believe [I]511-the young man saw [you]256-archer , [sir]4062-sir , yesterday in [Boston]147-boston . "[511-the young man]

The statement was insignificant enough , and [Archer]256-archer was about to frame an assent when [his]256-archer words were checked by something mysterious yet illuminating in [[his]256-archer visitor]2917-his visitor 's insistent gaze .

" It is extraordinary , very extraordinary , "[433-m. riviere] [M. Riviere]433-m. riviere continued , " that [we]4959-we should have met in the circumstances in which [I]433-m. riviere find [myself]433-m. riviere . "[433-m. riviere]

" What circumstances ? "[256-archer] [Archer]256-archer asked , wondering a little crudely if [he]256-archer needed money .

[M. Riviere]433-m. riviere continued to study [him]256-archer with tentative eyes . " [I]433-m. riviere have come , not to look for employment , as [I]433-m. riviere spoke of doing when [we]4959-we last met , but on a special mission-- "[433-m. riviere]

" Ah-- ! "[256-archer] [Archer]256-archer exclaimed . In a flash the two meetings had connected themselves in [his]256-archer mind . [He]256-archer paused to take in the situation thus suddenly lighted up for [him]256-archer , and [M. Riviere]433-m. riviere also remained silent , as if aware that what [he]256-archer had said was enough .

" A special mission , "[256-archer] [Archer]256-archer at length repeated .

[The young Frenchman]2918-the young frenchman , opening [his]2918-the young frenchman palms , raised them slightly , and [the two men]1704-the two men continued to look at [each other]558-each other across [the office - desk]2921-the office - desk till [Archer]256-archer roused [himself]256-archer to say : " Do sit down "[256-archer] ; whereupon [M. " It was about this mission that [you]433-m. riviere wanted to consult [me]256-archer ? "[256-archer] [Archer]256-archer finally asked .

[M. Riviere]433-m. riviere bent [his]433-m. riviere head . " Not in [my]433-m. riviere own behalf : on that score [I]433-m. riviere -- [I]433-m. riviere have fully dealt with [myself]433-m. riviere . [I]433-m. riviere should like -- if [I]433-m. riviere may -- to speak to [you]433-m. riviere about [the Countess Olenska]235-the countess olenska . "[433-m. riviere]

[Archer]256-archer had known for the last few minutes that the words were coming ; but when they came they sent the blood rushing to [his]256-archer temples as if [he]256-archer had been caught by a bent - back branch in a thicket .

" And on whose behalf , "[256-archer] [he]256-archer said , " do [you]433-m. riviere wish to do this ? "[256-archer]

[M. Riviere]433-m. riviere met the question sturdily . " Well -- [I]433-m. riviere might say [HERS]235-the countess olenska , if it did not sound like a liberty . Shall [I]433-m. riviere say instead : on behalf of abstract justice ? "[433-m. riviere]

[Archer]256-archer considered [him]433-m. riviere ironically . " In other words : [you]433-m. riviere are [[Count Olenski]278-count olenski 's messenger]4960-count olenski 's messenger ? "[256-archer]

[He]256-archer saw [his]433-m. riviere blush more darkly reflected in [M. Riviere]433-m. riviere 's sallow countenance . " Not to [YOU]511-the young man , [Monsieur]4961-monsieur . If [I]256-archer come to [you]4961-monsieur , it is on quite other grounds . "[256-archer]

" What right have [you]433-m. riviere , in the circumstances , to BE on any other ground ? "[256-archer] [Archer]256-archer retorted . " If [you]433-m. riviere 're [an emissary]4962-an emissary [you]433-m. riviere 're [an emissary]4962-an emissary . "[256-archer]

[Archer]256-archer sat silent , with the sense of clinging to the edge of a sliding precipice . [He]256-archer saw in a flash that if [the family]532-the family had ceased to consult [him]256-archer it was because some deep tribal instinct warned [them]532-the family that [he]256-archer was no longer on [their]532-the family side ; and [he]256-archer recalled , with a start of comprehension , a remark of [May]226-may 's during [their]2927-they drive [home]631-home from [Mrs. Manson Mingott]217-mrs. manson mingott 's on the day of the Archery Meeting : " Perhaps , after all , [Ellen]233-ellen would be happier with [[her]233-ellen husband]645-her husband . "[2927-they]

[Her]553-his wife careless allusion had no doubt been the straw held up to see which way the wind blew ; the result had been reported to [the family]532-the family , and thereafter [Archer]256-archer had been tacitly omitted from [their]532-the family counsels . [He]256-archer admired the tribal discipline which made [May]2932-may bow to this decision . [She]2932-may would not have done so , [he]256-archer knew , had [her]2932-may conscience protested ; but [she]2932-may probably shared the family view that [Madame Olenska]241-madame olenska would be better off as [an unhappy wife]2933-an unhappy wife than as [a separated one]2934-a separated one , and that there was no use in discussing the case with [Newland]215-archer , who had an awkward way of suddenly not seeming to take the most fundamental things for granted .

XXVI .

Every year on the fifteenth of October [Fifth Avenue]18-fifth avenue opened [its]18-fifth avenue shutters , unrolled [its]18-fifth avenue carpets and hung up [its]18-fifth avenue triple layer of window - curtains .

By the first of November this household ritual was over , and society had begun to look about and take stock of [itself]2947-itself . By the fifteenth the season was in full blast , Opera and [theatres]2948-theatres were putting forth [their]2949-their new attractions , dinner - engagements were accumulating , and dates for dances being fixed . And punctually at about this time [Mrs. Archer]215-archer always said that [New York]2-new york was very much changed .

Observing it from the lofty stand - point of [a non - participant]2950-a non - participant , [she]215-archer was able , with the help of [Mr. Sillerton Jackson]225-mr. jackson and [Miss Sophy]263-miss jackson , to trace each new crack in its surface , and all the strange weeds pushing up between the ordered rows of social vegetables . It had been one of the amusements of [Archer]215-archer 's youth to wait for this annual pronouncement of [[his]2951-his mother]512-his mother 's , and to hear [her]215-archer enumerate the minute signs of disintegration that [his]2951-his careless gaze had overlooked . For [New York]2-new york , to [Mrs. Archer]215-archer 's mind , never changed without changing for the worse ; and in this view [Miss Sophy Jackson]263-miss jackson heartily concurred .

[Mr. Sillerton Jackson]225-mr. jackson , as became [a man of [the world]561-the world]2953-a man of the world , suspended [his]225-mr. jackson judgment and listened with an amused impartiality to the lamentations of [the ladies]735-the ladies . But even [he]225-mr. jackson never denied that [New York]2-new york had changed ; and [Newland Archer]215-archer , in the winter of the second year of [his]2951-his marriage , was [himself]2951-his obliged to admit that if it had not actually changed it was certainly changing .

These points had been raised , as usual , at [Mrs. Archer]215-archer 's Thanksgiving dinner . At the date when [she]215-archer was officially enjoined to give thanks for the blessings of the year it was [her]215-archer habit to take [a mournful though not embittered stock of [[her]215-archer world]2957-her world]2956-a mournful though not embittered stock of her world , and wonder what there was to be thankful for . At any rate , not the state of society ; society , if it could be said to exist , was rather a spectacle on which to call down Biblical imprecations -- and in fact , [every one]635-every one knew what [the Reverend Dr. Ashmore]457-dr. ashmore meant when [he]457-dr. ashmore chose a text from [Jeremiah]458-jeremiah ( chap . ii . , verse 25 ) for [his]457-dr. ashmore Thanksgiving sermon . [Dr. Ashmore]457-dr. ashmore , [the new Rector of [St. Matthew 's]162-st. matthew 's]2959-the new rector of st. matthew 's , had been chosen because [he]457-dr. ashmore was very " advanced "[457-dr. ashmore] : [his]457-dr. ashmore sermons were considered bold in thought and novel in language . When [he]457-dr. ashmore fulminated against [fashionable society]2960-fashionable society [he]457-dr. ashmore always spoke of its " trend "[457-dr. ashmore] ; and to [Mrs. Archer]215-archer it was terrifying and yet fascinating to feel [herself]215-archer part of a community that was trending .

" There 's no doubt that [Dr. Ashmore]457-dr. ashmore is right : there IS a marked trend , "[215-archer] [she]215-archer said , as if it were something visible and measurable , like a crack in [a house]4071-a house .

" It was odd , though , to preach about it on Thanksgiving , "[263-miss jackson] [Miss Jackson]263-miss jackson opined ; and [[her]263-miss jackson hostess]2962-her hostess drily rejoined : " Oh , [he]457-dr. ashmore means [us]5007-us to give thanks for what 's left . "[2962-her hostess]

[Archer]215-archer had been wo nt to smile at these annual vaticinations of [[his]457-dr. ashmore mother]512-his mother 's ; but this year even [he]457-dr. ashmore was obliged to acknowledge , as [he]457-dr. ashmore listened to an enumeration of the changes , that the " trend "[2962-her hostess] was visible .

" The extravagance in dress-- "[263-miss jackson] [Miss Jackson]263-miss jackson began . " [Sillerton]225-mr. jackson took [me]263-miss jackson to the first night of [the Opera]502-the opera , and [I]263-miss jackson can only tell [you]5009-you that [Jane Merry]459-jane merry 's dress was the only one [I]263-miss jackson recognised from last year ; and even that had had the front panel changed . Yet [I]263-miss jackson know [she]215-archer got it out from Worth only two years ago , because [[my]263-miss jackson seamstress]5010-my seamstress always goes in to make over [her]215-archer Paris dresses before [she]215-archer wears them . "[263-miss jackson]

" Ah , [Jane Merry]459-jane merry is one of [US]5011-us , "[215-archer] said [Mrs. Archer]215-archer sighing , as if it were not such an enviable thing to be in an age when [ladies]2964-ladies were beginning to flaunt abroad [their]2964-ladies Paris dresses as soon as [they]2964-ladies were out of [the Custom House]2965-the custom house , instead of letting them mellow under lock and key , in the manner of [[Mrs. Archer]215-archer 's contemporaries]2966-mrs. archer 's contemporaries .

" Yes ; [she]215-archer 's one of the few . In [my]263-miss jackson youth , "[263-miss jackson] [Miss Jackson]263-miss jackson rejoined , " it was considered vulgar to dress in the newest fashions ; and [Amy Sillerton]446-amy sillerton has always told [me]263-miss jackson that in [Boston]147-boston the rule was to put away one 's Paris dresses for two years . [Old Mrs. Baxter Pennilow]460-old mrs. baxter pennilow , who did everything handsomely , used to import twelve a year , two velvet , two satin , two silk , and the other six of poplin and the finest cashmere . It was a standing order , and as [she]215-archer was ill for two years before [she]215-archer died [they]5012-they found forty - eight Worth dresses that had never been taken out of tissue paper ; and when [the girls]3965-the girls left off [their]3965-the girls mourning [they]3965-the girls were able to wear the first lot at the Symphony concerts without looking in advance of the fashion . "[263-miss jackson]

" Ah , well , [Boston]147-boston is more conservative than [New York]2-new york ; but [I]215-archer always think it 's a safe rule for [a lady]680-a lady to lay aside [her]680-a lady French dresses for one season , "[215-archer] [Mrs. Archer]215-archer conceded .

" It was [Beaufort]231-beaufort who started the new fashion by making [[his]5015-his wife]553-his wife clap [her]553-his wife new clothes on [her]553-his wife back as soon as [they]5017-they arrived : [I]263-miss jackson must say at times it takes all [Regina]249-regina 's distinction not to look like ... like ... "[263-miss jackson] [Miss Jackson]263-miss jackson glanced around the table , caught [Janey]420-janey 's bulging gaze , and took refuge in an unintelligible murmur .

" Like [[her]249-regina rivals]2505-her rivals , "[225-mr. jackson] said [Mr. Sillerton Jackson]225-mr. jackson , with the air of producing an epigram .

" Oh,-- "[735-the ladies] [the ladies]735-the ladies murmured ; and [Mrs. Archer]215-archer added , partly to distract [[her]215-archer daughter]534-her daughter 's attention from forbidden topics : " [Poor Regina]461-poor regina ! [Her]249-regina Thanksgiving has n't been a very cheerful one , [I]215-archer 'm afraid . Have [you]225-mr. jackson heard the rumours about [Beaufort]231-beaufort 's speculations , [Sillerton]225-mr. jackson ? "[215-archer]

[Mr. Jackson]225-mr. jackson nodded carelessly . [Every one]635-every one had heard the rumours in question , and [he]225-mr. jackson scorned to confirm a tale that was already common property .

A gloomy silence fell upon [the party]2741-the party . [No one]601-no one really liked [Beaufort]231-beaufort , and it was not wholly unpleasant to think the worst of [his]2972-his private life ; but the idea of [his]2972-his having brought financial dishonour on [[[his]2972-his wife]553-his wife 's family]2974-his wife 's family was too shocking to be enjoyed even by [[his]2972-his enemies]2975-his enemies . [Archer]215-archer 's [New York]2-new york tolerated hypocrisy in private relations ; but in business matters it exacted a limpid and impeccable honesty . It was a long time since [any well - known banker]2976-any well - known banker had failed discreditably ; but [every one]635-every one remembered the social extinction visited on the heads of [the firm when the last event of the kind]2978-the firm when the last event of the kind had happened . It would be the same with [the Beauforts]247-the beauforts , in spite of [his]2972-his power and [her]553-his wife popularity ; not all the leagued strength of the [Dallas]485-dallas connection would save [poor Regina]461-poor regina if there were any truth in the reports of [[her]553-his wife husband]645-her husband 's unlawful speculations .

The talk took refuge in less ominous topics ; but everything [they]2980-they touched on seemed to confirm [Mrs. Archer]215-archer 's sense of an accelerated trend .

" Of course , [Newland]215-archer , [I]215-archer know [you]215-archer let [dear May]5019-dear may go to [Mrs. Struthers]260-mrs. struthers 's Sunday evenings-- "[215-archer] [she]215-archer began ; and [May]2981-may interposed gaily : " Oh , [you]215-archer know , [everybody]586-everybody goes to [[Mrs. Struthers]260-mrs. struthers 's]2011-mrs. struthers 's now ; and [she]2981-may was invited to [Granny]244-granny 's last reception . "[2981-may]

It was thus , [Archer]215-archer reflected , that [New York]2-new york managed its transitions : conspiring to ignore [them]2982-they till [they]2982-they were well over , and then , in all good faith , imagining that [they]2982-they had taken place in a preceding age . There was always [a traitor]2983-a traitor in [the citadel]2984-the citadel ; and after [he]2985-he ( or generally [she]2986-she ) had surrendered the keys , what was the use of pretending that it was impregnable ? Once [people]619-people had tasted of [Mrs. Struthers]260-mrs. struthers 's easy Sunday hospitality [they]619-people were not likely to sit at [home]631-home remembering that [her]260-mrs. struthers champagne was transmuted Shoe - Polish .

" [I]215-archer know , [dear]3991-dear , [I]215-archer know , "[215-archer] [Mrs. Archer]215-archer sighed . "[215-archer]

A sudden blush rose to [young Mrs. Archer]215-archer 's face ; it surprised [[her]215-archer husband]645-her husband as much as [the other guests about the table]2990-the other guests about the table . "[512-his mother]

" Ah , well-- "[215-archer] [Mrs. Archer]215-archer sighed again .

[Everybody]586-everybody knew that [the Countess Olenska]235-the countess olenska was no longer in the good graces of [[her]235-the countess olenska family]1193-her family . "[225-mr. jackson]

[Archer]215-archer said nothing . Four months had passed since the midsummer day that [he]511-the young man and [Madame Olenska]241-madame olenska had spent together ; and since then [he]511-the young man had not seen [her]241-madame olenska . "[241-madame olenska]

Since then there had been no farther communication between [them]3012-they , and [he]511-the young man had built up within [himself]511-the young man a kind of sanctuary in which [she]241-madame olenska throned among [his]511-the young man secret thoughts and longings . "[3022-the old gentleman]

[Archer]215-archer was burning with unavailing wrath : [he]3023-he was exactly in [the state]1626-the state when [a man]914-a man is sure to do something stupid , knowing all the while that [he]914-a man is doing it .

[He]3023-he saw that [Mr. Jackson]225-mr. jackson had been instantly struck by the fact that [Madame Olenska]241-madame olenska 's differences with [[her]241-madame olenska grandmother]834-her grandmother and [[her]241-madame olenska other relations]1197-her other relations were not known to [him]225-mr. jackson , and that [the old gentleman]3022-the old gentleman had drawn [his]3022-the old gentleman own conclusions as to the reasons for [Archer]215-archer 's exclusion from the family councils . This fact warned [Archer]215-archer to go warily ; but the insinuations about [Beaufort]231-beaufort made [him]3023-he reckless . [He]3023-he was mindful , however , if not of [his]3023-he own danger , at least of the fact that [Mr. Jackson]225-mr. jackson was under [[his]225-mr. jackson mother]512-his mother 's roof , and consequently [[his]225-mr. jackson guest]4276-his guest . [Old New York]464-old new york scrupulously observed the etiquette of hospitality , and no discussion with [a guest]3031-a guest was ever allowed to degenerate into a disagreement .

" Shall [we]5054-we go up and join [[my]3023-he mother]4035-my mother ? "[3023-he] [he]3023-he suggested curtly , as [Mr. Jackson]225-mr. jackson 's last cone of ashes dropped into the brass ashtray at [his]3023-he elbow .

On the drive homeward [May]226-may remained oddly silent ; through the darkness , [he]3023-he still felt [her]226-may enveloped in [her]226-may menacing blush . What its menace meant [he]3023-he could not guess : but [he]3023-he was sufficiently warned by the fact that [Madame Olenska]241-madame olenska 's name had evoked it .

[They]3032-they went [upstairs]692-upstairs , and [he]3023-he turned into [the library]750-the library . [She]226-may usually followed [him]3023-he ; but [he]3023-he heard [her]226-may passing down [the passage]1854-the passage to [[her]226-may bedroom]3036-her bedroom .

" [May]5056-may ! "[3023-he] [he]3023-he called out impatiently ; and [she]226-may came back , with a slight glance of surprise at [his]3023-he tone .

" This lamp is smoking again ; [I]3023-he should think [the servants]715-the servants might see that it 's kept properly trimmed , "[3023-he] [he]3023-he grumbled nervously .

" [I]226-may 'm so sorry : it sha n't happen again , "[226-may] [she]226-may answered , in the firm bright tone [she]226-may had learned from [[her]226-may mother]587-her mother ; and it exasperated [Archer]215-archer to feel that [she]226-may was already beginning to humour [him]3023-he like [a younger Mr. Welland]335-mr. welland . [She]226-may bent over to lower the wick , and as the light struck up on [her]226-may white shoulders and the clear curves of [her]226-may face [he]3023-he thought : " How young [she]226-may is ! For what endless years this life will have to go on ! "[3023-he]

[He]3023-he felt , with a kind of horror , [his]3023-he own strong youth and the bounding blood in [his]3023-he veins . " Look here , "[3023-he] [he]3023-he said suddenly , " [I]3023-he may have to go to [Washington]112-washington for a few days -- soon ; next week perhaps . "[3023-he]

[Her]226-may hand remained on the key of the lamp as [she]226-may turned to [him]3023-he slowly . The heat from its flame had brought back a glow to [her]226-may face , but it paled as [she]226-may looked up .

" On business ? "[226-may] [she]226-may asked , in a tone which implied that there could be no other conceivable reason , and that [she]226-may had put the question automatically , as if merely to finish [his]3023-he own sentence .

" On business , naturally . There 's a patent case coming up before [the Supreme Court--]5058-the supreme court-- "[3023-he] [He]3023-he gave the name of [the inventor]3038-the inventor , and went on furnishing details with all [Lawrence Lefferts]224-lawrence lefferts 's practised glibness , while [she]226-may listened attentively , saying at intervals : " Yes , [I]226-may see . "[226-may]

" The change will do [you]3023-he good , "[226-may] [she]226-may said simply , when [he]3023-he had finished ; " and [you]3023-he must be sure to go and see [Ellen]233-ellen , "[226-may] [she]226-may added , looking [him]3023-he straight in the eyes with [her]226-may cloudless smile , and speaking in the tone [she]226-may might have employed in urging [him]3023-he not to neglect some irksome family duty .

It was the only word that passed between [them]3039-our on the subject ; but in the code in which [they]3039-our had both been trained it meant : " Of course [you]3023-he understand that [I]226-may know all that [people]619-people have been saying about [Ellen]233-ellen , and heartily sympathise with [[my]226-may family]4397-my family in [their]4397-my family effort to get [her]233-ellen to return to [[her]233-ellen husband]645-her husband . [I]226-may also know that , for some reason [you]3023-he have not chosen to tell [me]226-may , [you]3023-he have advised [her]233-ellen against this course , which [all the older men of the family]5062-all the older men of the family , as well as [[our]3039-our grandmother]5063-our grandmother , agree in approving ; and that it is owing to [your]3023-he encouragement that [Ellen]233-ellen defies [us]3039-our all , and exposes [herself]233-ellen to the kind of criticism of which [Mr. Sillerton Jackson]225-mr. jackson probably gave [you]3023-he , this evening , the hint that has made [you]3023-he so irritable .... Hints have indeed not been wanting ; but since [you]3023-he appear unwilling to take them from [others]1554-others , [I]226-may offer [you]3023-he this one [myself]226-may , in the only form in which [well - bred people of [our]3039-our kind]5065-well - bred people of our kind can communicate unpleasant things to [each other]558-each other : by letting [you]3023-he understand that [I]226-may know [you]3023-he mean to see [Ellen]233-ellen when [you]3023-he are in [Washington]112-washington , and are perhaps going [there]713-there expressly for that purpose ; and that , since [you]3023-he are sure to see [her]233-ellen , [I]226-may wish [you]3023-he to do so with [my]226-may full and explicit approval -- and to take the opportunity of letting [her]233-ellen know what the course of conduct [you]3023-he have encouraged [her]233-ellen in is likely to lead to . "[226-may]

[Her]3040-she hand was still on the key of the lamp when the last word of this mute message reached [him]3041-he . [She]3040-she turned the wick down , lifted off the globe , and breathed on the sulky flame .

" They smell less if one blows them out , "[3040-she] [she]3040-she explained , with [her]3040-she bright housekeeping air . On the threshold [she]3040-she turned and paused for [his]3041-he kiss .

XXVII .

[Wall Street]135-wall street , the next day , had more reassuring reports of [Beaufort]231-beaufort 's situation . They were not definite , but [they]3042-they were hopeful . It was generally understood that [he]3041-he could call on powerful influences in case of emergency , and that [he]3041-he had done so with success ; and that evening , when [Mrs. Beaufort]231-beaufort appeared at [the Opera]502-the opera wearing [her]231-beaufort old smile and a new emerald necklace , [society]1426-society drew a breath of relief .

[New York]2-new york was inexorable in its condemnation of business irregularities . So far there had been no exception to [its]2-new york tacit rule that [those who broke the law of probity]3045-those who broke the law of probity must pay ; and [every one]635-every one was aware that even [Beaufort]231-beaufort and [[Beaufort]231-beaufort 's wife]3047-beaufort 's wife would be offered up unflinchingly to this principle . But to be obliged to offer [them]3048-them up would be not only painful but inconvenient . The disappearance of [the Beauforts]247-the beauforts would leave a considerable void in [their]3048-them compact little circle ; and [those who were too ignorant or too careless to shudder at the moral catastrophe]3049-those who were too ignorant or too careless to shudder at the moral catastrophe bewailed in advance the loss of [the best ball - room in [New York]2-new york]3050-the best ball - room in new york .

[Archer]215-archer had definitely made up [his]3041-he mind to go to [Washington]112-washington . [He]3041-he was waiting only for the opening of the law - suit of which [he]3041-he had spoken to [May]226-may , so that its date might coincide with that of [his]3041-he visit ; but on the following Tuesday [he]3041-he learned from [Mr. Letterblair]353-mr. letterblair that the case might be postponed for several weeks . Nevertheless , [he]3041-he went [home]631-home that afternoon determined in any event to leave the next evening . The chances were that [May]226-may , who knew nothing of [his]3041-he professional life , and had never shown any interest in it , would not learn of the postponement , should it take place , nor remember the names of [the litigants]3052-the litigants if [they]3052-the litigants were mentioned before [her]226-may ; and at any rate [he]3041-he could no longer put off seeing [Madame Olenska]241-madame olenska . There were too many things that [he]3041-he must say to [her]226-may .

On the Wednesday morning , when [he]3041-he reached [[his]3041-he office]2915-his office , [Mr. Letterblair]353-mr. letterblair met [him]3041-he with a troubled face . [Beaufort]231-beaufort , after all , had not managed to " tide over "[3041-he] ; but by setting afloat the rumour that [he]3041-he had done so [he]3041-he had reassured [[his]3041-he depositors]3054-his depositors , and heavy payments had poured into [the bank]2586-the bank till the previous evening , when disturbing reports again began to predominate . In consequence , a run on [the bank]2586-the bank had begun , and [its]2586-the bank doors were likely to close before the day was over . The ugliest things were being said of [Beaufort]231-beaufort 's dastardly manoeuvre , and [his]3041-he failure promised to be one of the most discreditable in the history of [Wall Street]135-wall street .

The extent of the calamity left [Mr. Letterblair]353-mr. letterblair white and incapacitated . " [I]353-mr. letterblair 've seen bad things in [my]353-mr. letterblair time ; but nothing as bad as this . [[Everybody]586-everybody [we]5070-we know]5069-everybody we know will be hit , one way or another . And what will be done about [Mrs. Beaufort]231-beaufort ? What CAN be done about [her]231-beaufort ? [I]353-mr. letterblair pity [Mrs. Manson Mingott]217-mrs. manson mingott as much as [anybody]3958-anybody : coming at [her]231-beaufort age , there 's no knowing what effect this affair may have on [her]231-beaufort . [She]231-beaufort always believed in [Beaufort]231-beaufort -- [she]231-beaufort made [a friend of [him]3041-he]5072-a friend of him ! And there 's the whole [Dallas]485-dallas connection : poor [Mrs. Beaufort]231-beaufort is related to [every one of [you]5074-you]5073-every one of you . [Her]231-beaufort duty is at [his]3041-he side ; and luckily [she]231-beaufort seems always to have been blind to [his]3041-he private weaknesses . "[353-mr. letterblair]

There was a knock , and [Mr. Letterblair]353-mr. letterblair turned [his]353-mr. letterblair head sharply . " What is it ? [I]353-mr. letterblair ca n't be disturbed . "[353-mr. letterblair]

[A clerk]3057-a clerk brought in a letter for [Archer]215-archer and withdrew . [Archer]215-archer handed the note to [[his]353-mr. letterblair senior partner]1518-his senior partner , and a few minutes later was crawling northward in [a crowded horse - car]3061-a crowded horse - car , which [he]353-mr. letterblair exchanged at [Fourteenth Street]164-fourteenth street for one of [the high staggering omnibuses of [the Fifth Avenue line]3063-the fifth avenue line]3062-the high staggering omnibuses of the fifth avenue line . It was after twelve o'clock when [this laborious vehicle]3064-this laborious vehicle dropped [him]353-mr. letterblair at [[old Catherine]237-old catherine 's]4718-old catherine 's .
