[The hall]736-the hall wore the unnatural appearance peculiar to [well - kept houses]3071-well - kept houses suddenly invaded by illness : wraps and furs lay in heaps on the chairs , [a doctor]3072-a doctor 's bag and overcoat were on the table , and beside them letters and cards had already piled up unheeded .

[May]3073-may looked pale but smiling : [Dr. Bencomb]450-dr. bencomb , who had just come for the second time , took a more hopeful view , and [Mrs. Mingott]217-mrs. manson mingott 's dauntless determination to live and get well was already having an effect on [[her]237-old catherine family]1193-her family . [May]3075-may led [Archer]215-archer into [[the old lady]3973-the old lady 's sitting - room]3077-the old lady 's sitting - room , where the sliding doors opening into [the bedroom]3078-the bedroom had been drawn shut , and the heavy yellow damask portieres dropped over them ; and here [Mrs. Welland]219-mrs. welland communicated to [him]353-mr. letterblair in horrified undertones the details of the catastrophe . It appeared that the evening before something dreadful and mysterious had happened . At about eight o'clock , just after [Mrs. Mingott]217-mrs. manson mingott had finished the game of solitaire that [she]217-mrs. manson mingott always played after dinner , the door - bell had rung , and [a lady so thickly veiled that]3079-a lady so thickly veiled that [the servants]715-the servants did not immediately recognise [her]3079-a lady so thickly veiled that had asked to be received .

[The butler]925-the butler , hearing a familiar voice , had thrown open the sitting - room door , announcing : " [Mrs. Julius Beaufort"--and]466-mrs. julius beaufort"--and[925-the butler] had then closed it again on [the two ladies]3082-the two ladies . [They]3082-the two ladies must have been together , [he]925-the butler thought , about an hour . When [Mrs. Mingott]217-mrs. manson mingott 's bell rang [Mrs. Beaufort]231-beaufort had already slipped away unseen , and [the old lady , white and vast and terrible]3083-the old lady , white and vast and terrible , sat alone in [her]3083-the old lady , white and vast and terrible great chair , and signed to [the butler]925-the butler to help [her]3083-the old lady , white and vast and terrible into [[her]3083-the old lady , white and vast and terrible room]3085-her room . [She]3083-the old lady , white and vast and terrible seemed , at that time , though obviously distressed , in complete control of [her]3083-the old lady , white and vast and terrible body and brain . [The mulatto maid]3086-the mulatto maid put [her]3083-the old lady , white and vast and terrible to bed , brought [her]3083-the old lady , white and vast and terrible a cup of tea as usual , laid everything straight in [the room]972-the room , and went away ; but at three in the morning the bell rang again , and [the two servants]3088-the two servants , hastening in at this unwonted summons ( for [old Catherine]237-old catherine usually slept like [a baby]3089-a baby ) , had found [[their]3088-the two servants mistress]3090-their mistress sitting up against [her]3083-the old lady , white and vast and terrible pillows with a crooked smile on [her]3083-the old lady , white and vast and terrible face and one little hand hanging limp from [its]3083-the old lady , white and vast and terrible huge arm .

The stroke had clearly been a slight one , for [she]3083-the old lady , white and vast and terrible was able to articulate and to make [her]3083-the old lady , white and vast and terrible wishes known ; and soon after [the doctor]3091-the doctor 's first visit [she]3083-the old lady , white and vast and terrible had begun to regain control of [her]3083-the old lady , white and vast and terrible facial muscles . " [I]3094-the old woman said to [her]217-mrs. manson mingott : ' Honour 's always been honour , and honesty honesty , in [[Manson Mingott]217-mrs. manson mingott 's house]5080-manson mingott 's house , and will be till [I]3094-the old woman 'm carried out of it feet first , ' "[3094-the old woman] [the old woman]3094-the old woman had stammered into [[her]3094-the old woman daughter]534-her daughter 's ear , in the thick voice of [the partly paralysed]3096-the partly paralysed . ' "[3094-the old woman]

So much , with tears and gasps of horror , [Mrs. Welland]219-mrs. welland imparted , blanched and demolished by the unwonted obligation of having at last to fix [her]219-mrs. welland eyes on the unpleasant and the discreditable . [Archer]215-archer had seated [himself]215-archer near the window and was gazing out blankly at [the deserted thoroughfare]3099-the deserted thoroughfare . [Archer]215-archer listened unmoved to the relentless chorus . The idea of absolute financial probity as the first law of [a gentleman]4031-a gentleman 's code was too deeply ingrained in [him]4031-a gentleman for sentimental considerations to weaken it . [An adventurer like [Lemuel Struthers]260-mrs. struthers]3111-an adventurer like lemuel struthers might build up the millions of [his]3111-an adventurer like lemuel struthers Shoe Polish on any number of shady dealings ; but unblemished honesty was the noblesse oblige of old financial [New York]2-new york . Nor did [Mrs. Beaufort]231-beaufort 's fate greatly move [Archer]215-archer . [He]4031-a gentleman felt , no doubt , more sorry for [her]231-beaufort than [[her]231-beaufort indignant relatives]3112-her indignant relatives ; but it seemed to [him]4031-a gentleman that the tie between [husband]1157-husband and [wife]1158-wife , even if breakable in prosperity , should be indissoluble in misfortune . As [Mr. Letterblair]353-mr. letterblair had said , [a wife]996-a wife 's place was at [[her]996-a wife husband]645-her husband 's side when [he]645-her husband was in trouble ; but [[society]1426-society 's place]3118-society 's place was not at [his]645-her husband side , and [Mrs. Beaufort]231-beaufort 's cool assumption that it was seemed almost to make [her]231-beaufort [[his]645-her husband accomplice]3119-his accomplice . The mere idea of [a woman]4935-a woman 's appealing to [[her]4935-a woman family]1193-her family to screen [[her]4935-a woman husband]645-her husband 's business dishonour was inadmissible , since it was the one thing that [the Family]532-the family , as [an institution]3124-an institution , could not do .

[The mulatto maid]3086-the mulatto maid called [Mrs. Lovell Mingott]218-mrs. lovell mingott into [the hall]736-the hall , and [the latter]574-the latter came back in a moment with a frowning brow .

XXVIII .

" Ol - ol -- howjer spell it , anyhow ? " [Olenska]233-ellen -- O - len - ska , "[3135-his] [he]3135-his repeated , drawing back the message in order to print out the foreign syllables above [May]226-may 's rambling script .

" It 's an unlikely name for [a New York telegraph office]5105-a new york telegraph office ; at least in [this quarter]5106-this quarter , "[3135-his] an unexpected voice observed ; and turning around [Archer]215-archer saw [Lawrence Lefferts]224-lawrence lefferts at [his]3135-his elbow , pulling an imperturbable moustache and affecting not to glance at the message .

" [Hallo]471-hallo , [Newland]215-archer : thought [I]3135-his 'd catch [you]215-archer [here]4019-here . " Very bad , eh ? "[224-lawrence lefferts] [Lefferts]224-lawrence lefferts continued . " Wiring to [the family]532-the family , [I]224-lawrence lefferts suppose . [Archer]215-archer 's lips stiffened ; [he]3135-his felt a savage impulse to dash [his]3135-his fist into the long vain handsome face at [his]3135-his side .

" Why ? "[3135-his] [he]3135-his questioned .

[Lefferts]224-lawrence lefferts , who was known to shrink from discussion , raised [his]224-lawrence lefferts eye - brows with an ironic grimace that warned the other of [the watching damsel behind the lattice]3141-the watching damsel behind the lattice . Nothing could be worse " form "[215-archer] the look reminded [Archer]215-archer , than any display of temper in a public place .

[Archer]215-archer had never been more indifferent to the requirements of form ; but [his]3135-his impulse to do [Lawrence Lefferts]224-lawrence lefferts a physical injury was only momentary . The idea of bandying [Ellen Olenska]233-ellen 's name with [him]3135-his at such a time , and on whatsoever provocation , was unthinkable . [He]3135-his paid for [his]3135-his telegram , and [the two young men]3142-the two young men went out together into [the street]1900-the street . [There Archer]215-archer , having regained [his]3135-his self - control , went on : " [Mrs. Mingott]218-mrs. lovell mingott is much better : [the doctor]3091-the doctor feels no anxiety whatever "[215-archer] ; and [Lefferts]224-lawrence lefferts , with profuse expressions of relief , asked [him]3135-his if [he]3135-his had heard that there were beastly bad rumours again about [Beaufort]231-beaufort ....

That afternoon the announcement of the Beaufort failure was in all the papers . It overshadowed the report of [Mrs. Manson Mingott]217-mrs. manson mingott 's stroke , and only [the few who had heard of the mysterious connection between the two events]3144-the few who had heard of the mysterious connection between the two events thought of ascribing [old Catherine]237-old catherine 's illness to anything but the accumulation of flesh and years .

[The whole of [New York]2-new york]4055-the whole of new york was darkened by the tale of [Beaufort]231-beaufort 's dishonour . There had never , as [Mr. Letterblair]353-mr. letterblair said , been a worse case in [his]353-mr. letterblair memory , nor , for that matter , in the memory of [the far - off Letterblair who had given [his]353-mr. letterblair name to [the firm]1467-the firm]3146-the far - off letterblair who had given his name to the firm . [The bank]2586-the bank had continued to take in money for a whole day after [its]2586-the bank failure was inevitable ; and as [many of [[its]2586-the bank clients]3150-its clients]3149-many of its clients belonged to one or another of [the ruling clans]1062-the ruling clans , [Beaufort]231-beaufort 's duplicity seemed doubly cynical . If [Mrs. Beaufort]231-beaufort had not taken the tone that such misfortunes ( the word was [her]231-beaufort own ) were " the test of friendship , "[1062-the ruling clans] compassion for [her]231-beaufort might have tempered the general indignation against [[her]231-beaufort husband]645-her husband . As it was -- and especially after the object of [her]231-beaufort nocturnal visit to [Mrs. Manson Mingott]217-mrs. manson mingott had become known -- [her]231-beaufort cynicism was held to exceed [his]645-her husband ; and [she]231-beaufort had not the excuse -- nor [[her]231-beaufort detractors]3153-her detractors the satisfaction -- of pleading that [she]231-beaufort was " [a foreigner]5113-a foreigner . "[231-beaufort] It was some comfort ( to [those whose securities were not in jeopardy]3154-those whose securities were not in jeopardy ) to be able to remind [themselves]3154-those whose securities were not in jeopardy that [Beaufort]231-beaufort WAS ; but , after all , if [a Dallas of [South Carolina]9-south carolina]3155-a dallas of south carolina took [his]3155-a dallas of south carolina view of the case , and glibly talked of [his]3155-a dallas of south carolina soon being " on [his]3155-a dallas of south carolina feet again , "[231-beaufort] the argument lost its edge , and there was nothing to do but to accept this awful evidence of the indissolubility of marriage . Society must manage to get on without [the Beauforts]247-the beauforts , and there was an end of it -- except indeed for [such hapless victims of the disaster]3156-such hapless victims of the disaster as [Medora Manson]230-medora manson , [the poor old Miss Lannings]293-the lannings , and [certain other misguided ladies of good family who , if only [they]3154-those whose securities were not in jeopardy had listened to [Mr. Henry van der Luyden]302-mr. van der luyden]3157-certain other misguided ladies of good family who , if only they had listened to mr. henry van der luyden ...

" The best thing [the Beauforts]247-the beauforts can do , "[215-archer] said [Mrs. Archer]215-archer , summing it up as if [she]215-archer were pronouncing a diagnosis and prescribing a course of treatment , " is to go and live at [[Regina]467-regina 's little place in [North Carolina]166-north carolina]5114-regina 's little place in north carolina . [Beaufort]467-regina has always kept [a racing stable]5115-a racing stable , and [he]302-mr. van der luyden had better breed trotting horses . [I]635-every one should say [he]302-mr. van der luyden had all the qualities of [a successful horsedealer]5116-a successful horsedealer . "[635-every one] [Every one]635-every one agreed with [her]215-archer , but [no one]601-no one condescended to enquire what [the Beauforts]814-the beauforts really meant to do .

The next day [Mrs. Manson Mingott]217-mrs. manson mingott was much better : [she]217-mrs. manson mingott recovered [her]217-mrs. manson mingott voice sufficiently to give orders that [no one]601-no one should mention [the Beauforts]247-the beauforts to [her]217-mrs. manson mingott again , and asked -- when [Dr. Bencomb]450-dr. bencomb appeared -- what in [the world]561-the world [[her]217-mrs. manson mingott family]1193-her family meant by making such a fuss about [her]217-mrs. manson mingott health .

" If [people of]5117-people of [my]217-mrs. manson mingott age WILL eat chicken - salad in the evening what are [they]5117-people of to expect ? "[217-mrs. manson mingott] [she]217-mrs. manson mingott enquired ; and , [the doctor]3091-the doctor having opportunely modified [her]217-mrs. manson mingott dietary , the stroke was transformed into an attack of indigestion . But in spite of [her]217-mrs. manson mingott firm tone [old Catherine]237-old catherine did not wholly recover [her]217-mrs. manson mingott former attitude toward life . The growing remoteness of old age , though it had not diminished [her]217-mrs. manson mingott curiosity about [[her]217-mrs. manson mingott neighbours]3165-her neighbours , had blunted [her]217-mrs. manson mingott never very lively compassion for [their]3165-her neighbours troubles ; and [she]217-mrs. manson mingott seemed to have no difficulty in putting the Beaufort disaster out of [her]217-mrs. manson mingott mind . But for the first time [she]217-mrs. manson mingott became absorbed in [her]217-mrs. manson mingott own symptoms , and began to take a sentimental interest in [certain members of [[her]217-mrs. manson mingott family]1193-her family to whom [she]217-mrs. manson mingott had hitherto been contemptuously indifferent]3166-certain members of her family to whom she had hitherto been contemptuously indifferent .

[Mr. Welland]335-mr. welland , in particular , had the privilege of attracting [her]217-mrs. manson mingott notice . Of [[her]217-mrs. manson mingott sons - in - law]3168-her sons - in - law [he]335-mr. welland was the one [she]217-mrs. manson mingott had most consistently ignored ; and all [[his]335-mr. welland wife]553-his wife 's efforts to represent [him]335-mr. welland as [a man of forceful character and marked intellectual ability]3170-a man of forceful character and marked intellectual ability ( if [he]335-mr. welland had only " chosen "[335-mr. welland] ) had been met with a derisive chuckle . But [his]335-mr. welland eminence as [a valetudinarian]3171-a valetudinarian now made [him]335-mr. welland an object of engrossing interest , and [Mrs. Mingott]217-mrs. manson mingott issued an imperial summons to [him]335-mr. welland to come and compare diets as soon as [his]335-mr. welland temperature permitted ; for [old Catherine]237-old catherine was now the first to recognise that [one]503-one could not be too careful about temperatures .

Twenty - four hours after [Madame Olenska]241-madame olenska 's summons a telegram announced that [she]237-old catherine would arrive from [Washington]112-washington on the evening of the following day . At [the Wellands ']3173-the wellands ' , where [the Newland Archers]2310-the newland archers chanced to be lunching , the question as to who should meet [her]237-old catherine at [Jersey City]167-jersey city was immediately raised ; and the material difficulties amid which [the Welland household]3175-the welland household struggled as if [it]3175-the welland household had been [a frontier outpost]3176-a frontier outpost , lent animation to the debate . It was agreed that [Mrs. Welland]219-mrs. welland could not possibly go to [Jersey City]167-jersey city because [she]219-mrs. welland was to accompany [[her]219-mrs. welland husband]645-her husband to [old Catherine]237-old catherine 's that afternoon , and the brougham could not be spared , since , if [Mr. Welland]335-mr. welland were " upset "[335-mr. welland] by seeing [[his]335-mr. welland mother - in - law]3136-his mother - in - law for the first time after [her]219-mrs. welland attack , [he]335-mr. welland might have to be taken [home]631-home at a moment 's notice . [The Welland sons]3180-the welland sons would of course be " [down town]4949-down town , "[3180-the welland sons] [Mr. Lovell Mingott]455-mr. lovell mingott would be just hurrying back from [his]455-mr. lovell mingott shooting , and [the Mingott]455-mr. lovell mingott carriage engaged in meeting [him]455-mr. lovell mingott ; and [one]503-one could not ask [May]226-may , at the close of a winter afternoon , to go alone across [the ferry]3182-the ferry to [Jersey City]167-jersey city , even in [[her]226-may own carriage]2656-her own carriage . " It 's always one thing after another , "[1727-the poor lady] [the poor lady]1727-the poor lady grieved , in one of [her]1727-the poor lady rare revolts against fate ; " the only thing that makes [me]1727-the poor lady think [Mamma]245-mamma must be less well than [Dr. Bencomb]450-dr. bencomb will admit is this morbid desire to have [Ellen]233-ellen come at once , however inconvenient it is to meet [her]245-mamma . "[1727-the poor lady]

The words had been thoughtless , as the utterances of impatience often are ; and [Mr. Welland]335-mr. welland was upon [them]3189-them with a pounce .

" [Augusta]274-augusta , "[335-mr. welland] [he]335-mr. welland said , turning pale and laying down [his]335-mr. welland fork , " have [you]274-augusta any other reason for thinking that [Bencomb]450-dr. bencomb is less to be relied on than [he]335-mr. welland was ? "[335-mr. welland]

[Mr. Welland]335-mr. welland 's brow remained clouded , and it was evident that [his]335-mr. welland perturbed imagination had fastened at once on this last remark . " Yes : [[your]4004-my dear mother]4580-your mother 's [a very old woman]5123-a very old woman ; and for all [we]5122-we know [Bencomb]450-dr. bencomb may not be as successful with [very old people]5126-very old people . " But all the while , "[219-mrs. welland] [Mrs. Welland]219-mrs. welland began again , as [she]219-mrs. welland rose from the luncheon - table , and led the way into the wilderness of purple satin and malachite known as [the back drawing - room]3190-the back drawing - room , " [I]219-mrs. welland do n't see how [Ellen]233-ellen 's to be got [here]4019-here tomorrow evening ; and [I]219-mrs. welland do like to have things settled for at least twenty - four hours ahead . " Oh , [I]215-archer 'm not going , "[215-archer] [Archer]215-archer answered .

" Not going ? Why , what 's happened ? "[226-may] [Her]226-may voice was as clear as a bell , and full of wifely solicitude .

" The case is off -- postponed . "[226-may]

" Postponed ? How odd ! " [I]3196-he 'm not going till later on : luckily for the convenience of [[your]226-may family]4191-your family , "[3196-he] [he]3196-he continued , taking base refuge in sarcasm . XXIX .

[[His]3196-he wife]553-his wife 's dark blue brougham ( with the wedding varnish still on it ) met [Archer]215-archer at [the ferry]3182-the ferry , and conveyed [him]3196-he luxuriously to [the [Pennsylvania]171-pennsylvania terminus in [Jersey City]167-jersey city]3206-the pennsylvania terminus in jersey city .

It was a sombre snowy afternoon , and the gas - lamps were lit in [the big reverberating station]3207-the big reverberating station . As [he]3196-he paced [the platform]2254-the platform , waiting for the [Washington]112-washington express , [he]3196-he remembered that there were [people who thought there would one day be a tunnel under [the Hudson]61-the hudson through which [the trains of the Pennsylvania railway]3210-the trains of the pennsylvania railway would run straight into [New York]2-new york]3209-people who thought there would one day be a tunnel under the hudson through which the trains of the pennsylvania railway would run straight into new york . [They]3209-people who thought there would one day be a tunnel under the hudson through which the trains of the pennsylvania railway would run straight into new york were of [the brotherhood of visionaries who likewise predicted the building of [ships]3212-ships that would cross [the Atlantic]59-the atlantic]3211-the brotherhood of visionaries who likewise predicted the building of ships that would cross the atlantic in five days , the invention of a flying machine , lighting by electricity , telephonic communication without wires , and other Arabian Night marvels .

" [I]215-archer do n't care which of [their]3209-people who thought there would one day be a tunnel under the hudson through which the trains of the pennsylvania railway would run straight into new york visions comes true , "[215-archer] [Archer]215-archer mused , " as long as [the tunnel]5138-the tunnel is n't built yet . "[215-archer] In [his]3196-he senseless school - boy happiness [he]3196-he pictured [Madame Olenska]241-madame olenska 's descent from [the train]2232-the train , [his]3196-he discovery of [her]241-madame olenska a long way off , among the throngs of meaningless faces , [her]241-madame olenska clinging to [his]3196-he arm as [he]3196-he guided [her]241-madame olenska to [the carriage]859-the carriage , [their]3215-their slow approach to [the wharf]2834-the wharf among slipping horses , [laden carts]3217-laden carts , [vociferating teamsters]3218-vociferating teamsters , and then the startling quiet of [the ferry - boat]3219-the ferry - boat , where [they]3215-their would sit side by side under the snow , in [the motionless carriage]3220-the motionless carriage , while [the earth]3221-the earth seemed to glide away under [them]3215-their , rolling to the other side of the sun . It was incredible , the number of things [he]3196-he had to say to [her]241-madame olenska , and in what eloquent order they were forming themselves on [his]3196-he lips ...

The clanging and groaning of [the train]2232-the train came nearer , and it staggered slowly into [the station]1868-the station like a prey - laden monster into its lair . [Archer]215-archer pushed forward , elbowing through [the crowd]3224-the crowd , and staring blindly into window after window of [the high - hung carriages]3225-the high - hung carriages . And then , suddenly , [he]3196-he saw [Madame Olenska]241-madame olenska 's pale and surprised face close at hand , and had again the mortified sensation of having forgotten what [she]241-madame olenska looked like .

[They]3215-their reached [each other]558-each other , [their]3215-their hands met , and [he]3196-he drew [her]241-madame olenska arm through [his]3196-he . " This way -- [I]3196-he have [the carriage]859-the carriage , "[3196-he] [he]3196-he said .

After that it all happened as [he]3196-he had dreamed . [He]3196-he helped [her]241-madame olenska into the brougham with [her]241-madame olenska bags , and had afterward the vague recollection of having properly reassured [her]241-madame olenska about [[her]241-madame olenska grandmother]834-her grandmother and given [her]241-madame olenska a summary of the [Beaufort]231-beaufort situation ( [he]3196-he was struck by the softness of [her]241-madame olenska : " [Poor Regina]461-poor regina ! "[241-madame olenska] ) . Meanwhile [the carriage]859-the carriage had worked its way out of the coil about [the station]1868-the station , and [they]3230-they were crawling down [the slippery incline]3231-the slippery incline to [the wharf]2834-the wharf , menaced by [swaying coal - carts]3233-swaying coal - carts , bewildered horses , [dishevelled express - wagons]3234-dishevelled express - wagons , and [an empty hearse]3235-an empty hearse -- ah , that hearse ! [She]241-madame olenska shut [her]241-madame olenska eyes as it passed , and clutched at [Archer]215-archer 's hand .

" If only it does n't mean -- [poor Granny]244-granny ! "[241-madame olenska]

" Oh , no , no -- [she]244-granny 's much better -- [she]244-granny 's all right , really . There -- [we've]5140-we've passed it ! "[3196-he] [he]3196-he exclaimed , as if that made all the difference . [Her]241-madame olenska hand remained in [his]3196-he , and as [the carriage]859-the carriage lurched across the gang - plank onto [the ferry]3182-the ferry [he]3196-he bent over , unbuttoned [her]241-madame olenska tight brown glove , and kissed [her]241-madame olenska palm as if [he]3196-he had kissed a relic . " [Ellen]233-ellen -- [Ellen]233-ellen -- [Ellen]233-ellen ! "[3196-he]

[She]241-madame olenska made no answer , and [he]3239-he sat in silence , watching [her]241-madame olenska profile grow indistinct against the snow - streaked dusk beyond the window . What had [she]241-madame olenska been doing in all those four long months , [he]3239-he wondered ? How little [they]3240-their knew of [each other]558-each other , after all ! The precious moments were slipping away , but [he]3239-he had forgotten everything that [he]3239-he had meant to say to [her]241-madame olenska and could only helplessly brood on the mystery of [their]3240-their remoteness and [their]3240-their proximity , which seemed to be symbolised by the fact of [their]3240-their sitting so close to [each other]558-each other , and yet being unable to see [each other]558-each other 's faces .

" What [a pretty carriage]5142-a pretty carriage ! Is it [May]226-may 's ? "[241-madame olenska] [she]241-madame olenska asked , suddenly turning [her]241-madame olenska face from the window .

" Yes . "[3239-he]

In [his]3239-he brief letter to [her]241-madame olenska [he]3239-he had made no allusion to [M. "[3239-he]

[His]3246-you heart was beating suffocatingly . Would [she]3247-her meet this question with the same composure ?

" Yes : [I]3247-her owe [him]433-m. riviere a great debt , "[3247-her] [she]3247-her answered , without the least tremor in [her]3247-her quiet voice .

[Her]3247-her tone was so natural , so almost indifferent , that [Archer]215-archer 's turmoil subsided . Once more [she]3247-her had managed , by [her]3247-her sheer simplicity , to make [him]3246-you feel stupidly conventional just when [he]3246-you thought [he]3246-you was flinging convention to the winds .

" [I]3246-you think [you]3247-her 're [the most honest woman [I]3246-you ever met]5145-the most honest woman i ever met ! "[3246-you] [he]3246-you exclaimed .

" Oh , no -- but probably one of the least fussy , "[3247-her] [she]3247-her answered , a smile in [her]3247-her voice .

" Call it what [you]3246-you like : [you]3246-you look at things as they are . "[3247-her]

" Ah -- [I've]3246-you had to . [I]3247-her 've had to look at [the Gorgon]472-the gorgon . "[3247-her]

" Well -- it has n't blinded [you]3246-you ! [You]3246-you 've seen that [she]472-the gorgon 's just an old bogey like [all the others]2636-all the others . "[3247-her]

" [She]472-the gorgon does n't blind one ; but [she]472-the gorgon dries up one 's tears . "[3247-her]

The answer checked the pleading on [Archer]215-archer 's lips : it seemed to come from depths of experience beyond [his]3246-you reach . The slow advance of [the ferry - boat]3219-the ferry - boat had ceased , and [her]3247-her bows bumped against the piles of the slip with a violence that made [the brougham]5131-the brougham stagger , and flung [Archer]215-archer and [Madame Olenska]241-madame olenska against [each other]558-each other . [The young man]511-the young man , trembling , felt the pressure of [her]3247-her shoulder , and passed [his]511-the young man arm about [her]3247-her .

" If [you]3247-her 're not blind , then , [you]3247-her must see that this ca n't last . "[511-the young man]

" What ca n't ? "[511-the young man]

" [Our]3253-they being together -- and not together . "[511-the young man]

" No . [You]511-the young man ought not to have come today , "[3247-her] [she]3247-her said in an altered voice ; and suddenly [she]3247-her turned , flung [her]3247-her arms about [him]511-the young man and pressed [her]3247-her lips to [his]511-the young man . At the same moment [the carriage]859-the carriage began to move , and a gas - lamp at the head of the slip flashed its light into the window . [She]3247-her drew away , and [they]3253-they sat silent and motionless while [the brougham]5131-the brougham struggled through the congestion of carriages about [the ferry - landing]3255-the ferry - landing . As [they]3253-they gained [the street]1900-the street [Archer]215-archer began to speak hurriedly .

" Do n't be afraid of [me]215-archer : [you]3247-her need n't squeeze [yourself]3247-her back into [your]3247-her corner like that . A stolen kiss is n't what [I]215-archer want . Look : [I]215-archer 'm not even trying to touch the sleeve of [your]3247-her jacket . Do n't suppose that [I]215-archer do n't understand [your]3247-her reasons for not wanting to let this feeling between [us]3253-they dwindle into an ordinary hole - and - corner love - affair . [I]215-archer could n't have spoken like this yesterday , because when [we]3253-they 've been apart , and [I]215-archer 'm looking forward to seeing [you]3247-her , every thought is burnt up in a great flame . But then [you]3247-her come ; and [you]3247-her 're so much more than [I]215-archer remembered , and what [I]215-archer want of [you]3247-her is so much more than an hour or two every now and then , with wastes of thirsty waiting between , that [I]215-archer can sit perfectly still beside [you]3247-her , like this , with that other vision in [my]215-archer mind , just quietly trusting to it to come true . "[215-archer]

For a moment [she]3257-she made no reply ; then [she]3257-she asked , hardly above a whisper : " What do [you]215-archer mean by trusting to it to come true ? "[3257-she]

" Why -- [you]215-archer know it will , do n't [you]215-archer ? "[215-archer]

" [Your]215-archer vision of [you]215-archer and [me]3257-she together ? "[3257-she] [She]3257-she burst into a sudden hard laugh . " [You]215-archer choose [your]215-archer place well to put it to [me]3257-she ! "[3257-she]

" Do [you]215-archer mean because [we]5147-we 're in [[[my]3257-she wife]3988-my wife 's brougham]5149-my wife 's brougham ? Shall [we]5147-we get out and walk , then ? [I]3257-she do n't suppose [you]215-archer mind a little snow ? "[3257-she]

[She]3257-she laughed again , more gently . " No ; [I]3257-she sha n't get out and walk , because [my]3257-she business is to get to [Granny]244-granny 's as quickly as [I]3257-she can . And [you]215-archer 'll sit beside [me]3257-she , and [we]5147-we 'll look , not at visions , but at realities . "[3257-she]

" [I]3257-she do n't know what [you]215-archer mean by realities . The only reality to [me]3257-she is this . "[3257-she]

[She]3257-she met the words with a long silence , during which [the carriage]859-the carriage rolled down [an obscure side - street]3259-an obscure side - street and then turned into the searching illumination of [Fifth Avenue]18-fifth avenue .

" Is it [your]215-archer idea , then , that [I]3257-she should live with [you]215-archer as [[your]215-archer mistress]5150-your mistress -- since [I]3257-she ca n't be [[your]215-archer wife]5038-your wife ? "[3257-she] [she]3257-she asked .

The crudeness of the question startled [him]3260-he : the word was one that [women of [his]3260-he class]3261-women of his class fought shy of , even when [their]3261-women of his class talk flitted closest about the topic . [He]3260-he noticed that [Madame Olenska]241-madame olenska pronounced it as if it had a recognised place in [her]241-madame olenska vocabulary , and [he]3260-he wondered if it had been used familiarly in [her]241-madame olenska presence in the horrible life [she]241-madame olenska had fled from . [Her]3257-she question pulled [him]3260-he up with a jerk , and [he]3260-he floundered .

" [I]3257-she want -- [I]3257-she want somehow to get away with [you]3260-he into a world where words like that -- categories like that -- won't exist . Where [we]5152-we shall be simply [two human beings who love each other , who are the whole of life to each other]5153-two human beings who love each other , who are the whole of life to each other ; and nothing else on [earth]882-earth will matter . "[3257-she]

[She]3257-she drew a deep sigh that ended in another laugh . " Oh , [[my]3257-she dear]4004-my dear -- where is [that country]5156-that country ? Have [you]3260-he ever been [there]713-there ? "[3257-she] [she]3257-she asked ; and as [he]3260-he remained sullenly dumb [she]3257-she went on : " [I]3257-she know so many who 've tried to find it ; and , believe [me]3257-she , [they]5158-they all got out by mistake at [wayside stations]5159-wayside stations : at [places like [Boulogne]172-boulogne]5160-places like boulogne , or [Pisa]173-pisa , or [Monte Carlo]174-monte carlo -- and it was n't at all different from [the old world]5161-the old world [they]5158-they 'd left , but only rather smaller and dingier and more promiscuous . "[3257-she]

[He]3260-he had never heard [her]3257-she speak in such a tone , and [he]3260-he remembered the phrase [she]3257-she had used a little while before .

" Yes , [the Gorgon]472-the gorgon HAS dried [your]3257-she tears , "[3260-he] [he]3260-he said .

" Well , [she]3257-she opened [my]3257-she eyes too ; it 's a delusion to say that [she]3257-she blinds [people]619-people . What [she]3257-she does is just the contrary -- [she]3257-she fastens [their]619-people eyelids open , so that [they]619-people 're never again in the blessed darkness . Is n't there a Chinese torture like that ? There ought to be . Ah , believe [me]3257-she , it 's [a miserable little country]5163-a miserable little country ! "[3257-she]

[The carriage]859-the carriage had crossed [Forty - second Street]175-forty - second street : [May]226-may 's sturdy brougham - horse was carrying [them]859-the carriage northward as if [he]3260-he had been [a Kentucky trotter]3263-a kentucky trotter . [Archer]215-archer choked with the sense of wasted minutes and vain words .

" Then what , exactly , is [your]3257-she plan for [us]859-the carriage ? "[3260-he] [he]3260-he asked .

" For [US]859-the carriage ? But there 's no [US]859-the carriage in that sense ! [We]859-the carriage 're near [each other]558-each other only if [we]859-the carriage stay far from [each other]558-each other . Then [we]859-the carriage can be [ourselves]859-the carriage . Otherwise [we]859-the carriage 're only [Newland Archer]215-archer , [the husband of [[Ellen Olenska]233-ellen 's cousin]5167-ellen olenska 's cousin]5166-the husband of ellen olenska 's cousin , and [Ellen Olenska]233-ellen , [the cousin of [Newland Archer]215-archer 's wife]5168-the cousin of newland archer 's wife , trying to be happy behind the backs of [the people who trust [them]859-the carriage]5169-the people who trust them . "[3260-he]

" Ah , [I]3260-he 'm beyond that , "[3260-he] [he]3260-he groaned .

" No , [you]3260-he 're not ! [You]3260-he 've never been beyond . And [I]3264-she have , "[3264-she] [she]3264-she said , in a strange voice , " and [I]3264-she know what it looks like there . "[3264-she]

[He]3260-he sat silent , dazed with inarticulate pain . Then [he]3260-he groped in the darkness of [the carriage]859-the carriage for the little bell that signalled orders to [the coachman]1429-the coachman . [He]3260-he remembered that [May]226-may rang twice when [she]226-may wished to stop . [He]3260-he pressed the bell , and [the carriage]859-the carriage drew up beside [the curbstone]3268-the curbstone .

" Why are [we]5170-we stopping ? This is not [Granny]244-granny 's , "[241-madame olenska] [Madame Olenska]241-madame olenska exclaimed .

" No : [I]3260-he shall get out here , "[3260-he] [he]3260-he stammered , opening the door and jumping to [the pavement]3269-the pavement . By the light of a street - lamp [he]3260-he saw [her]3264-she startled face , and the instinctive motion [she]3264-she made to detain [him]3260-he . [He]3260-he closed the door , and leaned for a moment in the window .

" [You]3264-she 're right : [I]3260-he ought not to have come today , "[3260-he] [he]3260-he said , lowering [his]3260-he voice so that [the coachman]1429-the coachman should not hear . [She]3264-she bent forward , and seemed about to speak ; but [he]3260-he had already called out the order to drive on , and [the carriage]859-the carriage rolled away while [he]3260-he stood on the corner . The snow was over , and a tingling wind had sprung up , that lashed [his]3260-he face as [he]3260-he stood gazing . Suddenly [he]3260-he felt something stiff and cold on [his]3260-he lashes , and perceived that [he]3260-he had been crying , and that the wind had frozen [his]3260-he tears .

[He]3260-he thrust [his]3260-he hands in [his]3260-he pockets , and walked at a sharp pace down [Fifth Avenue]18-fifth avenue to [[his]3260-he own house]915-his own house .

XXX .

That evening when [Archer]215-archer came down before dinner [he]3260-he found [the drawing - room]964-the drawing - room empty .

[He]3260-he and [May]226-may were dining alone , [all the family]3274-all the family engagements having been postponed since [Mrs. Manson Mingott]217-mrs. manson mingott 's illness ; and as [May]226-may was the more punctual of [the two]778-the two [he]3260-he was surprised that [she]226-may had not preceded [him]3260-he . [He]3260-he knew that [she]226-may was at [home]631-home , for while [he]3260-he dressed [he]3260-he had heard [her]226-may moving about in [[her]226-may room]3085-her room ; and [he]3260-he wondered what had delayed [her]226-may .

[He]3260-he had fallen into the way of dwelling on such conjectures as a means of tying [his]3260-he thoughts fast to reality . Sometimes [he]3260-he felt as if [he]3260-he had found the clue to [[his]3260-he father - in - law]2626-his father - in - law 's absorption in trifles ; perhaps even [Mr. Welland]335-mr. welland , long ago , had had escapes and visions , and had conjured up all the hosts of domesticity to defend [himself]3260-he against [them]3279-them .

When [May]3280-may appeared [he]3260-he thought [she]226-may looked tired . [She]226-may had put on the low - necked and tightly - laced dinner - dress which [the Mingott ceremonial]3281-the mingott ceremonial exacted on the most informal occasions , and had built [her]226-may fair hair into its usual accumulated coils ; and [her]226-may face , in contrast , was wan and almost faded . But [she]226-may shone on [him]3260-he with [her]226-may usual tenderness , and [her]226-may eyes had kept the blue dazzle of the day before .

" What became of [you]3260-he , [dear]3991-dear ? "[226-may] [she]226-may asked . " [I]226-may was waiting at [[Granny]244-granny 's]5172-granny 's , and [Ellen]233-ellen came alone , and said [she]233-ellen had dropped [you]3260-he on the way because [you]3260-he had to rush off on business . There 's nothing wrong ? "[226-may]

" Only some letters [I]226-may 'd forgotten , and wanted to get off before dinner . "[226-may]

" Ah-- "[226-may] [she]226-may said ; and a moment afterward : " [I]226-may 'm sorry [you]3260-he did n't come to [Granny's]473-granny's -- unless the letters were urgent . "[226-may]

" They were , "[3260-he] [he]3260-he rejoined , surprised at [her]226-may insistence . " Besides , [I]3260-he do n't see why [I]3260-he should have gone to [[your]3260-he grandmother]5173-your grandmother 's . [I]3260-he did n't know [you]3260-he were [there]713-there . "[3260-he]

[She]226-may turned and moved to the looking - glass above the mantel - piece . As [she]226-may stood there , lifting [her]226-may long arm to fasten a puff that had slipped from its place in [her]226-may intricate hair , [Archer]215-archer was struck by something languid and inelastic in [her]226-may attitude , and wondered if the deadly monotony of [their]3282-their lives had laid its weight on [her]226-may also . Then [he]3260-he remembered that , as [he]3260-he had left [the house]516-the house that morning , [she]226-may had called over the stairs that [she]226-may would meet [him]3260-he at [[her]226-may grandmother]834-her grandmother 's so that [they]3282-their might drive [home]631-home together . [He]3260-he had called back a cheery " Yes ! "[3260-he] and then , absorbed in other visions , had forgotten [his]3260-he promise . Now [he]3260-he was smitten with compunction , yet irritated that so trifling an omission should be stored up against [him]3260-he after nearly two years of marriage . [He]3260-he was weary of living in a perpetual tepid honeymoon , without the temperature of passion yet with all its exactions . If [May]226-may had spoken out [her]226-may grievances ( [he]3260-he suspected [her]226-may of many ) [he]3260-he might have laughed them away ; but [she]226-may was trained to conceal imaginary wounds under a Spartan smile .

To disguise [his]3260-he own annoyance [he]3260-he asked how [[her]226-may grandmother]834-her grandmother was , and [she]226-may answered that [Mrs. Mingott]217-mrs. manson mingott was still improving , but had been rather disturbed by the last news about [the Beauforts]247-the beauforts .

" What news ? "[226-may]

" [It]5175-it seems [they]247-the beauforts 're going to stay in [New York]2-new york . [I]226-may believe [he]3260-he 's going into [an insurance business]5176-an insurance business , or something . [They]247-the beauforts 're looking about for [a small house]5177-a small house . "[226-may]

The preposterousness of the case was beyond discussion , and [they]3287-they went in to dinner . During dinner [their]3287-they talk moved in its usual limited circle ; but [Archer]215-archer noticed that [[his]3260-he wife]553-his wife made no allusion to [Madame Olenska]241-madame olenska , nor to old [Catherine]237-old catherine 's reception of [her]553-his wife . [He]3260-he was thankful for the fact , yet felt it to be vaguely ominous .

[They]3287-they went up to [the library]750-the library for coffee , and [Archer]215-archer lit a cigar and took down a volume of Michelet . [He]3260-he had taken to history in the evenings since [May]226-may had shown a tendency to ask [him]3260-he to read aloud whenever [she]226-may saw [him]3260-he with a volume of poetry : not that [he]3260-he disliked the sound of [his]3260-he own voice , but because [he]3260-he could always foresee [her]226-may comments on what [he]3260-he read . In the days of [their]3287-they engagement [she]226-may had simply ( as [he]3260-he now perceived ) echoed what [he]3260-he told [her]226-may ; but since [he]3260-he had ceased to provide [her]226-may with opinions [she]226-may had begun to hazard [her]226-may own , with results destructive to [his]3260-he enjoyment of the works commented on .

Seeing that [he]3260-he had chosen history [she]226-may fetched [her]226-may workbasket , drew up an arm - chair to the green - shaded student lamp , and uncovered a cushion [she]226-may was embroidering for [his]3260-he sofa . [She]226-may was not [a clever needle - woman]3290-a clever needle - woman ; [her]226-may large capable hands were made for riding , rowing and open - air activities ; but since [other wives]3291-other wives embroidered cushions for [[their]3291-other wives husbands]3292-their husbands [she]226-may did not wish to omit this last link in [her]226-may devotion .

[She]226-may was so placed that [Archer]215-archer , by merely raising [his]3260-he eyes , could see [her]226-may bent above [her]226-may work - frame , [her]226-may ruffled elbow - sleeves slipping back from [her]226-may firm round arms , the betrothal sapphire shining on [her]226-may left hand above [her]226-may broad gold wedding - ring , and the right hand slowly and laboriously stabbing the canvas . As [she]226-may sat thus , the lamplight full on [her]226-may clear brow , [he]3260-he said to [himself]3260-he with a secret dismay that [he]3260-he would always know the thoughts behind it , that never , in all the years to come , would [she]226-may surprise [him]3260-he by an unexpected mood , by a new idea , a weakness , a cruelty or an emotion . [She]226-may had spent [her]226-may poetry and romance on [their]3293-their short courting : the function was exhausted because the need was past . Now [she]226-may was simply ripening into a copy of [[her]226-may mother]587-her mother , and mysteriously , by the very process , trying to turn [him]3260-he into [a Mr. Welland]3295-a mr. welland . [He]3260-he laid down [his]3260-he book and stood up impatiently ; and at once [she]226-may raised [her]226-may head .

" What 's the matter ? "[226-may]

" [The room]972-the room is stifling : [I]226-may want a little air . "[226-may]

[He]3260-he had insisted that the library curtains should draw backward and forward on a rod , so that they might be closed in the evening , instead of remaining nailed to a gilt cornice , and immovably looped up over layers of lace , as in [the drawing - room]964-the drawing - room ; and [he]3260-he pulled them back and pushed up the sash , leaning out into the icy night . The mere fact of not looking at [May]226-may , seated beside [his]3260-he table , under [his]3260-he lamp , the fact of seeing [other houses]3297-other houses , [roofs]3298-roofs , [chimneys]3299-chimneys , of getting the sense of other lives outside [his]3260-he own , [other cities beyond [New York]2-new york]3300-other cities beyond new york , and [a whole world beyond [his]3260-he world]3301-a whole world beyond his world , cleared [his]3260-he brain and made it easier to breathe .

After [he]3260-he had leaned out into the darkness for a few minutes [he]3260-he heard [her]226-may say : " [Newland]215-archer ! Do shut the window . [You]3260-he 'll catch [your]3260-he death . "[226-may]

[He]3260-he pulled the sash down and turned back . " Catch [my]3260-he death ! "[3260-he] [he]3260-he echoed ; and [he]3260-he felt like adding : " But [I]3260-he 've caught it already . [I]3260-he AM dead -- [I've]3260-he been dead for months and months . "[3260-he]

And suddenly the play of the word flashed up a wild suggestion . What if it were [SHE]226-may who was dead ! If [she]226-may were going to die -- to die soon -- and leave [him]3260-he free ! The sensation of standing there , in [that warm familiar room]3302-that warm familiar room , and looking at [her]226-may , and wishing [her]226-may dead , was so strange , so fascinating and overmastering , that its enormity did not immediately strike [him]3260-he . [He]3260-he simply felt that chance had given [him]3260-he a new possibility to which [his]3260-he sick soul might cling . Yes , [May]3303-may might die -- [people]619-people did : [young people]4840-young people , [[healthy people]3306-healthy people like [herself]3303-may]3307-healthy people like herself : [she]226-may might die , and set [him]3260-he suddenly free .

[She]3303-may glanced up , and [he]3260-he saw by [her]3303-may widening eyes that there must be something strange in [his]3260-he own .

" [Newland]215-archer ! Are [you]3303-may ill ? "[3303-may]

[He]3260-he shook [his]3260-he head and turned toward [his]3260-he arm - chair . [She]3303-may bent over [her]3303-may work - frame , and as [he]3260-he passed [he]3260-he laid [his]3260-he hand on [her]3303-may hair . " [Poor May]226-may ! "[3260-he] [he]3260-he said .

" [Poor]5179-poor ? Why poor ? "[3303-may] [she]3303-may echoed with a strained laugh .

" Because [I]3260-he shall never be able to open a window without worrying [you]3303-may , "[3260-he] [he]3260-he rejoined , laughing also .

For a moment [she]3303-may was silent ; then [she]3303-may said very low , [her]3303-may head bowed over [her]3303-may work : " [I]3303-may shall never worry if [you]3260-he 're happy . "[3303-may]

" Ah , [[my]3303-may dear]4004-my dear ; and [I]3303-may shall never be happy unless [I]3303-may can open the windows ! "[3303-may]

" In THIS weather ? "[3303-may] [she]3303-may remonstrated ; and with a sigh [he]3260-he buried [his]3260-he head in [his]3260-he book .

Six or seven days passed . [Archer]215-archer heard nothing from [Madame Olenska]241-madame olenska , and became aware that [her]241-madame olenska name would not be mentioned in [his]3260-he presence by [any member of [the family]532-the family]3308-any member of the family . [He]3260-he did not try to see [her]241-madame olenska ; to do so while [she]241-madame olenska was at old [Catherine]237-old catherine 's guarded bedside would have been almost impossible . In the uncertainty of the situation [he]3260-he let [himself]3260-he drift , conscious , somewhere below the surface of [his]3260-he thoughts , of a resolve which had come to [him]3260-he when [he]3260-he had leaned out from [his]3260-he library window into the icy night . The strength of that resolve made it easy to wait and make no sign .

Then one day [May]226-may told [him]3260-he that [Mrs. Manson Mingott]217-mrs. manson mingott had asked to see [him]3260-he . There was nothing surprising in the request , for [the old lady]3973-the old lady was steadily recovering , and [she]3973-the old lady had always openly declared that [she]3973-the old lady preferred [Archer]215-archer to [any of [[her]3973-the old lady other grandsons - in - law]3312-her other grandsons - in - law]3311-any of her other grandsons - in - law . [May]3313-may gave the message with evident pleasure : [she]3313-may was proud of [old Catherine]237-old catherine 's appreciation of [[her]3313-may husband]645-her husband .

There was a moment 's pause , and then [Archer]215-archer felt it incumbent on [him]3260-he to say : " All right . Shall [we]5181-we go together this afternoon ? "[215-archer]

[[His]3260-he wife]553-his wife 's face brightened , but [she]553-his wife instantly answered : " Oh , [you]215-archer 'd much better go alone . It bores [Granny]244-granny to see [the same people]4375-the same people too often . "[553-his wife]

[Archer]215-archer 's heart was beating violently when [he]3260-he rang [old Mrs. Mingott]217-mrs. manson mingott 's bell . [He]3260-he had wanted above all things to go alone , for [he]3260-he felt sure the visit would give [him]3260-he the chance of saying a word in private to [the Countess Olenska]235-the countess olenska . [He]3260-he had determined to wait till the chance presented itself naturally ; and here it was , and here [he]3260-he was on the doorstep . Behind the door , behind the curtains of [the yellow damask room]3316-the yellow damask room next to [the hall]736-the hall , [she]553-his wife was surely awaiting [him]3260-he ; in another moment [he]3260-he should see [her]553-his wife , and be able to speak to [her]553-his wife before [she]553-his wife led [him]3260-he to [the sick - room]3318-the sick - room .

[He]3260-he wanted only to put one question : after that [his]3260-he course would be clear . What [he]3260-he wished to ask was simply the date of [her]553-his wife return to [Washington]112-washington ; and that question [she]553-his wife could hardly refuse to answer .

But in [the yellow sitting - room]3319-the yellow sitting - room it was [the mulatto maid who waited]3320-the mulatto maid who waited . [Her]3320-the mulatto maid who waited white teeth shining like a keyboard , [she]3320-the mulatto maid who waited pushed back the sliding doors and ushered [him]3260-he into [old Catherine]237-old catherine 's presence .

[The old woman]3094-the old woman sat in a vast throne - like arm - chair near [her]3094-the old woman bed . Beside [her]3094-the old woman was a mahogany stand bearing a cast bronze lamp with an engraved globe , over which a green paper shade had been balanced . There was not a book or a newspaper in reach , nor any evidence of feminine employment : conversation had always been [Mrs. Mingott]217-mrs. manson mingott 's sole pursuit , and [she]3094-the old woman would have scorned to feign an interest in fancywork .

[Archer]215-archer saw no trace of the slight distortion left by [her]3094-the old woman stroke . [She]3094-the old woman merely looked paler , with darker shadows in the folds and recesses of [her]3094-the old woman obesity ; and , in the fluted mob - cap tied by a starched bow between [her]3094-the old woman first two chins , and the muslin kerchief crossed over [her]3094-the old woman billowing purple dressing - gown , [she]3094-the old woman seemed like [some shrewd and kindly ancestress of [her]3094-the old woman own who might have yielded too freely to the pleasures of the table]3322-some shrewd and kindly ancestress of her own who might have yielded too freely to the pleasures of the table .

[She]3094-the old woman held out one of the little hands that nestled in a hollow of [her]3094-the old woman huge lap like pet animals , and called to [the maid]2049-the maid : " Do n't let in [any one else]565-any one else . If [[my]3094-the old woman daughters]5184-my daughters call , say [I]3094-the old woman 'm asleep . "[3094-the old woman]

[The maid]2049-the maid disappeared , and [the old lady]3973-the old lady turned to [[her]3973-the old lady grandson]3326-her grandson .

" [[My]3973-the old lady dear]4004-my dear , am [I]3973-the old lady perfectly hideous ? "[3973-the old lady] [she]3973-the old lady asked gaily , launching out one hand in search of the folds of muslin on [her]3973-the old lady inaccessible bosom . " [[My]3973-the old lady daughters]5184-my daughters tell [me]3973-the old lady it does n't matter at [my]3973-the old lady age -- as if hideousness did n't matter all the more the harder it gets to conceal ! "[3973-the old lady]

" [[My]215-archer dear]4004-my dear , [you]3973-the old lady 're handsomer than ever ! "[215-archer] [Archer]215-archer rejoined in the same tone ; and [she]3973-the old lady threw back [her]3973-the old lady head and laughed .

" Ah , but not as handsome as [Ellen]233-ellen ! "[3973-the old lady] [she]3973-the old lady jerked out , twinkling at [him]3326-her grandson maliciously ; and before [he]3326-her grandson could answer [she]3973-the old lady added : " Was [she]233-ellen so awfully handsome the day [you]3326-her grandson drove [her]233-ellen up from [the ferry]3182-the ferry ? "[3973-the old lady]

[He]3326-her grandson laughed , and [she]3973-the old lady continued : " Was it because [you]3326-her grandson told [her]233-ellen so that [she]233-ellen had to put [you]3326-her grandson out on the way ? In [my]3973-the old lady youth [young men]930-young men did n't desert [pretty women]1873-pretty women unless [they]930-young men were made to ! "[3973-the old lady] [She]3973-the old lady gave another chuckle , and interrupted it to say almost querulously : " It 's a pity [she]233-ellen did n't marry [you]3326-her grandson ; [I]3973-the old lady always told [her]233-ellen so . It would have spared [me]3973-the old lady all this worry . But who ever thought of sparing [[their]930-young men grandmother]5191-their grandmother worry ? "[3973-the old lady]

[Archer]215-archer wondered if [her]3973-the old lady illness had blurred [her]3973-the old lady faculties ; but suddenly [she]3973-the old lady broke out : " Well , it 's settled , anyhow : [she]233-ellen 's going to stay with [me]3973-the old lady , whatever [the rest of [the family]532-the family]4974-the rest of the family say ! [She]233-ellen had n't been [here]4019-here five minutes before [I]3973-the old lady 'd have gone down on [my]3973-the old lady knees to keep [her]233-ellen -- if only , for the last twenty years , [I]3973-the old lady 'd been able to see where the floor was ! "[3973-the old lady]

[Archer]215-archer listened in silence , and [she]3973-the old lady went on : " [They]930-young men 'd talked [me]3973-the old lady over , as no doubt [you]215-archer know : persuaded [me]3973-the old lady , [Lovell]455-mr. lovell mingott , and [Letterblair]353-mr. letterblair , and [Augusta Welland]274-augusta , and [all the rest of [them]930-young men]5195-all the rest of them , that [I]3973-the old lady must hold out and cut off [her]233-ellen allowance , till [she]233-ellen was made to see that it was [her]233-ellen duty to go back to [Olenski]278-count olenski . [They]930-young men thought [they]930-young men 'd convinced [me]3973-the old lady when [the secretary]4064-the secretary , or whatever [he]4064-the secretary was , came out with the last proposals : handsome proposals [I]3973-the old lady confess they were . After all , marriage is marriage , and money 's money -- both useful things in [their]930-young men way ... and [I]3973-the old lady did n't know what to answer-- "[3973-the old lady] [She]3327-i broke off and drew a long breath , as if speaking had become an effort . " But the minute [I]3327-i laid eyes on [her]233-ellen , [I]3327-i said : ' [[You]233-ellen sweet bird]5197-you sweet bird , [you]233-ellen ! ' And now it 's settled that [she]233-ellen 's to stay here and nurse [[her]233-ellen [Granny]244-granny]5199-her granny as long as there 's [a Granny]5200-a granny to nurse . "[3327-i]

[The young man]511-the young man heard [her]3327-i with veins aglow ; but in [his]511-the young man confusion of mind [he]511-the young man hardly knew whether [her]3327-i news brought joy or pain . [He]511-the young man had so definitely decided on the course [he]511-the young man meant to pursue that for the moment [he]511-the young man could not readjust [his]511-the young man thoughts . But gradually there stole over [him]511-the young man the delicious sense of difficulties deferred and opportunities miraculously provided . If [Ellen]233-ellen had consented to come and live with [[her]233-ellen grandmother]834-her grandmother it must surely be because [she]834-her grandmother had recognised the impossibility of giving [him]511-the young man up . This was [her]834-her grandmother answer to [his]511-the young man final appeal of the other day : if [she]834-her grandmother would not take the extreme step [he]511-the young man had urged , [she]834-her grandmother had at last yielded to half - measures . [He]511-the young man sank back into the thought with the involuntary relief of [a man who has been ready to risk everything]3330-a man who has been ready to risk everything , and suddenly tastes the dangerous sweetness of security .

" [She]834-her grandmother could n't have gone back -- it was impossible ! "[511-the young man] [he]511-the young man exclaimed .

" Ah , [[my]3331-her dear]4004-my dear , [I]3331-her always knew [you]4004-my dear were on [her]834-her grandmother side ; and that 's why [I]3331-her sent for [you]4004-my dear today , and why [I]3331-her said to [[your]4004-my dear pretty wife]5202-your pretty wife , when [she]5202-your pretty wife proposed to come with [you]4004-my dear : ' No , [[my]3331-her dear]4004-my dear , [I]3331-her 'm pining to see [Newland]215-archer , and [I]3331-her do n't want [anybody]3958-anybody to share [our]5205-our transports . ' For [you]3332-you see , [[my]3331-her dear--]5206-my dear-- "[3331-her] [she]3331-her drew [her]3331-her head back as far as its tethering chins permitted , and looked [him]3332-you full in the eyes--"you see , [we]5205-our shall have a fight yet . [The family]532-the family do n't want [her]3331-her [here]4019-here , and [they]532-the family 'll say it 's because [I]3332-you 've been ill , because [I]3332-you 'm [a weak old woman]5209-a weak old woman , that [she]3331-her 's persuaded [me]3332-you . " [I]3332-you ? "[3332-you] [he]3332-you stammered .

" [You]3332-you . Why not ? "[3331-her] [she]3331-her jerked back at [him]3332-you , [her]3331-her round eyes suddenly as sharp as pen - knives . [Her]3331-her hand fluttered from its chair - arm and lit on [his]3332-you with a clutch of little pale nails like bird - claws . " Why not ? "[3331-her] [she]3331-her searchingly repeated .

" Oh , [I]3331-her do n't count -- [I'm]3331-her too insignificant . "[3331-her]

" Oh , [[my]3333-he dear]4004-my dear , [I]3333-he back [you]3331-her to hold [your]3331-her own against [them]5211-they all without [my]3333-he help ; but [you]3331-her shall have it if [you]3331-her need it , "[3333-he] [he]3333-he reassured [her]3331-her .

" Then [we]5213-we 're safe ! "[3331-her]

" And [Madame Olenska]241-madame olenska ? When am [I]3333-he to see [her]241-madame olenska ? "[3333-he] [he]3333-he said .

[The old lady]3973-the old lady chuckled , crumpled [her]3973-the old lady lids , and went through the pantomime of archness . " Not today . One at a time , please . [Madame Olenska]241-madame olenska 's gone out . "[3973-the old lady]

[He]3333-he flushed with disappointment , and [she]3973-the old lady went on : " [She]241-madame olenska 's gone out , [[my]3973-the old lady child]4006-my child : gone in [[my]3973-the old lady carriage]5216-my carriage to see [Regina Beaufort]467-regina . "[3973-the old lady]

[She]3973-the old lady paused for this announcement to produce its effect . " That 's what [she]241-madame olenska 's reduced [me]3973-the old lady to already . The day after [she]241-madame olenska got [here]4019-here [she]241-madame olenska put on [her]241-madame olenska best bonnet , and told [me]3973-the old lady , as cool as [a cucumber]5218-a cucumber , that [she]241-madame olenska was going to call on [Regina Beaufort]467-regina . ' [I]3973-the old lady do n't know [her]241-madame olenska ; who is [she]241-madame olenska ? ' says [I.]3973-the old lady ' [She]241-madame olenska 's [[your]3973-the old lady grand - niece]5219-your grand - niece , and [a most unhappy woman]5220-a most unhappy woman , ' [she]3973-the old lady says . ' [She]241-madame olenska 's [the wife of [a scoundrel]5222-a scoundrel]5221-the wife of a scoundrel , ' [I]3973-the old lady answered . ' Well , ' [she]3973-the old lady says , ' and so am [I]3973-the old lady , and yet all [[my]3973-the old lady family]4397-my family want [me]3973-the old lady to go back to [him]5222-a scoundrel . ' Well , that floored [me]3973-the old lady , and [I]3973-the old lady let [her]3973-the old lady go ; and finally one day [she]3973-the old lady said it was raining too hard to go out on foot , and [she]3973-the old lady wanted [me]3973-the old lady to lend [her]3973-the old lady [[my]3973-the old lady carriage]5216-my carriage . After all , [Regina]467-regina 's [a brave woman]5227-a brave woman , and so is [she]467-regina ; and [I]3973-the old lady 've always liked courage above everything . "[3973-the old lady]

[Archer]215-archer bent down and pressed [his]3335-his lips on the little hand that still lay on [his]3335-his .

" Eh -- eh -- eh !
