"[3973-the old lady] [the old lady]3973-the old lady snapped out with [her]3973-the old lady mocking cackle ; and as [he]3335-his rose to go [she]3973-the old lady called out after [him]3335-his : " Give [her]5038-your wife [her]5038-your wife [Granny]244-granny 's love ; but [you]3335-his 'd better not say anything about [our]5230-our talk . "[3973-the old lady]

XXXI .

[Archer]215-archer had been stunned by [old Catherine]237-old catherine 's news . It was only natural that [Madame Olenska]241-madame olenska should have hastened from [Washington]112-washington in response to [[her]241-madame olenska grandmother]834-her grandmother 's summons ; but that [she]241-madame olenska should have decided to remain under [her]241-madame olenska roof -- especially now that [Mrs. Mingott]217-mrs. manson mingott had almost regained [her]217-mrs. manson mingott health -- was less easy to explain .

[Archer]215-archer was sure that [Madame Olenska]241-madame olenska 's decision had not been influenced by the change in [her]241-madame olenska financial situation . [He]3335-his knew the exact figure of the small income which [[her]241-madame olenska husband]645-her husband had allowed [her]241-madame olenska at [their]3339-their separation . Without the addition of [[her]241-madame olenska grandmother]834-her grandmother 's allowance it was hardly enough to live on , in any sense known to [the Mingott vocabulary]3341-the mingott vocabulary ; and now that [Medora Manson]230-medora manson , who shared [her]230-medora manson life , had been ruined , such a pittance would barely keep [the two women]894-the two women clothed and fed . Yet [Archer]215-archer was convinced that [Madame Olenska]241-madame olenska had not accepted [[her]241-madame olenska grandmother]834-her grandmother 's offer from interested motives .

[She]241-madame olenska had the heedless generosity and the spasmodic extravagance of persons used to large fortunes , and indifferent to money ; but [she]241-madame olenska could go without many things which [her]241-madame olenska relations considered indispensable , and [Mrs. Lovell Mingott]218-mrs. lovell mingott and [Mrs. Welland]219-mrs. welland had often been heard to deplore that [any one who had enjoyed the cosmopolitan luxuries of [[Count Olenski]278-count olenski 's establishments]3345-count olenski 's establishments]3344-any one who had enjoyed the cosmopolitan luxuries of count olenski 's establishments should care so little about " how things were done . "[3344-any one who had enjoyed the cosmopolitan luxuries of count olenski 's establishments] Moreover , as [Archer]215-archer knew , several months had passed since [her]241-madame olenska allowance had been cut off ; yet in the interval [she]241-madame olenska had made no effort to regain [[her]241-madame olenska grandmother]834-her grandmother 's favour . Therefore if [she]241-madame olenska had changed [her]241-madame olenska course it must be for a different reason .

[He]3347-he did not have far to seek for that reason . On the way from [the ferry]3182-the ferry [she]241-madame olenska had told [him]3347-he that [he]3347-he and [she]241-madame olenska must remain apart ; but [she]241-madame olenska had said it with [her]241-madame olenska head on [his]3347-he breast . [He]3347-he knew that there was no calculated coquetry in [her]241-madame olenska words ; [she]241-madame olenska was fighting [her]241-madame olenska fate as [he]3347-he had fought [his]3347-he , and clinging desperately to [her]241-madame olenska resolve that [they]3349-they should not break faith with [the people who trusted [them]3349-they]3350-the people who trusted them . But during the ten days which had elapsed since [her]241-madame olenska return to [New York]2-new york [she]241-madame olenska had perhaps guessed from [his]3347-he silence , and from the fact of [his]3347-he making no attempt to see [her]241-madame olenska , that [he]3347-he was meditating a decisive step , a step from which there was no turning back . At the thought , a sudden fear of [her]241-madame olenska own weakness might have seized [her]241-madame olenska , and [she]241-madame olenska might have felt that , after all , it was better to accept the compromise usual in such cases , and follow the line of least resistance .

An hour earlier , when [he]3347-he had rung [Mrs. Mingott]218-mrs. lovell mingott 's bell , [Archer]215-archer had fancied that [his]3347-he path was clear before [him]3347-he . [He]3347-he had meant to have a word alone with [Madame Olenska]241-madame olenska , and failing that , to learn from [[her]241-madame olenska grandmother]834-her grandmother on what day , and by [which train]3352-which train , [she]241-madame olenska was returning to [Washington]112-washington . In [that train]3353-that train [he]3347-he intended to join [her]241-madame olenska , and travel with [her]241-madame olenska to [Washington]112-washington , or as much farther as [she]241-madame olenska was willing to go . [His]3347-he own fancy inclined to [Japan]475-japan . At any rate [she]241-madame olenska would understand at once that , wherever [she]241-madame olenska went , [he]3347-he was going . [He]3347-he meant to leave a note for [May]226-may that should cut off any other alternative .

[He]3347-he had fancied [himself]3347-he not only nerved for this plunge but eager to take it ; yet [his]3347-he first feeling on hearing that the course of events was changed had been one of relief . Now , however , as [he]3347-he walked [home]631-home from [[Mrs. Mingott]218-mrs. lovell mingott 's]3355-mrs. mingott 's , [he]3347-he was conscious of a growing distaste for what lay before [him]3347-he . There was nothing unknown or unfamiliar in the path [he]3347-he was presumably to tread ; but when [he]3347-he had trodden it before it was as [a free man]1311-a free man , who was accountable to [no one]601-no one for [his]3347-he actions , and could lend [himself]3347-he with an amused detachment to the game of precautions and prevarications , concealments and compliances , that the part required . This procedure was called " protecting [a woman]4935-a woman 's honour "[3347-he] ; and the best fiction , combined with the after - dinner talk of [[his]3347-he elders]3358-his elders , had long since initiated [him]3347-he into every detail of its code .

Now [he]3347-he saw the matter in a new light , and [his]3347-he part in it seemed singularly diminished . It was , in fact , that which , with a secret fatuity , [he]3347-he had watched [Mrs. Thorley Rushworth]243-mrs. thorley rushworth play toward [a fond and unperceiving husband]3359-a fond and unperceiving husband : a smiling , bantering , humouring , watchful and incessant lie . A lie by day , a lie by night , a lie in every touch and every look ; a lie in every caress and every quarrel ; a lie in every word and in every silence .

It was easier , and less dastardly on the whole , for [a wife]996-a wife to play such a part toward [[her]996-a wife husband]645-her husband . [A woman]4935-a woman 's standard of truthfulness was tacitly held to be lower : [she]4935-a woman was [the subject creature]3363-the subject creature , and versed in the arts of [the enslaved]3364-the enslaved . Then [she]4935-a woman could always plead moods and nerves , and the right not to be held too strictly to account ; and even in the most strait - laced societies the laugh was always against [the husband]3365-the husband .

But in [[Archer]215-archer 's little world]3366-archer 's little world [no one]601-no one laughed at [a wife]996-a wife deceived , and a certain measure of contempt was attached to [men who continued [their]3369-men who continued their philandering after marriage philandering after marriage]3369-men who continued their philandering after marriage . In the rotation of crops there was a recognised season for wild oats ; but [they]3370-they were not to be sown more than once .

[Archer]215-archer had always shared this view : in [his]3347-he heart [he]3347-he thought [Lefferts]224-lawrence lefferts despicable . But to love [Ellen Olenska]233-ellen was not to become [a man like [Lefferts]224-lawrence lefferts]3371-a man like lefferts : for the first time [Archer]215-archer found [himself]215-archer face to face with the dread argument of the individual case . [Ellen Olenska]233-ellen was like [no other woman]4673-no other woman , [he]3347-he was like [no other man]3373-no other man : [their]3374-their situation , therefore , resembled [no one else]3375-no one else 's , and [they]3374-their were answerable to no tribunal but that of [their]3374-their own judgment .

Yes , but in ten minutes more [he]3347-he would be mounting [[his]3347-he own doorstep]3376-his own doorstep ; and there were May , and habit , and honour , and all the old decencies that [he]3347-he and [[his]3347-he people]3377-his people had always believed in ...

At [his]3347-he corner [he]3347-he hesitated , and then walked on down [Fifth Avenue]18-fifth avenue .

Ahead of [him]3347-he , in the winter night , loomed [a big unlit house]3378-a big unlit house . As [he]3347-he drew near [he]3347-he thought how often [he]3347-he had seen [it]3378-a big unlit house blazing with lights , [its]3378-a big unlit house steps awninged and carpeted , and carriages waiting in double line to draw up at [the curbstone]3268-the curbstone . [It]3380-it was in [the conservatory that stretched [its]3378-a big unlit house dead - black bulk down [the side street]3382-the side street that [he]3347-he had taken [his]3347-he first kiss from [May]226-may]3381-the conservatory that stretched its dead - black bulk down the side street that he had taken his first kiss from may ; it was under the myriad candles of the ball - room that [he]3347-he had seen [her]226-may appear , tall and silver - shining as [a young Diana]3383-a young diana .

Now [the house]516-the house was as dark as [the grave]3385-the grave , except for a faint flare of gas in [the basement]1807-the basement , and a light in one [upstairs room where the blind had not been lowered]3387-upstairs room where the blind had not been lowered . As [Archer]215-archer reached the corner [he]3347-he saw that [the carriage]859-the carriage standing at the door was [Mrs. Manson Mingott]217-mrs. manson mingott 's . What an opportunity for [Sillerton Jackson]225-mr. jackson , if [he]225-mr. jackson should chance to pass ! [Archer]215-archer had been greatly moved by old [Catherine]237-old catherine 's account of [Madame Olenska]241-madame olenska 's attitude toward [Mrs. Beaufort]231-beaufort ; it made the righteous reprobation of [New York]2-new york seem like a passing by on the other side . But [he]3347-he knew well enough what construction [the clubs and drawing - rooms]3389-the clubs and drawing - rooms would put on [Ellen Olenska]233-ellen 's visits to [[her]233-ellen cousin]672-her cousin .

[He]3347-he paused and looked up at the lighted window . No doubt [the two women]894-the two women were sitting together in [that room]3392-that room : [Beaufort]231-beaufort had probably sought consolation elsewhere . There were even rumours that [he]3347-he had left [New York]2-new york with [Fanny Ring]345-miss fanny ring ; but [Mrs. Beaufort]231-beaufort 's attitude made the report seem improbable .

[Archer]215-archer had the nocturnal perspective of [Fifth Avenue]18-fifth avenue almost to [himself]215-archer . At that hour [most people]1067-most people were indoors , dressing for dinner ; and [he]3347-he was secretly glad that [Ellen]233-ellen 's exit was likely to be unobserved . As the thought passed through [his]3347-he mind the door opened , and [she]233-ellen came out . Behind [her]233-ellen was a faint light , such as might have been carried down the stairs to show [her]233-ellen the way . [She]233-ellen turned to say a word to [some one]669-some one ; then the door closed , and [she]233-ellen came down the steps .

" [Ellen]233-ellen , "[3347-he] [he]3347-he said in a low voice , as [she]233-ellen reached [the pavement]3269-the pavement .

[She]233-ellen stopped with a slight start , and just then [he]3347-he saw [two young men of fashionable cut]3396-two young men of fashionable cut approaching . There was a familiar air about [their]3396-two young men of fashionable cut overcoats and the way [their]3396-two young men of fashionable cut smart silk mufflers were folded over [their]3396-two young men of fashionable cut white ties ; and [he]3347-he wondered how youths of [their]3396-two young men of fashionable cut quality happened to be dining out so early . Then [he]3347-he remembered that [the Reggie Chiverses]285-the reggie chiverses , whose [house was a few doors above]3397-house was a few doors above , were taking a large party that evening to see [Adelaide Neilson]476-adelaide neilson in Romeo and Juliet , and guessed that [the two]778-the two were of the number . [They]3396-two young men of fashionable cut passed under a lamp , and [he]3347-he recognised [Lawrence Lefferts]224-lawrence lefferts and [a young Chivers]3399-a young chivers .

A mean desire not to have [Madame Olenska]241-madame olenska seen at [the Beauforts]814-the beauforts ' door vanished as [he]3347-he felt the penetrating warmth of [her]233-ellen hand .

" [I]3347-he shall see [you]233-ellen now -- [we]3396-two young men of fashionable cut shall be together , "[3347-he] [he]3347-he broke out , hardly knowing what [he]3347-he said .

" Ah , "[233-ellen] [she]233-ellen answered , " [Granny]244-granny has told [you]3347-he ? "[233-ellen]

While [he]3347-he watched [her]233-ellen [he]3347-he was aware that [Lefferts]224-lawrence lefferts and [Chivers]393-reggie chivers , on reaching the farther side of [the street corner]3401-the street corner , had discreetly struck away across [Fifth Avenue]18-fifth avenue . It was the kind of masculine solidarity that [he]3347-he [himself]3347-he often practised ; now [he]3347-he sickened at [their]3402-we connivance . Did [she]233-ellen really imagine that [he]3347-he and [she]233-ellen could live like this ? And if not , what else did [she]233-ellen imagine ?

" Tomorrow [I]3347-he must see [you]233-ellen -- somewhere where [we]3402-we can be alone , "[3347-he] [he]3347-he said , in a voice that sounded almost angry to [his]3347-he own ears .

[She]233-ellen wavered , and moved toward [the carriage]859-the carriage .

" But [I]233-ellen shall be at [Granny's]473-granny's -- for the present that is , "[233-ellen] [she]233-ellen added , as if conscious that [her]233-ellen change of plans required some explanation .

" Somewhere where [we]3402-we can be alone , "[3347-he] [he]3347-he insisted .

[She]233-ellen gave a faint laugh that grated on [him]3347-he .

" In [New York]2-new york ? But there are [no churches]5232-no churches ... [no monuments]5233-no monuments . "[233-ellen]

" There 's [the Art Museum]5234-the art museum -- in [the Park]179-the park , "[3347-he] [he]3347-he explained , as [she]233-ellen looked puzzled . " At half - past two . [I]233-ellen shall be at the door ... "[233-ellen]

[She]233-ellen turned away without answering and got quickly into [the carriage]859-the carriage . As [it]859-the carriage drove off [she]233-ellen leaned forward , and [he]3347-he thought [she]233-ellen waved [her]233-ellen hand in the obscurity . [He]3347-he stared after [her]233-ellen in a turmoil of contradictory feelings . It seemed to [him]3347-he that [he]3347-he had been speaking not to [the woman [he]3347-he loved]3405-the woman he loved but to another , [a woman [he]3347-he was indebted to for pleasures already wearied of]3406-a woman he was indebted to for pleasures already wearied of : it was hateful to find [himself]3347-he [the prisoner of this hackneyed vocabulary]3407-the prisoner of this hackneyed vocabulary .

" [She]3406-a woman he was indebted to for pleasures already wearied of 'll come ! "[3347-he] [he]3347-he said to [himself]3347-he , almost contemptuously .

Avoiding the popular " Wolfe collection , "[3347-he] whose anecdotic canvases filled one of [the main galleries of the queer wilderness of cast - iron and encaustic tiles known as [the Metropolitan Museum]180-the metropolitan museum]3408-the main galleries of the queer wilderness of cast - iron and encaustic tiles known as the metropolitan museum , [they]3409-they had wandered down [a passage]3410-a passage to [the room where the " Cesnola antiquities "[3347-he] mouldered in unvisited loneliness]3411-the room where the " cesnola antiquities " mouldered in unvisited loneliness .

[They]3409-they had this melancholy retreat to [themselves]3409-they , and seated on the divan enclosing the central steam - radiator , [they]3409-they were staring silently at the glass cabinets mounted in ebonised wood which contained the recovered fragments of Ilium .

" It 's odd , "[241-madame olenska] [Madame Olenska]241-madame olenska said , " [I]241-madame olenska never came [here]4019-here before . "[241-madame olenska]

" Yes , "[241-madame olenska] [she]241-madame olenska assented absently .

[She]241-madame olenska stood up and wandered across [the room]972-the room . [His]3413-he mind , as always when [they]3409-they first met , was wholly absorbed in the delicious details that made [her]241-madame olenska [herself]241-madame olenska and no other . [Its]3414-its glass shelves were crowded with small broken objects -- hardly recognisable domestic utensils , ornaments and personal trifles -- made of glass , of clay , of discoloured bronze and other time - blurred substances .

" It seems cruel , "[241-madame olenska] [she]241-madame olenska said , " that after a while nothing matters ... any more than these little things , that used to be necessary and important to [forgotten people]5237-forgotten people , and now have to be guessed at under a magnifying glass and labelled : ' Use unknown . ' "[241-madame olenska]

" Yes ; but meanwhile-- "[241-madame olenska]

[Archer]215-archer walked [home]631-home alone . [He]511-the young man sat there without conscious thoughts , without sense of the lapse of time , in a deep and grave amazement that seemed to suspend life rather than quicken it . " This was what had to be , then ... this was what had to be , "[511-the young man] [he]511-the young man kept repeating to [himself]511-the young man , as if [he]511-the young man hung in the clutch of doom . The door opened and [May]3438-may came in .

XXXII .

" At [the court of [the Tuileries]29-the tuileries]5265-the court of the tuileries , "[225-mr. jackson] said [Mr. Sillerton Jackson]225-mr. jackson with [his]225-mr. jackson reminiscent smile , " such things were pretty openly tolerated . "[225-mr. jackson]

The scene was [the van der Luydens ' black walnut dining - room in [Madison Avenue]63-madison avenue]3442-the van der luydens ' black walnut dining - room in madison avenue , and the time the evening after [Newland Archer]215-archer 's visit to [the Museum of Art]3443-the museum of art . [Mr.]3444-mr. and [Mrs. van der Luyden]296-mrs. van der luyden had come to [town]1110-town for a few days from [Skuytercliff]60-skuytercliff , whither [they]3446-they had precipitately fled at the announcement of [Beaufort]231-beaufort 's failure . It had been represented to [them]3446-they that the disarray into which society had been thrown by this deplorable affair made [their]3446-they presence in [town]1110-town more necessary than ever . It was one of the occasions when , as [Mrs. Archer]215-archer put it , [they]3446-they " owed it to [society]1426-society "[3446-they] to show [themselves]3446-they at [the Opera]26-the opera , and even to open [their]3446-they own doors .

" It will never do , [[my]3446-they dear]4004-my dear [Louisa]297-louisa , to let [people like [Mrs. Lemuel Struthers]260-mrs. struthers]5268-people like mrs. lemuel struthers think [they]5268-people like mrs. lemuel struthers can step into [Regina]467-regina 's shoes . It is just at such times that [new people]5269-new people push in and get a footing . It was owing to the epidemic of chicken - pox in [New York]2-new york the winter [Mrs. Struthers]260-mrs. struthers first appeared that [the married men]5270-the married men slipped away to [[her]260-mrs. struthers house]800-her house while [[their]5270-the married men wives]2326-their wives were in [the nursery]5273-the nursery . [You]5274-you and dear [Henry]296-mrs. van der luyden , [Louisa]297-louisa , must stand in the breach as [you]5274-you always have . "[3446-they]

[Mr.]3448-mr. and [Mrs. van der Luyden]296-mrs. van der luyden could not remain deaf to such a call , and reluctantly but heroically [they]3449-they had come to [town]1110-town , unmuffled [the house]516-the house , and sent out invitations for two dinners and an evening reception .

On this particular evening [they]3449-they had invited [Sillerton Jackson]225-mr. jackson , [Mrs. Archer]215-archer and [Newland]215-archer and [[his]3448-mr. wife]553-his wife to go with [them]3449-they to [the Opera]502-the opera , where [Faust]222-faust was being sung for the first time that winter . Nothing was done without ceremony under the [van der Luyden roof]3454-van der luyden roof , and though there were but [four guests]3455-four guests the repast had begun at seven punctually , so that the proper sequence of courses might be served without haste before [the gentlemen]965-the gentlemen settled down to [their]965-the gentlemen cigars .

[Archer]215-archer had not seen [[his]3448-mr. wife]553-his wife since the evening before . [He]3448-mr. had left early for [the office]1759-the office , where [he]3448-mr. had plunged into an accumulation of unimportant business . In the afternoon [one of [the senior partners]3460-the senior partners]3459-one of the senior partners had made an unexpected call on [his]3448-mr. time ; and [he]3448-mr. had reached [home]631-home so late that [May]226-may had preceded [him]3448-mr. to [the van der Luydens ']4162-the van der luydens ' , and sent back [the carriage]859-the carriage .

Now , across the Skuytercliff carnations and the massive plate , [she]226-may struck [him]3448-mr. as pale and languid ; but [her]226-may eyes shone , and [she]226-may talked with exaggerated animation .

The subject which had called forth [Mr. Sillerton Jackson]225-mr. jackson 's favourite allusion had been brought up ( [Archer]215-archer fancied not without intention ) by [[their]3464-their hostess]2362-their hostess . The Beaufort failure , or rather [the Beaufort]467-regina attitude since the failure , was still a fruitful theme for [the drawing - room moralist]3466-the drawing - room moralist ; and after it had been thoroughly examined and condemned [Mrs. van der Luyden]296-mrs. van der luyden had turned [her]296-mrs. van der luyden scrupulous eyes on [May Archer]427-archer .

"[213-madame nilsson]

[Archer]215-archer turned to the stage , where , in the familiar setting of giant roses and pen - wiper pansies , [the same large blonde victim]3480-the same large blonde victim was succumbing to [the same small brown seducer]3481-the same small brown seducer .

From the stage [his]302-mr. van der luyden eyes wandered to the point of the horseshoe where [May]3482-may sat between [two older ladies]3483-two older ladies , just as , on that former evening , [she]3482-may had sat between [Mrs. Lovell Mingott]218-mrs. lovell mingott and [[her]217-mrs. manson mingott newly - arrived " foreign "[3482-may] cousin]3484-her newly - arrived " foreign " cousin . As on that evening , [she]3482-may was all in white ; and [Archer]215-archer , who had not noticed what [she]3482-may wore , recognised the blue - white satin and old lace of [her]3482-may wedding dress .

It was the custom , in old [New York]2-new york , for [brides]3485-brides to appear in this costly garment during the first year or two of marriage : [[his]302-mr. van der luyden mother]512-his mother , [he]302-mr. van der luyden knew , kept [hers]3487-hers in tissue paper in the hope that [Janey]420-janey might some day wear it , though [poor [Janey]420-janey]3488-poor janey was reaching the age when [pearl grey poplin]3489-pearl grey poplin and [no bridesmaids]3490-no bridesmaids would be thought more " appropriate . "[3489-pearl grey poplin]

It struck [Archer]215-archer that [May]427-archer , since [their]3491-their return from [Europe]17-europe , had seldom worn [her]3482-may bridal satin , and the surprise of seeing [her]3482-may in it made [him]302-mr. van der luyden compare [her]3482-may appearance with that of [the young girl [he]302-mr. van der luyden had watched with such blissful anticipations two years earlier]3492-the young girl he had watched with such blissful anticipations two years earlier .

Though [May]427-archer 's outline was slightly heavier , as [her]3482-may goddesslike build had foretold , [her]3482-may athletic erectness of carriage , and the girlish transparency of [her]3482-may expression , remained unchanged : but for the slight languor that [Archer]427-archer had lately noticed in [her]3482-may [she]3482-may would have been the exact image of [the girl]539-the girl playing with the bouquet of lilies - of - [the - valley]549-the - valley on [her]3482-may betrothal evening . The fact seemed an additional appeal to [his]427-archer pity : such innocence was as moving as the trustful clasp of [a child]1378-a child . Then [he]427-archer remembered the passionate generosity latent under that incurious calm . [He]427-archer recalled [her]3482-may glance of understanding when [he]427-archer had urged that [their]3496-their engagement should be announced at the Beaufort ball ; [he]427-archer heard the voice in which [she]3482-may had said , in [the Mission garden]3439-the mission garden : " [I]3482-may could n't have [my]3482-may happiness made out of a wrong -- a wrong to [some one else]5285-some one else ; "[3482-may] and an uncontrollable longing seized [him]427-archer to tell [her]3482-may the truth , to throw [himself]427-archer on [her]3482-may generosity , and ask for the freedom [he]427-archer had once refused .

[Newland Archer]215-archer was [a quiet and self - controlled young man]3498-a quiet and self - controlled young man . Conformity to the discipline of [a small society]3499-a small society had become almost [his]427-archer second nature . It was deeply distasteful to [him]427-archer to do anything melodramatic and conspicuous , anything [Mr. van der Luyden]302-mr. van der luyden would have deprecated and the club box condemned as bad form . But [he]427-archer had become suddenly unconscious of the club box , of [Mr. van der Luyden]302-mr. van der luyden , of all that had so long enclosed [him]427-archer in the warm shelter of habit . [He]427-archer walked along the semi - circular passage at [the back of [the house]516-the house]3500-the back of the house , and opened the door of [[Mrs. van der Luyden]296-mrs. van der luyden 's box]3502-mrs. van der luyden 's box as if it had been a gate into the unknown .

" M'ama ! "[427-archer] thrilled out [the triumphant Marguerite]427-archer ; and [the occupants of the box]3503-the occupants of the box looked up in surprise at [Archer]427-archer 's entrance . [He]427-archer had already broken one of the rules of [[his]427-archer world]1584-his world , which forbade the entering of a box during a solo .

Slipping between [Mr. van der Luyden]302-mr. van der luyden and [Sillerton Jackson]225-mr. jackson , [he]427-archer leaned over [[his]427-archer wife]553-his wife .

" [I]427-archer 've got a beastly headache ; do n't tell [any one]1132-any one , but come [home]631-home , wo n't [you]553-his wife ? "[427-archer] [he]427-archer whispered .

[May]3506-may gave [him]427-archer a glance of comprehension , and [he]427-archer saw [her]3506-may whisper to [[his]427-archer mother]512-his mother , who nodded sympathetically ; then [she]3506-may murmured an excuse to [Mrs. van der Luyden]296-mrs. van der luyden , and rose from [her]3506-may seat just as [Marguerite]427-archer fell into [Faust]222-faust 's arms . [Archer]427-archer , while [he]427-archer helped [her]3506-may on with [her]3506-may Opera cloak , noticed the exchange of a significant smile between [the older ladies]3508-the older ladies .

" No -- it 's not that : do [you]553-his wife mind if [I]427-archer open the window ? "[427-archer] [he]427-archer returned confusedly , letting down the pane on [his]427-archer side . [He]427-archer sat staring out into [the street]1900-the street , feeling [[his]427-archer wife]553-his wife beside [him]427-archer as a silent watchful interrogation , and keeping [his]427-archer eyes steadily fixed on [the passing houses]3513-the passing houses . " Did [you]553-his wife hurt [yourself]553-his wife ? "[427-archer] [he]427-archer asked , steadying [her]553-his wife with [his]427-archer arm .

" No ; but [my]553-his wife poor dress -- see how [I]553-his wife 've torn it ! "[553-his wife] [she]553-his wife exclaimed . [She]553-his wife bent to gather up a mud - stained breadth , and followed [him]427-archer up the steps into [the hall]736-the hall . [The servants]715-the servants had not expected [them]715-the servants so early , and there was only a glimmer of gas on [the upper landing]3435-the upper landing .

[Archer]427-archer mounted the stairs , turned up the light , and put a match to the brackets on each side of the library mantelpiece . The curtains were drawn , and the warm friendly aspect of [the room]972-the room smote [him]427-archer like that of a familiar face met during an unavowable errand .

[He]427-archer noticed that [[his]427-archer wife]553-his wife was very pale , and asked if [he]427-archer should get [her]553-his wife some brandy .

" Oh , no , "[553-his wife] [she]553-his wife exclaimed with a momentary flush , as [she]553-his wife took off [her]553-his wife cloak . " But had n't [you]427-archer better go to bed at once ? "[553-his wife] [she]553-his wife added , as [he]427-archer opened a silver box on the table and took out a cigarette .

[Archer]427-archer threw down the cigarette and walked to [his]427-archer usual place by the fire .

" No ; [my]427-archer head is not as bad as that . "[427-archer] [He]427-archer paused . " And there 's something [I]427-archer want to say ; something important -- that [I]427-archer must tell [you]553-his wife at once . "[427-archer]

[She]553-his wife had dropped into an armchair , and raised [her]553-his wife head as [he]427-archer spoke . " Yes , [dear]3991-dear ? "[553-his wife] [she]553-his wife rejoined , so gently that [he]427-archer wondered at the lack of wonder with which [she]553-his wife received this preamble .

" May-- "[427-archer] [he]427-archer began , standing a few feet from [her]553-his wife chair , and looking over at [her]553-his wife as if the slight distance between [them]3521-them were an unbridgeable abyss . "[427-archer]

[She]553-his wife sat silent , without a movement or a tremor of [her]553-his wife lashes . [She]553-his wife was still extremely pale , but [her]553-his wife face had a curious tranquillity of expression that seemed drawn from some secret inner source .

[Archer]427-archer checked the conventional phrases of self - accusal that were crowding to [his]427-archer lips . [He]427-archer was determined to put the case baldly , without vain recrimination or excuse .

" [Madame Olenska--]241-madame olenska "[427-archer] [he]427-archer said ; but at the name [[his]427-archer wife]553-his wife raised [her]553-his wife hand as if to silence [him]427-archer . As [she]553-his wife did so the gaslight struck on the gold of [her]553-his wife wedding - ring .

" Oh , why should [we]5290-we talk about [Ellen]233-ellen tonight ? "[553-his wife] [she]553-his wife asked , with a slight pout of impatience .

" Because [I]553-his wife ought to have spoken before . "[553-his wife]

[Her]553-his wife face remained calm . " Is it really worth while , [dear]3991-dear ? [I]553-his wife know [I]553-his wife 've been unfair to [her]553-his wife at times -- perhaps [we]5290-we all have . [You]3991-dear 've understood [her]553-his wife , no doubt , better than [we]5290-we did : [you]3991-dear 've always been kind to [her]553-his wife . But what does it matter , now it 's all over ? "[553-his wife]

[Archer]427-archer looked at [her]553-his wife blankly . Could it be possible that the sense of unreality in which [he]427-archer felt [himself]427-archer imprisoned had communicated itself to [[his]427-archer wife]553-his wife ?

" All over -- what do [you]3524-may mean ? "[427-archer] [he]427-archer asked in an indistinct stammer .

[May]3524-may still looked at [him]427-archer with transparent eyes . " Why -- since [she]553-his wife 's going back to [Europe]17-europe so soon ; since [Granny]244-granny approves and understands , and has arranged to make [her]553-his wife independent of [[her]553-his wife husband--]5292-her husband-- "[3524-may]

[She]3524-may broke off , and [Archer]427-archer , grasping the corner of the mantelpiece in one convulsed hand , and steadying [himself]427-archer against it , made a vain effort to extend the same control to [his]427-archer reeling thoughts .

" [I]427-archer supposed , "[427-archer] [he]427-archer heard [[his]427-archer wife]553-his wife 's even voice go on , " that [you]3524-may had been kept at [the office]1759-the office this evening about the business arrangements . It was settled this morning , [I]427-archer believe . "[427-archer] [She]3524-may lowered [her]3524-may eyes under [his]427-archer unseeing stare , and another fugitive flush passed over [her]3524-may face .

[He]427-archer understood that [his]427-archer own eyes must be unbearable , and turning away , rested [his]427-archer elbows on the mantel - shelf and covered [his]427-archer face . Something drummed and clanged furiously in [his]427-archer ears ; [he]427-archer could not tell if it were the blood in [his]427-archer veins , or the tick of the clock on the mantel .

[May]3526-may sat without moving or speaking while the clock slowly measured out five minutes . A lump of coal fell forward in the grate , and hearing [her]3524-may rise to push it back , [Archer]427-archer at length turned and faced [her]3524-may .

" It 's impossible , "[427-archer] [he]427-archer exclaimed .

" [Impossible--]5294-impossible-- ? "[427-archer]

" [I]427-archer saw [Ellen]233-ellen yesterday -- [I]427-archer told [you]3524-may [I]427-archer 'd seen [her]233-ellen at [Granny]244-granny 's . "[427-archer]

" It was n't then that [she]244-granny told [you]427-archer ? "[427-archer]

" No ; [I]427-archer had a note from [her]244-granny this afternoon.--Do [you]3524-may want to see it ? "[427-archer]

[He]427-archer could not find [his]427-archer voice , and [she]3524-may went out of [the room]972-the room , and came back almost immediately .

" [I]3524-may thought [you]427-archer knew , "[3524-may] [she]3524-may said simply .

[She]3524-may laid a sheet of paper on the table , and [Archer]427-archer put out [his]427-archer hand and took it up . The letter contained only a few lines .

" [May dear]5295-may dear , [I]3524-may have at last made [Granny]244-granny understand that [my]3524-may visit to [her]244-granny could be no more than a visit ; and [she]244-granny has been as kind and generous as ever . " If [any of [[my]427-archer friends]4168-my friends]5297-any of my friends wish to urge [me]427-archer to change [my]427-archer mind , please tell [them]5297-any of my friends it would be utterly useless . "[427-archer]

[Archer]427-archer read the letter over two or three times ; then [he]427-archer flung it down and burst out laughing .

The sound of [his]427-archer laugh startled [him]427-archer . [It]3528-it recalled [Janey]420-janey 's midnight fright when [she]420-janey had caught [him]427-archer rocking with incomprehensible mirth over [May]427-archer 's telegram announcing that the date of [their]3529-their marriage had been advanced .

" Why did [she]420-janey write this ? "[427-archer] [he]427-archer asked , checking [his]427-archer laugh with a supreme effort .

[May]3530-may met the question with [her]3530-may unshaken candour . " [I]3530-may suppose because [we]3529-their talked things over yesterday-- "[3530-may]

" What things ? "[3530-may]

" [I]3530-may told [her]420-janey [I]3530-may was afraid [I]3530-may had n't been fair to [her]420-janey -- hadn't always understood how hard it must have been for [her]420-janey here , alone among [so many people who were relations and yet strangers]5299-so many people who were relations and yet strangers ; who felt the right to criticise , and yet did n't always know the circumstances . "[3530-may] [She]3530-may paused . " [I]3530-may knew [you]427-archer 'd been [the one friend [she]420-janey could always count on]5300-the one friend she could always count on ; and [I]3530-may wanted [her]420-janey to know that [you]427-archer and [I]3530-may were the same -- in all [our]5301-our feelings . "[3530-may]

[She]3530-may hesitated , as if waiting for [him]3531-him to speak , and then added slowly : " [She]420-janey understood [my]3530-may wishing to tell [her]420-janey this . [I]3530-may think [she]420-janey understands everything . "[3530-may]

[She]3530-may went up to [Archer]427-archer , and taking one of [his]427-archer cold hands pressed it quickly against [her]3530-may cheek .

" [My]3530-may head aches too ; good - night , [dear]3991-dear , "[3530-may] [she]3530-may said , and turned to the door , [her]3530-may torn and muddy wedding - dress dragging after [her]3530-may across [the room]972-the room .

XXXIII .

It was , as [Mrs. Archer]215-archer smilingly said to [Mrs. Welland]219-mrs. welland , a great event for [a young couple]3533-a young couple to give [their]3533-a young couple first big dinner .

[The Newland Archers]262-the archers , since [they]262-the archers had set up [[their]262-the archers household]3534-their household , had received a good deal of company in an informal way . [Archer]215-archer was fond of having [three or four friends]3535-three or four friends to dine , and [May]3536-may welcomed [them]3535-three or four friends with the beaming readiness of which [[her]3536-may mother]587-her mother had set [her]3536-may the example in conjugal affairs . [[Her]3536-may husband]645-her husband questioned whether , if left to [herself]3536-may , [she]3536-may would ever have asked [any one]1132-any one to [the house]516-the house ; but [he]645-her husband had long given up trying to disengage [[her]3536-may real self]3541-her real self from the shape into which tradition and training had moulded [her]3536-may . It was expected that [well - off young couples in [New York]2-new york]3542-well - off young couples in new york should do a good deal of informal entertaining , and [a Welland]3543-a welland married to [an Archer]3544-an archer was doubly pledged to the tradition .

But a big dinner , with [a hired chef]3545-a hired chef and [two borrowed footmen]3546-two borrowed footmen , with Roman punch , roses from [Henderson]480-henderson 's , and menus on gilt - edged cards , was a different affair , and not to be lightly undertaken . As [Mrs. Archer]215-archer remarked , the Roman punch made all the difference ; not in itself but by its manifold implications -- since it signified either canvas - backs or terrapin , two soups , a hot and a cold sweet , full decolletage with short sleeves , and [guests of a proportionate importance]3547-guests of a proportionate importance .

It was always an interesting occasion when [a young pair]3548-a young pair launched [their]3548-a young pair first invitations in [the third person]3549-the third person , and [their]3548-a young pair summons was seldom refused even by [the seasoned and sought - after]3550-the seasoned and sought - after . Still , it was admittedly a triumph that [the van der Luydens]275-the van der luydens , at [May]427-archer 's request , should have stayed over in order to be present at [her]3536-may farewell dinner for [the Countess Olenska]235-the countess olenska .

[The two mothers - in - law]3551-the two mothers - in - law sat in [[May]427-archer 's drawing - room]1337-may 's drawing - room on the afternoon of the great day , [Mrs. Archer]215-archer writing out the menus on [Tiffany]481-tiffany 's thickest gilt - edged bristol , while [Mrs. Welland]219-mrs. welland superintended the placing of the palms and standard lamps .

[Archer]427-archer , arriving late from [[his]427-archer office]2915-his office , found them still there . [Mrs. Archer]215-archer had turned [her]215-archer attention to the name - cards for the table , and [Mrs. Welland]219-mrs. welland was considering the effect of bringing forward the large gilt sofa , so that another " corner "[427-archer] might be created between the piano and the window .

[May]427-archer , [they]3551-the two mothers - in - law told [him]427-archer , was in [the dining - room]3554-the dining - room inspecting the mound of Jacqueminot roses and maidenhair in the centre of the long table , and the placing of the Maillard bonbons in openwork silver baskets between the candelabra . On the piano stood a large basket of orchids which [Mr. van der Luyden]302-mr. van der luyden had had sent from [Skuytercliff]60-skuytercliff . Everything was , in short , as it should be on the approach of so considerable an event .

[Mrs. Archer]215-archer ran thoughtfully over the list , checking off each name with [her]215-archer sharp gold pen .

" [Henry van der Luyden]302-mr. van der luyden -- [Louisa]297-louisa -- [the Lovell Mingotts]227-the mingotts -- [the Reggie Chiverses]1043-the reggie chiverses -- [Lawrence Lefferts]224-lawrence lefferts and [Gertrude--(yes]5304-gertrude--(yes , [I]215-archer suppose [May]427-archer was right to have [them)--the Selfridge Merrys]282-the selfridge merrys , [Sillerton Jackson]225-mr. jackson , [Van Newland]482-van newland and [[his]482-van newland wife]553-his wife . ( How time passes ! It seems only yesterday that [he]482-van newland was [[your]219-mrs. welland best man]5306-your best man , [Newland)--and Countess Olenska]483-the countess olenska -- yes , [I]215-archer think that 's all .... "[215-archer]

[Mrs. Welland]219-mrs. welland surveyed [[her]219-mrs. welland son - in - law]2677-her son - in - law affectionately . " [No one]601-no one can say , [Newland]482-van newland , that [you]482-van newland and [May]427-archer are not giving [Ellen]233-ellen a handsome send - off . "[219-mrs. welland]

" Ah , well , "[215-archer] said [Mrs. Archer]215-archer , " [I]215-archer understand [May]427-archer 's wanting [[her]219-mrs. welland cousin]672-her cousin to tell [people abroad]5309-people abroad that [we]5310-we 're not quite barbarians . "[215-archer]

" [I]219-mrs. welland 'm sure [Ellen]233-ellen will appreciate it . [She]233-ellen was to arrive this morning , [I]219-mrs. welland believe . It will make a most charming last impression . The evening before sailing is usually so dreary , "[219-mrs. welland] [Mrs. Welland]219-mrs. welland cheerfully continued .

[Archer]427-archer turned toward the door , and [[his]427-archer mother - in - law]3136-his mother - in - law called to [him]427-archer : " Do go in and have a peep at the table . And do n't let May tire [herself]233-ellen too much . "[427-archer] But [he]427-archer affected not to hear , and sprang up the stairs to [[his]427-archer library]1353-his library . [The room]972-the room looked at [him]427-archer like an alien countenance composed into a polite grimace ; and [he]427-archer perceived that it had been ruthlessly " tidied , "[427-archer] and prepared , by a judicious distribution of ash - trays and cedar - wood boxes , for [the gentlemen]965-the gentlemen to smoke in .

" Ah , well , "[427-archer] [he]427-archer thought , " it 's not for long-- "[427-archer] and [he]427-archer went on to [[his]427-archer dressing - room]3560-his dressing - room .

Ten days had passed since [Madame Olenska]241-madame olenska 's departure from [New York]2-new york . During those ten days [Archer]427-archer had had no sign from [her]241-madame olenska but that conveyed by the return of a key wrapped in tissue paper , and sent to [[his]427-archer office]2915-his office in a sealed envelope addressed in [her]241-madame olenska hand . This retort to [his]427-archer last appeal might have been interpreted as a classic move in a familiar game ; but [the young man]511-the young man chose to give it a different meaning . [She]241-madame olenska was still fighting against [her]241-madame olenska fate ; but [she]241-madame olenska was going to [Europe]17-europe , and [she]241-madame olenska was not returning to [[her]241-madame olenska husband]645-her husband . Nothing , therefore , was to prevent [his]427-archer following [her]241-madame olenska ; and once [he]427-archer had taken the irrevocable step , and had proved to [her]241-madame olenska that it was irrevocable , [he]427-archer believed [she]241-madame olenska would not send [him]427-archer away .

This confidence in the future had steadied [him]427-archer to play [his]427-archer part in the present . It had kept [him]427-archer from writing to [her]241-madame olenska , or betraying , by any sign or act , [his]427-archer misery and mortification . It seemed to [him]427-archer that in the deadly silent game between [them]3564-them the trumps were still in [his]427-archer hands ; and [he]427-archer waited .

There had been , nevertheless , moments sufficiently difficult to pass ; as when [Mr. Letterblair]353-mr. letterblair , the day after [Madame Olenska]241-madame olenska 's departure , had sent for [him]427-archer to go over the details of the trust which [Mrs. Manson Mingott]217-mrs. manson mingott wished to create for [[her]217-mrs. manson mingott granddaughter]3565-her granddaughter . For a couple of hours [Archer]427-archer had examined the terms of the deed with [[his]427-archer senior]1530-his senior , all the while obscurely feeling that if [he]427-archer had been consulted it was for some reason other than the obvious one of [[his]427-archer cousinship]3567-his cousinship ; and that the close of the conference would reveal it .

" Well , [the lady]663-the lady ca n't deny that it 's a handsome arrangement , "[353-mr. letterblair] [Mr. Letterblair]353-mr. letterblair had summed up , after mumbling over a summary of the settlement . " In fact [I]353-mr. letterblair 'm bound to say [she]663-the lady 's been treated pretty handsomely all round . "[353-mr. letterblair]

" All round ? "[427-archer] [Archer]427-archer echoed with a touch of derision . " Do [you]353-mr. letterblair refer to [[her]663-the lady husband]645-her husband 's proposal to give [her]663-the lady back [her]663-the lady own money ? "[427-archer]

[Mr. Letterblair]353-mr. letterblair 's bushy eyebrows went up a fraction of an inch . " [[My]353-mr. letterblair dear sir]5313-my dear sir , the law 's the law ; and [[your]5313-my dear sir wife 's cousin]5314-your wife 's cousin was married under the French law . It 's to be presumed [she]663-the lady knew what that meant . "[353-mr. letterblair]

" Even if [she]663-the lady did , what happened subsequently-- . "[427-archer] But [Archer]427-archer paused . [Mr. Letterblair]353-mr. letterblair had laid [his]353-mr. letterblair pen - handle against [his]353-mr. letterblair big corrugated nose , and was looking down it with the expression assumed by [virtuous elderly gentlemen]3568-virtuous elderly gentlemen when [they]3568-virtuous elderly gentlemen wish [[their]3568-virtuous elderly gentlemen youngers]3569-their youngers to understand that virtue is not synonymous with ignorance .

" [[My]353-mr. letterblair dear sir]5313-my dear sir , [I]353-mr. letterblair 've no wish to extenuate [the Count]1491-the count 's transgressions ; but -- but on the other side ... [I]353-mr. letterblair would n't put [my]353-mr. letterblair hand in the fire ... well , that there had n't been tit for tat ... with [the young champion]665-the young champion .... "[353-mr. letterblair] [Mr. Letterblair]353-mr. letterblair unlocked a drawer and pushed a folded paper toward [Archer]427-archer . " This report , the result of discreet enquiries ... "[1648-the lawyer] And then , as [Archer]427-archer made no effort to glance at the paper or to repudiate the suggestion , [the lawyer]1648-the lawyer somewhat flatly continued : " [I]1648-the lawyer do n't say it 's conclusive , [you]427-archer observe ; far from it . But straws show ... and on the whole it 's eminently satisfactory for all parties that this dignified solution has been reached . "[1648-the lawyer]

" Oh , eminently , "[427-archer] [Archer]427-archer assented , pushing back the paper .

A day or two later , on responding to a summons from [Mrs. Manson Mingott]217-mrs. manson mingott , [his]427-archer soul had been more deeply tried .

[He]427-archer had found [the old lady]3973-the old lady depressed and querulous .

" [You]427-archer know [she]3973-the old lady 's deserted [me]3973-the old lady ? "[3973-the old lady] [she]3973-the old lady began at once ; and without waiting for [his]427-archer reply : " Oh , do n't ask [me]3973-the old lady why ! [She]3973-the old lady gave so many reasons that [I]3973-the old lady 've forgotten them all . [My]3973-the old lady private belief is that [she]3973-the old lady could n't face the boredom . At any rate that 's what [Augusta]274-augusta and [[my]3973-the old lady daughters - in - law]5318-my daughters - in - law think . And [I]3973-the old lady do n't know that [I]3973-the old lady altogether blame [her]3973-the old lady . [Olenski]278-count olenski 's [a finished scoundrel]5319-a finished scoundrel ; but life with [him]278-count olenski must have been a good deal gayer than it is in [Fifth Avenue]18-fifth avenue . Not that [the family]532-the family would admit that : [they]532-the family think [Fifth Avenue]18-fifth avenue is [Heaven]182-heaven with [the rue de la Paix]4230-the rue de la paix thrown in . And poor [Ellen]233-ellen , of course , has no idea of going back to [[her]233-ellen husband]645-her husband . [She]233-ellen held out as firmly as ever against that . So [she]233-ellen 's to settle down in [Paris]7-paris with [that fool Medora]5323-that fool medora .... Well , [Paris]7-paris is [Paris]7-paris ; and [you]5324-you can keep [a carriage]5325-a carriage [there]713-there on next to nothing . But [she]5323-that fool medora was as gay as a bird , and [I]3973-the old lady shall miss [her]5323-that fool medora . "[3973-the old lady] Two tears , the parched tears of the old , rolled down [her]3572-her puffy cheeks and vanished in the abysses of [her]3572-her bosom .

" All [I]3572-her ask is , "[3572-her] [she]3572-her concluded , " that [they]5327-they should n't bother [me]3572-her any more . [I]3572-her must really be allowed to digest [my]3572-her gruel .... "[3572-her] And [she]3572-her twinkled a little wistfully at [Archer]427-archer .

It was that evening , on [his]427-archer return [home]631-home , that [May]427-archer announced [her]3572-her intention of giving a farewell dinner to [[her]3572-her cousin]672-her cousin . [Madame Olenska]241-madame olenska 's name had not been pronounced between [them]3575-them since the night of [her]3572-her flight to [Washington]112-washington ; and [Archer]427-archer looked at [[his]427-archer wife]553-his wife with surprise .

" A dinner -- why ? "[427-archer] [he]427-archer interrogated .

[Her]3572-her colour rose . " But [you]427-archer like [Ellen]233-ellen -- [I]3572-her thought [you]427-archer 'd be pleased . "[3572-her]

" It 's awfully nice -- [your]427-archer putting it in that way . But [I]3572-her really do n't see-- "[3572-her]

" [I]3572-her mean to do it , [Newland]215-archer , "[3572-her] [she]3572-her said , quietly rising and going to [her]3572-her desk . " Here are the invitations all written . [Mother]348-mother helped [me]3572-her -- [she]348-mother agrees that [we]5328-we ought to . "[3572-her] [She]3572-her paused , embarrassed and yet smiling , and [Archer]427-archer suddenly saw before [him]427-archer the embodied image of [the Family]532-the family .

" Oh , all right , "[427-archer] [he]427-archer said , staring with unseeing eyes at the list of guests that [she]3572-her had put in [his]427-archer hand .

When [he]427-archer entered [the drawing - room]964-the drawing - room before dinner [May]3579-may was stooping over the fire and trying to coax the logs to burn in their unaccustomed setting of immaculate tiles .

The tall lamps were all lit , and [Mr. van der Luyden]302-mr. van der luyden 's orchids had been conspicuously disposed in various receptacles of modern porcelain and knobby silver . [[Mrs. Newland Archer]215-archer 's drawing - room]3580-mrs. newland archer 's drawing - room was generally thought a great success . [A gilt bamboo jardiniere]3581-a gilt bamboo jardiniere , in which the primulas and cinerarias were punctually renewed , blocked the access to the bay window ( where the old - fashioned would have preferred a bronze reduction of the Venus of Milo ) ; the sofas and arm - chairs of pale brocade were cleverly grouped about little plush tables densely covered with silver toys , porcelain animals and efflorescent photograph frames ; and tall rosy - shaded lamps shot up like tropical flowers among the palms .

" [I]427-archer do n't think [Ellen]233-ellen has ever seen [this room]5329-this room lighted up , "[427-archer] said [May]427-archer , rising flushed from [her]3572-her struggle , and sending about [her]3572-her a glance of pardonable pride . The brass tongs which [she]3572-her had propped against the side of the chimney fell with a crash that drowned [[her]3572-her husband]645-her husband 's answer ; and before [he]427-archer could restore them [Mr.]3583-mr. and [Mrs. van der Luyden]296-mrs. van der luyden were announced .

[The other guests]3584-the other guests quickly followed , for it was known that [the van der Luydens]275-the van der luydens liked to dine punctually . [The room]972-the room was nearly full , and [Archer]427-archer was engaged in showing to [Mrs. Selfridge]419-mrs. selfridge merry Merry a small highly - varnished Verbeckhoven " Study of Sheep , "[335-mr. welland] which [Mr. Welland]335-mr. welland had given [May]427-archer for Christmas , when [he]427-archer found [Madame Olenska]241-madame olenska at [his]427-archer side .

[She]241-madame olenska was excessively pale , and [her]241-madame olenska pallor made [her]241-madame olenska dark hair seem denser and heavier than ever . Perhaps that , or the fact that [she]241-madame olenska had wound several rows of amber beads about [her]241-madame olenska neck , reminded [him]427-archer suddenly of the little [Ellen Mingott]261-ellen [he]427-archer had danced with at [children]3979-children 's parties , when [Medora Manson]230-medora manson had first brought [her]241-madame olenska to [New York]2-new york .

The amber beads were trying to [her]241-madame olenska complexion , or [her]241-madame olenska dress was perhaps unbecoming : [her]241-madame olenska face looked lustreless and almost ugly , and [he]427-archer had never loved it as [he]427-archer did at that minute . [Their]3587-their hands met , and [he]427-archer thought [he]427-archer heard [her]241-madame olenska say : " Yes , [we]3587-their 're sailing tomorrow in the [Russia--]215-archer "[241-madame olenska] ; then there was an unmeaning noise of opening doors , and after an interval [May]427-archer 's voice : " [Newland]215-archer ! Dinner 's been announced . Wo n't [you]427-archer please take [Ellen]261-ellen in ? "[427-archer]

[Madame Olenska]241-madame olenska put [her]241-madame olenska hand on [his]427-archer arm , and [he]427-archer noticed that the hand was ungloved , and remembered how [he]427-archer had kept [his]427-archer eyes fixed on it the evening that [he]427-archer had sat with [her]241-madame olenska in [the little Twenty - third Street drawing - room]3588-the little twenty - third street drawing - room . All the beauty that had forsaken [her]241-madame olenska face seemed to have taken refuge in the long pale fingers and faintly dimpled knuckles on [his]427-archer sleeve , and [he]427-archer said to [himself]427-archer : " If it were only to see [her]241-madame olenska hand again [I]427-archer should have to follow [her--]5330-her-- . "[427-archer]

It was only at an entertainment ostensibly offered to [a " foreign visitor]5331-a " foreign visitor "[427-archer] that [Mrs. van der Luyden]296-mrs. van der luyden could suffer the diminution of being placed on [[her]296-mrs. van der luyden host]3589-her host 's left . The fact of [Madame Olenska]241-madame olenska 's " foreignness "[241-madame olenska] could hardly have been more adroitly emphasised than by this farewell tribute ; and [Mrs. van der Luyden]296-mrs. van der luyden accepted [her]241-madame olenska displacement with an affability which left no doubt as to [her]241-madame olenska approval . There were certain things that had to be done , and if done at all , done handsomely and thoroughly ; and one of these , in the old [New York]2-new york code , was the tribal rally around [a kinswoman]3590-a kinswoman about to be eliminated from [the tribe]3591-the tribe . There was nothing on [earth that]3592-earth that [the Wellands]321-the wellands and [Mingotts]227-the mingotts would not have done to proclaim [their]3593-their unalterable affection for [the Countess Olenska]483-the countess olenska now that [her]483-the countess olenska passage for [Europe]17-europe was engaged ; and [Archer]427-archer , at the head of [his]427-archer table , sat marvelling at the silent untiring activity with which [her]483-the countess olenska popularity had been retrieved , grievances against [her]483-the countess olenska silenced , [her]483-the countess olenska past countenanced , and [her]483-the countess olenska present irradiated by the family approval . [Mrs. van der Luyden]296-mrs. van der luyden shone on [her]483-the countess olenska with the dim benevolence which was [her]483-the countess olenska nearest approach to cordiality , and [Mr. van der Luyden]302-mr. van der luyden , from [his]302-mr. van der luyden seat at [May]427-archer 's right , cast down the table glances plainly intended to justify all the carnations [he]302-mr. van der luyden had sent from [Skuytercliff]60-skuytercliff .

[Archer]427-archer , who seemed to be assisting at the scene in a state of odd imponderability , as if [he]427-archer floated somewhere between chandelier and ceiling , wondered at nothing so much as [his]427-archer own share in the proceedings . As [his]427-archer glance travelled from one placid well - fed face to another [he]427-archer saw [all the harmless - looking people]3594-all the harmless - looking people engaged upon [May]427-archer 's canvas - backs as a band of [dumb conspirators]3595-dumb conspirators , and [himself]427-archer and [the pale woman on [his]427-archer right]3596-the pale woman on his right as the centre of [their]3597-their conspiracy . And then it came over [him]427-archer , in a vast flash made up of many broken gleams , that to all of [them]3597-their [he]427-archer and [Madame Olenska]241-madame olenska were [lovers]826-lovers , [lovers in the extreme sense peculiar to " foreign "[3599-lovers in the extreme sense peculiar to " foreign " vocabularies] vocabularies]3599-lovers in the extreme sense peculiar to " foreign " vocabularies . [He]427-archer guessed [himself]427-archer to have been , for months , the centre of [countless silently observing eyes and patiently listening ears]3600-countless silently observing eyes and patiently listening ears ; [he]427-archer understood that , by means as yet unknown to [him]427-archer , the separation between [himself]427-archer and [the partner]3601-the partner of [his]427-archer guilt had been achieved , and that now [the whole tribe]3602-the whole tribe had rallied about [[his]427-archer wife]553-his wife on the tacit assumption that [nobody]3966-nobody knew anything , or had ever imagined anything , and that the occasion of the entertainment was simply [May Archer]427-archer 's natural desire to take an affectionate leave of [[her]553-his wife friend]3605-her friend and [cousin]3606-cousin .

It was the old [New York]2-new york way of taking life " without effusion of blood "[5332-people who dreaded scandal more than disease , who placed decency above courage , and who considered that nothing was more ill - bred than " scenes , "] : the way of [people who dreaded scandal more than disease , who placed decency above courage , and who considered that nothing was more ill - bred than " scenes , "]5332-people who dreaded scandal more than disease , who placed decency above courage , and who considered that nothing was more ill - bred than " scenes , "[5332-people who dreaded scandal more than disease , who placed decency above courage , and who considered that nothing was more ill - bred than " scenes , "] except the behaviour of [those who gave rise to them]3607-those who gave rise to them .

As these thoughts succeeded each other in [his]427-archer mind [Archer]427-archer felt like [a prisoner in the centre of [an armed camp]3609-an armed camp]3608-a prisoner in the centre of an armed camp . [He]427-archer looked about the table , and guessed at the inexorableness of [[his]427-archer captors]3610-his captors from the tone in which , over the asparagus from [Florida]94-florida , [they]3610-his captors were dealing with [Beaufort]231-beaufort and [[his]427-archer wife]553-his wife . " It 's to show [me]427-archer , "[427-archer] [he]427-archer thought , " what would happen to [ME--]427-archer "[427-archer] and a deathly sense of the superiority of implication and analogy over direct action , and of silence over rash words , closed in on [him]427-archer like the doors of [the family vault]1406-the family vault .

[He]427-archer laughed , and met [Mrs. van der Luyden]296-mrs. van der luyden 's startled eyes .

" [You]427-archer think it laughable ? "[296-mrs. van der luyden] [she]296-mrs. van der luyden said with a pinched smile . " Of course poor [Regina]467-regina 's idea of remaining in [New York]2-new york has its ridiculous side , [I]296-mrs. van der luyden suppose ; "[296-mrs. van der luyden] and [Archer]427-archer muttered : " Of course . "[427-archer]

At this point , [he]427-archer became conscious that [[Madame Olenska]241-madame olenska 's other neighbour]3613-madame olenska 's other neighbour had been engaged for some time with [the lady on [his]427-archer right]3614-the lady on his right . At the same moment [he]427-archer saw that [May]427-archer , serenely enthroned between [Mr. van der Luyden]302-mr. van der luyden and [Mr. Selfridge Merry]484-mr. selfridge merry , had cast a quick glance down the table . It was evident that [the host]3615-the host and [the lady on]3616-the lady on [his]427-archer right could not sit through the whole meal in silence . [He]427-archer turned to [Madame Olenska]241-madame olenska , and [her]241-madame olenska pale smile met [him]427-archer . " Oh , do let 's see it through , "[241-madame olenska] it seemed to say .

" Did [you]241-madame olenska find the journey tiring ? "[427-archer] [he]427-archer asked in a voice that surprised [him]427-archer by its naturalness ; and [she]241-madame olenska answered that , on the contrary , [she]241-madame olenska had seldom travelled with fewer discomforts .

" Except , [you]427-archer know , the dreadful heat in [the train]2232-the train , "[241-madame olenska] [she]241-madame olenska added ; and [he]427-archer remarked that [she]241-madame olenska would not suffer from that particular hardship in [the country [she]241-madame olenska was going to]3617-the country she was going to .

" [I]427-archer never , "[427-archer] [he]427-archer declared with intensity , " was more nearly frozen than once , in April , in the train between [Calais]184-calais and [Paris]7-paris . "[427-archer]

[She]241-madame olenska said [she]241-madame olenska did not wonder , but remarked that , after all , [one]503-one could always carry an extra rug , and that every form of travel had its hardships ; to which [he]427-archer abruptly returned that [he]427-archer thought them all of no account compared with the blessedness of getting away . [She]241-madame olenska changed colour , and [he]427-archer added , [his]427-archer voice suddenly rising in pitch : " [I]427-archer mean to do a lot of travelling [myself]427-archer before long . "[427-archer] A tremor crossed [her]241-madame olenska face , and leaning over to [Reggie Chivers]393-reggie chivers , [he]427-archer cried out : " [I]427-archer say , [Reggie]393-reggie chivers , what do [you]393-reggie chivers say to a trip round [the world]561-the world : now , next month , [I]427-archer mean ? [I]427-archer 'm game if [you]393-reggie chivers are-- "[427-archer] at which [Mrs. Reggie]393-reggie chivers piped up that [she]393-reggie chivers could not think of letting [Reggie]393-reggie chivers go till after the Martha Washington Ball [she]393-reggie chivers was getting up for [the Blind Asylum]3619-the blind asylum in Easter week ; and [[her]393-reggie chivers husband]645-her husband placidly observed that by that time [he]645-her husband would have to be practising for the International Polo match .

But [Mr. Selfridge Merry]484-mr. selfridge merry had caught the phrase " round [the world]561-the world , "[484-mr. selfridge merry] and having once circled the globe in [[his]484-mr. selfridge merry steam - yacht]3621-his steam - yacht , [he]484-mr. selfridge merry seized the opportunity to send down the table several striking items concerning the shallowness of [the Mediterranean ports]3622-the mediterranean ports . Though , after all , [he]484-mr. selfridge merry added , it did n't matter ; for when [you]3623-you 'd seen [Athens]185-athens and [Smyrna]186-smyrna and [Constantinople]187-constantinople , what else was there ? And [Mrs. Merry]419-mrs. selfridge merry said [she]419-mrs. selfridge merry could never be too grateful to [Dr. Bencomb]450-dr. bencomb for having made [them]3624-them promise not to go to [Naples]188-naples on account of the fever .

" But [you]3623-you must have three weeks to do [India]189-india properly , "[645-her husband] [[her]419-mrs. selfridge merry husband]645-her husband conceded , anxious to have it understood that [he]484-mr. selfridge merry was [no frivolous globe - trotter]3626-no frivolous globe - trotter .

And at this point [the ladies]735-the ladies went up to [the drawing - room]964-the drawing - room .

In [the library]750-the library , in spite of weightier presences , [Lawrence Lefferts]224-lawrence lefferts predominated .

The talk , as usual , had veered around to [the Beauforts]247-the beauforts , and even [Mr. van der Luyden]302-mr. van der luyden and [Mr. Selfridge Merry]484-mr. selfridge merry , installed in the honorary arm - chairs tacitly reserved for [them]3624-them , paused to listen to [the younger man]3630-the younger man 's philippic .

Never had [Lefferts]224-lawrence lefferts so abounded in the sentiments that adorn Christian manhood and exalt the sanctity of [the home]3631-the home . Indignation lent [him]224-lawrence lefferts a scathing eloquence , and it was clear that if [others]1554-others had followed [his]224-lawrence lefferts example , and acted as [he]224-lawrence lefferts talked , society would never have been weak enough to receive [a foreign upstart like [Beaufort]467-regina]3633-a foreign upstart like beaufort -- no , [sir]4062-sir , not even if [he]224-lawrence lefferts 'd married [a van der [Luyden]485-dallas or [a Lanning]3635-a lanning instead of [a Dallas]3636-a dallas]485-dallas . If society chose to open [its]3640-its doors to [vulgar women]3641-vulgar women the harm was not great , though the gain was doubtful ; but once it got in the way of tolerating [men of obscure origin and tainted wealth]3642-men of obscure origin and tainted wealth the end was total disintegration -- and at no distant date .

" If things go on at this pace , "[224-lawrence lefferts] [Lefferts]224-lawrence lefferts thundered , looking like [a young prophet dressed by Poole]3643-a young prophet dressed by poole , and who had not yet been stoned , " [we]5336-we shall see [[our]5336-we children]5337-our children fighting for invitations to [[swindlers]5338-swindlers ' houses]5339-swindlers ' houses , and marrying [[Beaufort]231-beaufort 's bastards]5340-beaufort 's bastards . "[224-lawrence lefferts]

" Oh , [I]393-reggie chivers say -- draw it mild ! " Has [he]302-mr. van der luyden got any ? "[225-mr. jackson] cried [Mr. Sillerton Jackson]225-mr. jackson , pricking up [his]225-mr. jackson ears ; and while [Lefferts]224-lawrence lefferts tried to turn the question with a laugh , [the old gentleman]3022-the old gentleman twittered into [Archer]215-archer 's ear : " [Queer]5341-queer , [those fellows who are always wanting to set things right]5342-those fellows who are always wanting to set things right . "[3022-the old gentleman]

The talk swept past [Archer]215-archer like some senseless river running and running because it did not know enough to stop . [He]3645-he saw , on the faces about [him]3645-he , expressions of interest , amusement and even mirth . [He]3645-he listened to [the younger men]659-the younger men 's laughter , and to the praise of the Archer Madeira , which [Mr. van der Luyden]302-mr. van der luyden and [Mr. Merry]484-mr. selfridge merry were thoughtfully celebrating . Through it all [he]3645-he was dimly aware of a general attitude of friendliness toward [himself]3645-he , as if [the guard of [the prisoner [he]3645-he felt [himself]3645-he to be]3648-the prisoner he felt himself to be]3647-the guard of the prisoner he felt himself to be were trying to soften [his]3645-he captivity ; and the perception increased [his]3645-he passionate determination to be free .

In [the drawing - room]964-the drawing - room , where [they]3650-they presently joined [the ladies]735-the ladies , [he]3645-he met [May]427-archer 's triumphant eyes , and read in [them]3652-them the conviction that everything had " gone off "[3652-them] beautifully . [She]3653-she rose from [Madame Olenska]241-madame olenska 's side , and immediately [Mrs. van der Luyden]296-mrs. van der luyden beckoned [the latter]574-the latter to a seat on the gilt sofa where [she]3653-she throned . [Mrs. Selfridge Merry]419-mrs. selfridge merry bore across [the room]972-the room to join [them]3650-they , and it became clear to [Archer]427-archer that here also a conspiracy of rehabilitation and obliteration was going on . The silent organisation which held [[his]427-archer little world]3656-his little world together was determined to put itself on record as never for a moment having questioned the propriety of [Madame Olenska]241-madame olenska 's conduct , or the completeness of [Archer]427-archer 's domestic felicity . [All these amiable and inexorable persons]3657-all these amiable and inexorable persons were resolutely engaged in pretending to each other that [they]3657-all these amiable and inexorable persons had never heard of , suspected , or even conceived possible , the least hint to the contrary ; and from this tissue of elaborate mutual dissimulation [Archer]427-archer once more disengaged the fact that [New York]464-old new york believed [him]3645-he to be [[Madame Olenska]241-madame olenska 's lover]3658-madame olenska 's lover . [He]427-archer caught the glitter of victory in [[his]427-archer wife]553-his wife 's eyes , and for the first time understood that [she]553-his wife shared the belief . The discovery roused a laughter of inner devils that reverberated through all [his]427-archer efforts to discuss the [Martha Washington]242-martha ball with [Mrs. Reggie Chivers]393-reggie chivers and [little Mrs. Newland]215-archer ; and so the evening swept on , running and running like [a senseless river]3660-a senseless river that did not know how to stop .

At length [he]427-archer saw that [Madame Olenska]241-madame olenska had risen and was saying good - bye . [He]427-archer understood that in a moment [she]241-madame olenska would be gone , and tried to remember what [he]427-archer had said to [her]241-madame olenska at dinner ; but [he]427-archer could not recall a single word [they]3661-they had exchanged .

[She]241-madame olenska went up to [May]427-archer , [the rest of [the company]2516-the company]2515-the rest of the company making a circle about [her]241-madame olenska as [she]241-madame olenska advanced . [The two young women]3664-the two young women clasped hands ; then [May]3665-may bent forward and kissed [[her]3665-may cousin]672-her cousin .

" Certainly [[our]3661-they hostess]5346-our hostess is much [the handsomer of [the two]778-the two]5347-the handsomer of the two , "[393-reggie chivers] [Archer]427-archer heard [Reggie Chivers]393-reggie chivers say in an undertone to [young Mrs. Newland]215-archer ; and [he]427-archer remembered [Beaufort]467-regina 's coarse sneer at [May]427-archer 's ineffectual beauty .

A moment later [he]427-archer was in [the hall]736-the hall , putting [Madame Olenska]241-madame olenska 's cloak about [her]241-madame olenska shoulders .

Through all [his]427-archer confusion of mind [he]427-archer had held fast to the resolve to say nothing that might startle or disturb [her]241-madame olenska . Convinced that no power could now turn [him]427-archer from [his]427-archer purpose [he]427-archer had found strength to let events shape themselves as they would . But as [he]427-archer followed [Madame Olenska]241-madame olenska into [the hall]736-the hall [he]427-archer thought with a sudden hunger of being for a moment alone with [her]241-madame olenska at the door of [[her]241-madame olenska carriage]1427-her carriage .

"[296-mrs. van der luyden]

As [he]427-archer went up [the steps]3671-the steps [he]427-archer crossed [Lawrence Lefferts]224-lawrence lefferts coming down with [[his]224-lawrence lefferts wife]553-his wife . " It DID go off beautifully , did n't it ? "[3674-may] [May]3674-may questioned from the threshold of [the library]750-the library .

[Archer]427-archer roused [himself]427-archer with a start . But there [she]553-his wife stood , pale and drawn , yet radiating the factitious energy of [one who has passed beyond fatigue]3680-one who has passed beyond fatigue .

" May [I]553-his wife come and talk it over ? "[553-his wife] [she]553-his wife asked .

" Very well , "[427-archer] [he]427-archer said , pushing [her]553-his wife chair near the fire .

[She]553-his wife sat down and [he]427-archer resumed [his]427-archer seat ; but [neither]1129-neither spoke for a long time . At length [Archer]427-archer began abruptly : " Since [you]553-his wife 're not tired , and want to talk , there 's something [I]427-archer must tell [you]553-his wife . [I]427-archer tried to the other night-- . "[427-archer]

[She]553-his wife looked at [him]427-archer quickly . " Yes , [dear]3991-dear . Something about [yourself]427-archer ? "[553-his wife]

" About [myself]427-archer . [You]427-archer say [you]427-archer 're not tired : well , [I]427-archer am . Horribly tired ... "[427-archer]

In an instant [she]553-his wife was all tender anxiety . " Oh , [I]553-his wife 've seen it coming on , [Newland]215-archer ! [You]215-archer 've been so wickedly overworked-- "[553-his wife]

" Perhaps it 's that . Anyhow , [I]427-archer want to make a break-- "[427-archer]

" A break ? To give up the law ? "[553-his wife]

" To go away , at any rate -- at once . On a long trip , ever so far off -- away from everything-- "[427-archer]

[He]427-archer paused , conscious that [he]427-archer had failed in [his]427-archer attempt to speak with the indifference of [a man who longs for a change , and is yet too weary to welcome it]3682-a man who longs for a change , and is yet too weary to welcome it . Do what [he]427-archer would , the chord of eagerness vibrated . " Away from everything-- "[427-archer] [he]427-archer repeated .

" Ever so far ? Where , for instance ? "[553-his wife] [she]553-his wife asked .

" Oh , [I]427-archer do n't know . [India]189-india -- or [Japan]475-japan . "[427-archer]

[She]553-his wife stood up , and as [he]427-archer sat with bent head , [his]427-archer chin propped on [his]427-archer hands , [he]427-archer felt [her]553-his wife warmly and fragrantly hovering over [him]427-archer .

" As far as that ? But [I]553-his wife 'm afraid [you]427-archer ca n't , [dear]3991-dear ... "[553-his wife] [she]553-his wife said in an unsteady voice . " Not unless [you]427-archer 'll take [me]553-his wife with [you]427-archer . "[553-his wife] And then , as [he]427-archer was silent , [she]553-his wife went on , in tones so clear and evenly - pitched that each separate syllable tapped like a little hammer on [his]427-archer brain : " That is , if [the doctors]4488-the doctors will let [me]553-his wife go ... but [I]553-his wife 'm afraid [they]4488-the doctors wo n't . [He]427-archer looked up at [her]553-his wife with a sick stare , and [she]553-his wife sank down , all dew and roses , and hid [her]553-his wife face against [his]427-archer knee .

" Oh , [[my]427-archer dear]4004-my dear , "[427-archer] [he]427-archer said , holding [her]553-his wife to [him]427-archer while [his]427-archer cold hand stroked [her]553-his wife hair .

There was a long pause , which [the inner devils]3683-the inner devils filled with strident laughter ; then [May]3684-may freed [herself]3684-may from [his]427-archer arms and stood up .

" [You]553-his wife did n't guess-- ? "[3683-the inner devils]

" Yes -- [I]3683-the inner devils ; no . That is , of course [I]3683-the inner devils hoped-- "[3683-the inner devils]

[They]3685-they looked at [each other]558-each other for an instant and again fell silent ; then , turning [his]427-archer eyes from [hers]553-his wife , [he]427-archer asked abruptly : " Have [you]553-his wife told [any one else]565-any one else ? "[427-archer]

" Only [Mamma]245-mamma and [[your]3683-the inner devils mother]4580-your mother . "[553-his wife] [She]553-his wife paused , and then added hurriedly , the blood flushing up to [her]553-his wife forehead : " That is -- and [Ellen]261-ellen .
