" Ah-- "[427-archer] said [Archer]427-archer , [his]427-archer heart stopping .

[He]427-archer felt that [[his]427-archer wife]553-his wife was watching [him]427-archer intently . " Did [you]427-archer MIND [my]427-archer telling [her]261-ellen first , [Newland]215-archer ? "[427-archer]

" Mind ? Why should [I]427-archer ? "[427-archer] [He]427-archer made a last effort to collect [himself]427-archer . " But that was a fortnight ago , was n't it ? [I]427-archer thought [you]427-archer said [you]427-archer were n't sure till today . "[427-archer]

[Her]553-his wife colour burned deeper , but [she]553-his wife held [his]427-archer gaze . " No ; [I]553-his wife was n't sure then -- but [I]553-his wife told [her]261-ellen [I]553-his wife was . And [you]427-archer see [I]553-his wife was right ! "[553-his wife] [she]553-his wife exclaimed , [her]553-his wife blue eyes wet with victory .

XXXIV .

[Newland]215-archer [Archer]427-archer sat at the writing - table in [[his]427-archer library in [East Thirty - ninth Street]77-east thirty - ninth street]3688-his library in east thirty - ninth street .

[He]427-archer had just got back from a big official reception for the inauguration of [the new galleries at [the Metropolitan Museum]180-the metropolitan museum]3689-the new galleries at the metropolitan museum , and the spectacle of [those great spaces]3690-those great spaces crowded with the spoils of the ages , where the throng of fashion circulated through a series of scientifically catalogued treasures , had suddenly pressed on a rusted spring of memory .

" Why , this used to be [one of [the old Cesnola rooms]5363-the old cesnola rooms]5362-one of the old cesnola rooms , "[669-some one] [he]427-archer heard [some one]669-some one say ; and instantly everything about [him]427-archer vanished , and [he]427-archer was sitting alone on a hard leather divan against a radiator , while [a slight figure in a long sealskin cloak]3692-a slight figure in a long sealskin cloak moved away down the meagrely - fitted vista of [the old Museum]3693-the old museum .

The vision had roused a host of other associations , and [he]427-archer sat looking with new eyes at [the library]750-the library which , for over thirty years , had been the scene of [his]427-archer solitary musings and of all the family confabulations .

It was [the room in which most of the real things of [his]427-archer life had happened]3695-the room in which most of the real things of his life had happened . There [[his]427-archer wife]553-his wife , nearly twenty - six years ago , had broken to [him]427-archer , with a blushing circumlocution that would have caused [the young women of the new generation]3697-the young women of the new generation to smile , the news that [she]553-his wife was to have [a child]1378-a child ; and there [[their]3699-their eldest boy]3700-their eldest boy , [Dallas]485-dallas , too delicate to be taken to [church]1398-church in midwinter , had been christened by [[their]3699-their old friend [the Bishop of [New York]2-new york]3703-the bishop of new york , [the ample magnificent irreplaceable Bishop]3704-the ample magnificent irreplaceable bishop , so long the pride and ornament of [[his]3703-the bishop of new york diocese]3705-his diocese]3702-their old friend the bishop of new york , the ample magnificent irreplaceable bishop , so long the pride and ornament of his diocese . There [Dallas]485-dallas had first staggered across the floor shouting " [Dad]5364-dad , "[485-dallas] while [May]427-archer and [the nurse]3706-the nurse laughed behind the door ; there [[their]3699-their second child]3707-their second child , [Mary]307-mary ( who was so like [[her]307-mary mother]587-her mother ) , had announced [her]307-mary engagement to [the dullest and most reliable of [[Reggie Chivers]393-reggie chivers 's many sons]3710-reggie chivers 's many sons]3709-the dullest and most reliable of reggie chivers 's many sons ; and there [Archer]427-archer had kissed [her]307-mary through [her]307-mary wedding veil before [they]3699-their went down to the motor which was to carry [them]3699-their to [Grace Church]99-grace church -- for in a world where all else had reeled on [its]3711-its foundations the " Grace Church wedding "[3714-his young brother] remained an unchanged institution .

It was in [the library]750-the library that [he]427-archer and [May]427-archer had always discussed the future of [the children]4406-the children : the studies of [Dallas]485-dallas and [[his]485-dallas young brother]3714-his young brother [Bill]486-bill , [Mary]307-mary 's incurable indifference to " accomplishments , "[3714-his young brother] and passion for sport and philanthropy , and the vague leanings toward " art "[3714-his young brother] which had finally landed the restless and curious [Dallas]485-dallas in the office of [a rising New York architect]3715-a rising new york architect .

[The young men]3716-the young men nowadays were emancipating [themselves]3716-the young men from the law and business and taking up all sorts of new things . If [they]3716-the young men were not absorbed in state politics or municipal reform , the chances were that [they]3716-the young men were going in for Central American archaeology , for architecture or landscape - engineering ; taking a keen and learned interest in [the prerevolutionary buildings of [[their]3716-the young men own country]3718-their own country]3717-the prerevolutionary buildings of their own country , studying and adapting Georgian types , and protesting at the meaningless use of the word " Colonial . "[3966-nobody] [Nobody]3966-nobody nowadays had " [Colonial "[3720-the millionaire grocers of the suburbs] houses]5365-colonial " houses except [the millionaire grocers of [the suburbs]3721-the suburbs]3720-the millionaire grocers of the suburbs .

But above all -- sometimes [Archer]427-archer put it above all -- it was in [that library]3722-that library that [the Governor of [New York]2-new york]3723-the governor of new york , coming down from [Albany]11-albany one evening to dine and spend the night , had turned to [[his]3723-the governor of new york host]1278-his host , and said , banging [his]3723-the governor of new york clenched fist on the table and gnashing [his]3723-the governor of new york eye - glasses : " Hang [the professional politician]5366-the professional politician ! [You]427-archer 're [the kind of man [the country]1743-the country]5367-the kind of man the country wants , [Archer]427-archer . If [the stable]5369-the stable 's ever to be cleaned out , [[men]848-men like [you]427-archer]5371-men like you have got to lend a hand in the cleaning . "[3723-the governor of new york]

" Men like [you--]427-archer "[427-archer] how [Archer]427-archer had glowed at the phrase ! How eagerly [he]427-archer had risen up at the call ! It was an echo of [Ned Winsett]323-winsett 's old appeal to roll [his]323-winsett sleeves up and get down into the muck ; but spoken by [a man who set the example of the gesture]3725-a man who set the example of the gesture , and whose summons to follow [him]323-winsett was irresistible .

[Archer]427-archer , as [he]427-archer looked back , was not sure that [men like [himself]427-archer]3726-men like himself WERE what [[his]427-archer country]3727-his country needed , at least in the active service to which [Theodore Roosevelt]487-theodore roosevelt had pointed ; in fact , there was reason to think it did not , for after a year in [the State Assembly]191-the state assembly [he]427-archer had not been re - elected , and had dropped back thankfully into obscure if useful municipal work , and from that again to the writing of occasional articles in one of the reforming weeklies that were trying to shake [the country]1743-the country out of its apathy . It was little enough to look back on ; but when [he]427-archer remembered to what [the young men of [his]427-archer generation]3729-the young men of his generation and [his]427-archer set had looked forward -- the narrow groove of money - making , sport and society to which [their]3729-the young men of his generation vision had been limited -- even [his]427-archer small contribution to the new state of things seemed to count , as each brick counts in a well - built wall . [He]427-archer had done little in public life ; [he]427-archer would always be by nature [a contemplative and a dilettante]3730-a contemplative and a dilettante ; but [he]427-archer had had high things to contemplate , great things to delight in ; and [one great man]3731-one great man 's friendship to be [his]427-archer strength and pride .

[He]427-archer had been , in short , what [people]619-people were beginning to call " [a good citizen]5372-a good citizen . "[427-archer] In [New York]2-new york , for many years past , every new movement , philanthropic , municipal or artistic , had taken account of [his]427-archer opinion and wanted [his]427-archer name . [People]619-people said : " Ask [Archer]427-archer "[619-people] when there was a question of starting [the first school for [crippled children]3735-crippled children]3734-the first school for crippled children , reorganising [the Museum of Art]3443-the museum of art , founding [the Grolier Club]3737-the grolier club , inaugurating [the new Library]3738-the new library , or getting up [a new society of chamber music]3739-a new society of chamber music . [His]427-archer days were full , and they were filled decently . [He]427-archer supposed it was all [a man]914-a man ought to ask .

Something [he]427-archer knew [he]427-archer had missed : the flower of life . But [he]427-archer thought of it now as a thing so unattainable and improbable that to have repined would have been like despairing because [one]503-one had not drawn the first prize in a lottery . There were a hundred million tickets in [HIS]427-archer lottery , and there was only one prize ; the chances had been too decidedly against [him]427-archer . When [he]427-archer thought of [Ellen Olenska]233-ellen it was abstractly , serenely , as [one]503-one might think of some imaginary beloved in a book or a picture : [she]233-ellen had become the composite vision of all that [he]427-archer had missed . That vision , faint and tenuous as it was , had kept [him]427-archer from thinking of [other women]3743-other women . [He]427-archer had been what was called [a faithful husband]3744-a faithful husband ; and when [May]427-archer had suddenly died -- carried off by the infectious pneumonia through which [she]233-ellen had nursed [[their]3745-their youngest child]3746-their youngest child -- [he]427-archer had honestly mourned [her]233-ellen . [Their]3745-their long years together had shown [him]427-archer that it did not so much matter if marriage was a dull duty , as long as it kept the dignity of a duty : lapsing from that , it became a mere battle of ugly appetites . Looking about [him]427-archer , [he]427-archer honoured [his]427-archer own past , and mourned for it . After all , there was good in the old ways .

[His]427-archer eyes , making the round of [the room]972-the room -- done over by [Dallas]485-dallas with English mezzotints , Chippendale cabinets , bits of chosen blue - and - white and pleasantly shaded electric lamps -- came back to the old [Eastlake]192-eastlake writing - table that [he]427-archer had never been willing to banish , and to [his]427-archer first photograph of [May]427-archer , which still kept its place beside [his]427-archer inkstand .

There [she]233-ellen was , tall , round - bosomed and willowy , in [her]233-ellen starched muslin and flapping Leghorn , as [he]427-archer had seen [her]233-ellen under the orange - trees in [the Mission garden]3439-the mission garden . And as [he]427-archer had seen [her]233-ellen that day , so [she]233-ellen had remained ; never quite at the same height , yet never far below it : generous , faithful , unwearied ; but so lacking in imagination , so incapable of growth , that [the world]561-the world of [her]233-ellen youth had fallen into pieces and rebuilt itself without [her]233-ellen ever being conscious of the change . This hard bright blindness had kept [her]233-ellen immediate horizon apparently unaltered . [Her]233-ellen incapacity to recognise change made [[her]233-ellen children]707-her children conceal [their]707-her children views from [her]233-ellen as [Archer]427-archer concealed [his]427-archer ; there had been , from the first , a joint pretence of sameness , a kind of innocent family hypocrisy , in which [father]3751-father and [children]3979-children had unconsciously collaborated . And [she]233-ellen had died thinking [the world]561-the world a good place , full of [loving and harmonious households like [her]233-ellen own]3754-loving and harmonious households like her own , and resigned to leave [it]561-the world because [she]233-ellen was convinced that , whatever happened , [Newland]215-archer would continue to inculcate in [Dallas]485-dallas the same principles and prejudices which had shaped [[his]427-archer parents]3755-his parents ' lives , and that [Dallas]485-dallas in turn ( when [Newland]215-archer followed [her]233-ellen ) would transmit the sacred trust to [little Bill]486-bill . And of [Mary]307-mary [she]307-mary was sure as of [her]307-mary own self . [Opposite May]488-opposite may 's portrait stood one of [[her]215-archer daughter]534-her daughter . [Mary Chivers]489-mary chivers was as tall and fair as [[her]489-mary chivers mother]587-her mother , but large - waisted , flat - chested and slightly slouching , as the altered fashion required . [Mary Chivers]489-mary chivers 's mighty feats of athleticism could not have been performed with the twenty - inch waist that [May Archer]427-archer 's azure sash so easily spanned . And the difference seemed symbolic ; [the mother]941-the mother 's life had been as closely girt as [her]941-the mother figure . [Mary]489-mary chivers , who was no less conventional , and no more intelligent , yet led a larger life and held more tolerant views . There was good in the new order too .

Now , as [he]427-archer reviewed [his]427-archer past , [he]427-archer saw into what a deep rut [he]427-archer had sunk . The worst of doing one 's duty was that it apparently unfitted [one]503-one for doing anything else . At least that was the view that [the men of [[his]427-archer generation]3797-his generation had taken]3796-the men of his generation had taken . The trenchant divisions between right and wrong , honest and dishonest , respectable and the reverse , had left so little scope for the unforeseen . There are moments when [a man]914-a man 's imagination , so easily subdued to what it lives in , suddenly rises above its daily level , and surveys the long windings of destiny . " No . [I]485-dallas forgot . [You]427-archer never did ask [each other]558-each other anything , did [you]427-archer ? And [you]427-archer never told [each other]558-each other anything . [Archer]427-archer did not accompany [[his]427-archer son]3837-his son to [Versailles]203-versailles . [He]427-archer preferred to spend the afternoon in solitary roamings through [Paris]7-paris . [He]427-archer had to deal all at once with the packed regrets and stifled memories of an inarticulate lifetime .

After a little while [he]427-archer did not regret [Dallas]485-dallas 's indiscretion . It seemed to take an iron band from [his]427-archer heart to know that , after all , [some one]669-some one had guessed and pitied [....]3871-.... And that it should have been [[his]427-archer wife]553-his wife moved [him]427-archer indescribably . [Dallas]485-dallas , for all [his]485-dallas affectionate insight , would not have understood that . To [the boy]1711-the boy , no doubt , the episode was only a pathetic instance of vain frustration , of wasted forces . But was it really no more ? For a long time [Archer]427-archer sat on a bench in [the Champs Elysees]3874-the champs elysees and wondered , while the stream of life rolled by ....

[A few streets away]3875-a few streets away , a few hours away , [Ellen Olenska]233-ellen waited . [She]233-ellen had never gone back to [[her]233-ellen husband]645-her husband , and when [he]645-her husband had died , some years before , [she]233-ellen had made no change in [her]233-ellen way of living . There was nothing now to keep [her]233-ellen and [Archer]427-archer apart -- and that afternoon [he]427-archer was to see [her]233-ellen .

[He]427-archer got up and walked across [the Place de la Concorde]3877-the place de la concorde and [the Tuileries gardens]3878-the tuileries gardens to [the Louvre]204-the louvre . [She]233-ellen had once told [him]427-archer that [she]233-ellen often went [there]713-there , and [he]427-archer had a fancy to spend the intervening time in [a place where [he]427-archer could think of [her]233-ellen as perhaps having lately been]3880-a place where he could think of her as perhaps having lately been . For an hour or more [he]427-archer wandered from [gallery]3881-gallery to [gallery]3881-gallery through the dazzle of afternoon light , and one by one the pictures burst on [him]427-archer in their half - forgotten splendour , filling [his]427-archer soul with the long echoes of beauty . After all , [his]427-archer life had been too starved ....

Suddenly , before [an effulgent Titian]3883-an effulgent titian , [he]427-archer found [himself]427-archer saying : " But [I]427-archer 'm only fifty - seven-- "[427-archer] and then [he]427-archer turned away . For such summer dreams it was too late ; but surely not for a quiet harvest of friendship , of comradeship , in the blessed hush of [her]233-ellen nearness .

[He]427-archer went back to [the hotel]4898-the hotel , where [he]427-archer and [Dallas]485-dallas were to meet ; and together [they]3885-they walked again across [the Place de la Concorde]205-the place de la concorde and over [the bridge that leads to [the Chamber of Deputies]3887-the chamber of deputies]3886-the bridge that leads to the chamber of deputies .

[Dallas]485-dallas , unconscious of what was going on in [[his]485-dallas father]2392-his father 's mind , was talking excitedly and abundantly of [Versailles]203-versailles . [He]427-archer had had but one previous glimpse of it , during a holiday trip in which [he]427-archer had tried to pack all the sights [he]427-archer had been deprived of when [he]427-archer had had to go with [the family]532-the family to [Switzerland]125-switzerland ; and tumultuous enthusiasm and cock - sure criticism tripped each other up on [his]427-archer lips .

As [Archer]427-archer listened , [his]427-archer sense of inadequacy and inexpressiveness increased . [The boy]1711-the boy was not insensitive , [he]427-archer knew ; but [he]1711-the boy had the facility and self - confidence that came of looking at fate not as [a master]3891-a master but as [an equal]3892-an equal . " That 's it : [they]5420-they feel equal to things -- [they]5420-they know [their]5420-they way about , "[427-archer] [he]427-archer mused , thinking of [[his]427-archer son]3837-his son as [the spokesman of the new generation which had swept away all the old landmarks , and with [them]3895-them the sign - posts and the danger - signal]3894-the spokesman of the new generation which had swept away all the old landmarks , and with them the sign - posts and the danger - signal .

[Suddenly Dallas]485-dallas stopped short , grasping [[his]1711-the boy father]2392-his father 's arm . " Oh , by [Jove]206-jove , "[1711-the boy] [he]1711-the boy exclaimed .

[They]3897-they had come out into [the great tree - planted space before [the Invalides]207-the invalides]3898-the great tree - planted space before the invalides . [The dome of [Mansart]208-mansart]3899-the dome of mansart floated ethereally above the budding trees and the long grey front of [the building]3900-the building : drawing up into itself all the rays of afternoon light , it hung there like the visible symbol of the race 's glory .

[Archer]427-archer knew that [Madame Olenska]241-madame olenska lived in [a square near [one of the avenues radiating from [the Invalides]207-the invalides]3902-one of the avenues radiating from the invalides]3901-a square near one of the avenues radiating from the invalides ; and [he]427-archer had pictured [the quarter]3903-the quarter as quiet and almost obscure , forgetting the central splendour that lit [it]3903-the quarter up . Now , by some queer process of association , that golden light became for [him]427-archer the pervading illumination in which [she]241-madame olenska lived . For nearly thirty years , [her]241-madame olenska life -- of which [he]427-archer knew so strangely little -- had been spent in this rich atmosphere that [he]427-archer already felt to be too dense and yet too stimulating for [his]427-archer lungs . [He]427-archer thought of [the theatres [she]241-madame olenska must have been to]3904-the theatres she must have been to , the pictures [she]241-madame olenska must have looked at , [the sober and splendid old houses [she]241-madame olenska must have frequented]3905-the sober and splendid old houses she must have frequented , [the people [she]241-madame olenska must have talked with]3906-the people she must have talked with , the incessant stir of ideas , curiosities , images and associations thrown out by [an intensely social race in a setting of immemorial manners]3907-an intensely social race in a setting of immemorial manners ; and suddenly [he]427-archer remembered [the young Frenchman who had once said to [him]427-archer]3908-the young frenchman who had once said to him : " Ah , good conversation -- there is nothing like it , is there ? "[3908-the young frenchman who had once said to him]

[Archer]427-archer had not seen [M. More than half a lifetime divided [them]3909-they , and [she]241-madame olenska had spent the long interval among [[people]619-people [he]427-archer did not know]3911-people he did not know , in [a society [he]427-archer but faintly guessed at , in conditions [he]427-archer would never wholly understand]3912-a society he but faintly guessed at , in conditions he would never wholly understand . [They]3909-they had crossed [the Place des Invalides]3914-the place des invalides , and were walking down [one of the thoroughfares flanking [the building]3900-the building]3915-one of the thoroughfares flanking the building . The day was fading into a soft sun - shot haze , pricked here and there by a yellow electric light , and [passers]3922-passers were rare in [the little square into which [they]3909-they had turned]3923-the little square into which they had turned . [Dallas]485-dallas stopped again , and looked up .

" It must be here , "[485-dallas] [he]485-dallas said , slipping [his]485-dallas arm through [[his]485-dallas father]2392-his father 's with a movement from which [Archer]427-archer 's shyness did not shrink ; and [they]3909-they stood together looking up at [the house]516-the house .

[It]516-the house was [a modern building]3926-a modern building , without distinctive character , but many - windowed , and pleasantly balconied up [its]516-the house wide cream - coloured front . On one of the upper balconies , which hung well above the rounded tops of the horse - chestnuts in [the square]3927-the square , the awnings were still lowered , as though the sun had just left it .

" [I]485-dallas wonder which floor-- ? " [I]3837-his son say , [you]427-archer know , it 's nearly six , "[3837-his son] [[his]427-archer son]3837-his son at length reminded [him]427-archer .

" It 's more real to [me]2392-his father here than if [I]2392-his father went up , "[2392-his father] [he]2392-his father suddenly heard [himself]2392-his father say ; and the fear lest that last shadow of reality should lose its edge kept [him]2392-his father rooted to [his]2392-his father seat as the minutes succeeded each other .

[He]2392-his father sat for a long time on the bench in the thickening dusk , [his]2392-his father eyes never turning from [the balcony]3948-the balcony . At that , as if it had been the signal [he]2392-his father waited for , [Newland Archer]215-archer got up slowly and walked back alone to [[his]2392-his father hotel]3951-his hotel .
